111312.content:
The bell signalling the end of another class period rang out and many students instantly flooded the halls. A few were rushing to get to their lockers while others merely went to class. A member of the first category was Twilight, hurrying along with her backpack slung over her shoulders. Quickly passing by the sea of people, Twilight found herself in front of her locker. She turned the combination with no trouble and opened the door. On top of her math book, strangely enough, was a small note. It had clearly been shoved through the small openings in the locker as it was bent slightly. As Twilight grabbed her things and walked off, she worked on opening the letter.

Dear Twilight,
I am sorry I had to do this, but I knew you would turn me down face to face. I need to meet you in the chemistry lab after school PRIVATELY. I cannot stress that one word enough. I will know if you skip out on me and I will know if you bring your 'friends.'
Sincerely,
Someone cheated out of what they deserve.
"Well...." Twilight thought as she looked over the letter for the third time, "I can't say I'm not curious. But who could have made this?" Judging by the way this was written and how seemingly dark it was, Twilight had a bad feeling this was no friend of hers. Then again....Pinkie often had weirder ways to get attention. The question was bubbling in her if she should get her friends on this or follow the letter....to the letter.
111312.title: She is merely waiting for her chance to strike

choices: TimeSkip - Twilight Faces her Mystery Writer
Follow Twilight into Chemistry
1113122.content:
Considering how much time she had left before the next class, Twilight decided to send forward a mass text to her friends just in case something should go awry. Whipping out her cellular phone, she began to tap away at the screen, quickly hammering out a brief message.

Girls
Got weird note to meet someone after school
Will be at chemistry lab
If not out in 1 hour, come running
~Twilight

With the message sent, Twilight fetched the next set of textbooks she needed and sighed, trying to mentally prepare herself for whatever was going to face her in that lab.

"Gosh, why does it always seem like every time I come to visit this dimension, there's always someone or something that has to eat up my time like this? First evil Sunset, then the Dazzlings and now this! Ugh, next time, I'll make my visit a surprise." With a final huff, Twilight made her way down the halls of the school in hopes that perhaps Chemistry would put her mind to peace.
1113122.title: Relay the Message, Prepare for the Conflict

choices: After school, no awsner

11131222.content:
Chemistry, whether dealing with human ways of solving or own ways, it was always a subject that fastenated her. Hopefully it would be just the thing to help calm her down despite the room being a part of her problem. Of course none of her friends were in this class with her so she couldn't discuss the note with them. She stepped into the classroom bright-eyed nonetheless. "Ah Twilight." The teacher said, her face obscured by a clipboard. "I hope you don't mind, but it seems you're gonna have a new partner at your table. They aren't here yet but they will be soon." As the bell signalling the start of class rang, the teacher pointed to some flasks carrying a blue substance. "Alright class, we will continue where we left off in our studies. Now be very careful with these mixtures......" Knowing what the teacher wanted done, Twilight went right to work.

"Excuse me? Excuse?" Twilight looked up from the flasks....and stared. "Um...I was told to sit here, do you mind if..." Twilight shook her head and moved slightly, never taking her eyes off the girl. The hair...those eyes....that binder with the equal marks....there was no denying. Making sure she wasn't watched, Twilight pulled her phone under the table and texted Pinkie.
What do you know about a girl named Starlight Glimmer?

1113122221.content:
As Twilight clicked send, she instantly felt a pang of regret. If there could be copies of her friends and(according to what she heard) herself, they why could there not be another...her? As Twilight walked to the chemistry room, her mind raced back to a few months before.

Twilight looked back and forth between the clock. "Hmmm..where could she be?" She looked at the megar meal for two before her. Starlight never missed dinner with her. She had sent Spike to fetch her, but he had yet to return. Just as Twilight was about to get up, the sound of a screaming dragon echoed through the halls. Twilight had become a master noe at detecting where sounds came from in her castle and followed them.
Starlight's room was a mess, pages torn, the walls were marked with either equal marks or 'lies', and worst of all, Starlight was nowhere in sight.

Twilight pushed on the door, halfway locked in her memories. With only a few steps in, the door closed and locked behind her. Looking forward, a figure could be seen in the darkness of the unlit room. "Hello Twilight." Wanting to take an easy route on this, Twilight spoke as if this was possibly this world's Glimmer. "Oh right, from chemist..." A light came on, with an enraged Glimmer standing in it. "Don't act like you don't know who I am little miss 'princess of friendship."
Well...there was no deny what Glimmer this was.
"Why did you leave me Glimmer? How did you even find out about this place?" The girl sneered, "With a kind heart like hour's gullibility is quite a trait. I never forgot the humiliation you gave me in both my downfalls, especially my first! Did you honestly think a little 'If...then' story would stop me? No. You've made me see things your way, now you'll see them in mine!"
1113122221.title: Twilight risks venturing to meet her former stu...

choices: The two roll into a puddle of blue liquid

11131222212.content:
"That still doesn't explain how you got here, or what has snapped inside you!"

"Ha! You don't think I didn't make use of all we had in that castle? Once I gleaned off of Spike the truth of your little portal mirror, I knew it would be the perfect place to plot my revenge and lure you in once you came back!" Starlight sneered with contempt.

"Starlight, you saw what was to become of Equestria should something happen to the fates of the Bearers of the Elements! What makes you think it would be any different should you fight me here? If anything, our powers are practically neutralized in this dimension!" Twilight fired back, her temper beginning to boil.

"That won't stop me! I'll do whatever it takes to ensure you understand my dreams of equality! Now, have at you!" Starlight barked before tackling Twilight, the two resorting to fisticuffs as they wrestled about the floor. As their melee persisted, their battling bodies began to knock into the tables and science equipment about them, fluids and cheicals tipping wildly and some spilling across the tables and floor.
11131222212.title: If Words Worked Once...

111312222122.content: Starlight pushed Twilight back, having just barely enough strength to topple her. The other worldly princess trip on a backpack and fell down, letting Glimmer pull off her plan. Grabbing a vial of the blue liquid from today, Glimmer chuckled. "I don't suppose you happen to know why the teacher said to be careful with this stuff? Of course not, unequal people like you only care about finishing so you get the praise." As Twilight tried to pick herself up, she found herself being splashed with the blue concoction. With no way to defend herself, all Twilight could do was watch. With one last rush, Glimmer pushed Twilight back again. This time she landed in a puddle of a few of the other blue vials. Glimmer stood triumphantly over her fallen former teacher. "As I said, you made me see the extreme of your argument. Soon, you'll understand why equality is a must for friendship." Twilight attempted to pull herself up, but her eyes fell upon her 'arms' as they called them. There had been a little serum spilled on them, yet they were colored like they were coated in the blue stuff. Taking a look at herself, Twilight's entire body seemed to fall under that same category. "In a few moments, you're going to be so different and unusual that even your so-called friends won't help but mock and laugh." Twilight smiled, though it faltered as she felt her stomach bluging out. "You're wrong Glimmer, you clearly have a lot to learn about how friendship works." We'll see Twilight, we'll see how difference is noting to smile about."

1113122221221.content:
"You really haven't changed, have you?" Twilight spoke between her gritted teeth as a strange and sudden pressure enveloped her abdomen. Clutching it tightly, she could begin to feel a fluid pouring into her stomach and slosh about.

"What reason did I have to change? I could read you like the books that lined your shelves nd all I had to do was seem like I had. I would have thought a Princess who'd saved the land a few times could have seen a wolf in sheep's clothing, but then again, you're not much of a princess, are you?" Starlight jabbed as one of her hands came down and fiercely poked Twilight square int he gut. The princess grimaced and let loose a small yelp of frustration and pain.

"Ha! You're so soft, sitting on that cushion of power of yours! Not to mention, that cushion beneath you," Starlight sneered as Twilight's butt began to rapidly expand outwards, pushing her up off the ground.

"At least I'm not a coward and a backstabber!" Twilight countered, pointing a finger at Starlight as her arm took on liquid.

"Bah! I'm the one who'll save our world from itself! And you? You'll be nothing but a giant blue toy for me to have my way with!" Starlight barked back, slapping Twilight's extended gut.

But it didn't really help when her body hit another pang of swelling. This time, she could hear the juice sloshing in her body as it kept growing. Chuckling evil, Glimmer took a second to grab ahold of Twilight's stomach. "No tickets and no lines! Just the way I like a water bed...or juice bed." Glimmer got on top of Twilight, who was surprised she was able to hold the girl. Twilight's just kept growing, her clothes already looking like they were gonna have a tear. "They won't be able to help you know." Twilight's focused back to the girl using her belly like a pillow, "What?" "An hour is quite a long time to wait. By that time you'll be able to take a quarter of the room. Shame you won't grow larger, but it won't matter." Twilight could feel her limbs slowly growing and yet being cover by her round body. "As I said, they won't help but laugh. They'll mock you for your differences. You'll think it's playful, but it'll hurt. Only then will you see what I mean." Glimmer bounced on Twilight's belly, which was like a liquid trampoline. Twilight couldn't help but laugh, she was always ticklish there in human form. "Well as much fun as it is..." Glimmer said as she slid off, "I'm gonna hide, I'll be back after your 'friends' leave without you."

With more laughing and sloshing. The round Twilight began involuntarily moving again. Every few seconds were precious windows for Glimmer as she now wiggled in a specific direction. 11131222212211112.content:
Having finally come down from her fit of laughter and realized her former student had abandoned her once more, Twilight was left to grow and simmer over what exactly had just happened. As her thoughts floated about in piecing together the puzzle, the school clocked chimed for the top of the hour and with a fearsome shudder and thrashing against the door, each of Twilight's friends burst through the doorway, harsh grimaces adorning their faces.

"Backup has arrived!" Dash shouted as her eyes darted around the dark room.

"Looks like we're late for whatever scuffle happened here," Applejack noted, stiffening her guard as she began to better observe the room about them.

""Well, whatever happened, they left some giant ball for us to use!" Pinkie cheered as she leaped upon the berry, eliciting a few shouts of protest. Pinkie jumped off and ducked behind AJ as the girls slowly approached the source of the sound.

"Ooww...don't do that Pinkie, I'm super full!" Twilight whined as her friends gathered around their friend's head.

"Golly Twilight...what happen'd to y'all?" AJ whispered as she poked her friend's body.

"Ugh, it was Starlight! She hit me with some sort of chemical and that transformed me into some kind of giant blueberry! She's under some delusion of humiliating me for the sake of equality. Long sotry short, I've gotta get back to normal and stop Starlight before she wrecks havoc on our worlds with her crazy equality ideals."

111312222122111121.content:
Twilight's expression turned from worry and annoyance to simply worry. "I have no clue how to get this stuff out! Since I can't use magic here I can't do that. Plus I still have no clue if this stuff is somehow self generating or what! I might just be stuck here like this!"
That's when the thoughts came to her head...the thought of everyone here seeing her like this. Everyone pointing and laughing because of this, she could practically hear the laughing.....
"Twi?....Twilight?" Applejack waved her hand in front of her friend's face, pulling her from her thoughts. "Sorry AJ...I guess I lost myself there." "Ya must have, cause ah know ya didn't hear math plan." Twilight now smiled, ready to do whatever it takes to stop this and Glimmer. AJ walked around Twilight's large blue frame, giving a few slight pokes. "What we seem to have here is a case of a lotta juice and no way out. May family had some juicing equipment and some other things that might stop this. We just get ya to the farm and get the juice outta her." Rainbow took a step forward. "Nice idea AJ, but how are we even gonna get Twilight out of the room let alone to Sweet Apple Acres? I mean...just look at her! No offense." "None taken." Twilight said, though somewhere inside her there was a tiny pang of hurt.

"Until then," Pinkie said as she came back over to the berry's side, "...why don't we enjoy ourselves. Hey Twiley, still ticklish in the stomach?" Considering her stomach was now most of her physical body, Twilight couldn't stop what was gonna happen. As Pinkie's touches began outing giggles from her mouth, Twilight noticed something.

choices: Pinkie Nods, she simply has to agree
Pinkie refutes this, holding back her true feelings
1113122221221111222.content:
Her eyes glanced over each of her human friends, their faces filled with something beyond their outward expression, something troubling in their eyes. The warm glean and spark in each of them was somehow...more adrift? No, that wasn't the word she was seeking...cold? That seemed to better suit what she had observed, but even tat seemed to only cut a minor indent into the depth of what had disappeared from them. But that missing fragment, that is what chilled her to her core. For in the loss of that fragment, the warmth and cheer of their relationships, the very foundation of what had driven them together, was feeling more and more estranged. And despite their own form of magic, even Pinkie's tickles couldn't stop the very edges of her smile to wane in confusion and pain.

The fingers came to an abrupt halt, their desires for laughter and mirth taken aback with haste from the micro-sense of displeasure. Pinkie's face contorted, a deep-seated and unusual frown replacing her typical and brilliant smile. She drew close to Twilight, cupping a hand to her friend's ear.

"Twilight, what's up? Your laughs aren't you." Leave it to Pinkie to remove the tact of a situation, but at least she was straightforward, the thoughts of Twilight echoed in her mind. The berried one returned the gesture, bearing cose to her friend.

"I'm foreign to you now, aren't I? I mean, more so than I already am."
1113122221221111222.title: Shifts of Cold Winds

choices: "Different!? She's a freak!!"

11131222212211112221.content: Upon hearing those words, Pinkie froze up for a short time that only she would notice. Her mind blazed with ways to get herself out of this little situation. After a few moments of realizing how Twilight works and those around her(particularly the honesty detector beside her) Pinkie just sighed and nodded. "I have to be honest Twilight, even I can't just take all this in at once. You're just...two different." Pinkie instantly regretted that last sentence as Twilight's face drooped even further. Twilight looked to herself and began to very lightly cry. "What about the rest of you? Do you all think that I'm 'just too different?" The girls all looked to each other, sharing the same worry on their faces. "Um....well darling.." Rarity started before turning to Fluttershy. "We don't mean to offend you or anything like that." Applejack stepped in front, sweat on her forehead. "It's just that the fact you're a big berry is a little...unusual. But we've felt with stranger things together...right girls?" Applejack turned to RD and Sunset, who were both looking to them in surprise.

"I think that depends on how you define 'strange,'" Dash replied as she shot a gae to Sunset.

"I mean, I turned into a demon succubus monster thing and that was pretty weird. So," Sunset shrugged as she flashed a glare to Dash, "I guess we're even there."

"Well, there ya go Twilight," Applejack piped up, trying to keep the situation at as minimal in tension as she could. Her grin wavered slightly as Twilight's piercing gaze struck her through and through. "Come on Twi, don't look at me like that."

"How can I not!" Twilight's tears streamed down her soaked face. "How could Starlight be right?! Can't you see this is what she wanted?!"

"Now Twilight, y'all are talking crazy!"

"You weren't there AJ! I was! This is exactly what Starlight wants, to tear a rift between us like this!" Twilight sobbed, gasping slightly for breath as she pointed her chubby finger at her friends.
111312222122111122212.title: Umm....yeah...right

choices: You were right Starlight, equality is needed for friendship
You....fix me now!
1113122221221111222121.content:
Normally, Applejack was a patient being who tried to keep nice when nessasary. The way Twilight was acting however just made the farm girl mad. "Ya think we haven't thought yah'll were different before? Right as ah met ya ah knew there was something odd about ya. When Sunset had put that video on the internet, ah laughed the first time ah saw that. It wasn't right but it just made ya seem so...wrong that ah couldn't help it. Plus, it ain't even like yah'll were on of us in the first place! Being a 'magical pony princesses ain't easy to swallow then or now! Ah don't see how anything could possibly different then before ya big berry!"
Applejack began taking breaths to collect herself, her face red and flustered. As she looked around her, the weight of what she just yelled began to manifest. She looked to the girls around her who all shared looks of disbelief. When her eyes fell to Twilight though, that was when her heart sank. The berry's face was a sour mixture of sadness, anger, disbelief and overall uncomfortably. Pinkie, feeling the tension becoming too much, ran from the room. "Twi...ah..." "Just go." Considering what words passed between them, AJ complyed out of kindness more then anything. Fluttershy and Rarity nervously stepped forward, receiving a death glare from the big berrygirl. In response, both of them fled the scene. Rainbow was already walking towards the exit, leaving only Sunset. "Sunset, I know you won't...." Sunset steppes back, almost as if she was afraid. The girl ran out with the others, leaving Twilight all by herself. Along with the hurt, there was a hint of satisfaction by making them leave. How could she possibly call them her friends now? After that rant about how...different she was from them....how....unequal. Twilight paused, suddenly she could see what Starlight had been telling her. It was through difference that they were driven apart maybe....
If took a while for Twilight to hear footsteps again. "So how did it go 'dear teacher.'
1113122221221111222121.title: Applejack's temper flares

choices: Starlight approaches Twilight's friends for Equality
Starligth plots to capture Twilight's friends
11131222212211112221212.content:
"You!" Twilight's eyes pierced the depths of Starlight's being and left a conflicting feeling of chilled terror and heated smugness. "I swear, if you don't change me back, I'm gonna go from "Princess of Friendship" to "Princess of Plot-Whooping" in short order."

"I don't know Twilight, blue really seems to be your color," Starlight smirked as she came close to her berry. With a fair hand, she petted Twilight's head. "Seems your friends just don't understand you, hmm? If only everyone was equal..."

"We've been over this Starlight! Your delusions of equality are not how friendship works. I thought Trixie would have gotten that to you, but I can see she was clearly not the best candidate."

"Your friends don't seem to think so..."

"Glimmer," Twilight tried to pinch the bridge of her nose, "Celestia help us all should I ever get my hands on you. Nopony, and I mean Nopony, will ever accept in your flawed philosophy. Even my human friends are dumb enough to listen to you!"

"Well then," Starlight got up and headed for the door, "I'll just have to convince them otherwise."
11131222212211112221212.title: A Conflict of Interest

choices: They agree with Starlight
Third gonna be difficult
111312222122111122212121.content:
Twilight just sighed as Starlight disappeared, "I swear that girl is more stubborn then Applejack."

It took awhile for Sunset to find the others, they had all seemingly vanished. After listening closely though, she was able to pick up the not too faint sound of someone crying. Following the voice, she found herself in the kitchen with the girls huddling around Pinkie. Her poofy hair had deflated and now nearly covered her face. "Why!? Why did I have to go and say that!?" Fluttershy attempted to put a comforting hand on her friend's shoulder. "Pinkie...you can't feel so bad about this.." "How can't I!! Twilight needed support and instead I made her self-conscious! She needed help and we insulted her!" Apple Jack nodded sheepishly, "Yah, ah certainly didn't help the situation."

"I think we can all agree to that."

The girls all turned to the door and found the smiling Starlight looking at them. "YOU!" Pinkie yelled through clenched teeth, "You did what happened to Twilight!" "Only as an experiment....that I think worked pretty well." "What are you talking about?" Sunset angrily said as she took a step forward." Starlight put up her hand defensivly. "To show Twilight how important equality was for friendship. Don't tell me you all have already forgotten. One little difference between you and she turned on you and vice versa." Not wanting to argue with that, Sunset stepped back while Rainbow stepped forward. "And you think that justifies what you did to her?" Starlight nodded, "Think of it like this: Everyone on a sports team must put in the work right? How can that be if some are better and or worse then others?"
Rainbow stood back in thought.
"Many animals get angry if not given an equal amount of love and affection, right?"
Fluttershy nodded, though regretted it.
"In baking, it's better to make sure everything is followed equally to the recipe right?"
"Well...sometimes...but....well"
In clothing in farming, it's important to keep materials at a equal preparedness."
Rarity and Applejack looked to eachother in realization.
"Sunset, I've heard the stories about you. It must be so hard to know you couldn't be more different then everyone else at this school. Don't you wish everyone would treat you as an equal? Well, how is friendship different then all the other things?"
111312222122111122212121.title: Starlight approaches Twilight's friends for...

choices: Another Vial of Blue to Submit the Unequal
A Magical Artifact to subdue the Resistant
1113122221221111222121212.content:
"It's just not that simple Starlight," Sunset tried to explain looking for the right words to express her thoughts.

"Oh, but isn't it?" Starlight grinned, having pinned each of them at their core interest and values.

"People have innate strengths and weaknesses...and that's what makes them who they are. If we stripped them down of all that, then doesn't that strip them of their humanity as well? People would be little better than mindless drones or little cogs spinning in an unnecessary machine," Sunset replied, doing her best to counter the strong points laid before her.

"Bah, those are merely obstacles to be overcome with equality. If the playing field is equal, then the need of individual has become the need of the community."

"But that merely leads to stagnation and the death of creativity!"

"Such things aren't needed in an equal society, for all would have the same desires and the need for change would be gone."

"It'd be the death of the soul!" Sunset crossly shouted, rearing herself up slightly. Starlight scowled at this one, this Sunset Shimmer. Twilight certainly had some kind fo impression on her, as did this whole human world. But that could change very quickly, as her hands fished about in her pockets.
1113122221221111222121212.title: The Debate of Ideals

Sunset runs off to save herseld
11131222212211112221212122.content:
After a few short seconds of time, Glimmer found what she was looking for. She pulled out what appeared to be a small necklace with a big black equal mark in the center. Upon closer examination however, one would find a thin black aura eminating from the mark. "What's with the jewelry?" Sunset question, sensing the magic in it. Starlight shrugged playfully, "Just a little something that I his from my teacher. I don't know what she told you all about me, but let's just say this gave me the power to equalize others." She held the dark object closer to the girls, who all backed slightly. "I know however that in this world, magic is not so commonplace, you all have nothing to protect you from the truth. Even now just being in the mark's presence makes you desire equality. While the girls did have resources with them being elements, their sparse use coupled with Twiligh's breakdown madethier magic weak. Sure enough the girls were beginning to think more and more about what Glimmer said. It was seemingly to make sense, if so many things required equality to be perfect, then why was friendship any different? While they didn't fully accept it, their colors were beginning to gain a gray dull tint. Out of the girls, Sunset seemed to be the one holding out. There was no way this girl was gonna twist her to her fake sense of friendship. Plus, she had to think of some way to get Twilight out of the transformation. "Like I said Sunset..." Glimmer said as she put the artifact in front of the girl's face, "...you out of any of these girls should know how difference is not exactly a friend maker." Whether by the amulet or her own thought, Sunset's mind began to think back. The comments she heard, the fears and rumors, they all came flooding back.
What a freak. She could turn at any second. Jerk. Nut case. Evil. Horrible. Not like us!
11131222212211112221212122.title: A Magical Artifact to subdue the Resistant

choices: It's far too late to save them, but Twilight's others friends could help
I owe it to them, time for a daring rescue!
111312222122111122212121222.content:
They tortured her, those thoughts of time gone by. Sunset writhed about in anguish and terror, the feelings of old making their efforts to bend her reformed will. Every fiber of her mind throbbed with anxiety, with that awful sense of pressure she had shaken.

"That's it! I'm outta here!" she roared before bolting in any direction that would take her away from her nightmares. Her legs sped along, turning corners and leaping over whatever got in her way until she had firmly planted herself in front of the CHS statue. Drawing in long breaths to recover her lost oxygen, Sunset gazed into her reflection, hoping to find the courage she had taken in becoming someone better than who she was, but the haze of Starlight's equality was blocking a proper view. It burned her deeply, the anger she had towards that loon Twilight had been crazy enough to try and teach.

"When I get my hands on her, I'm gonna...wait! Shoot! I left them behind!"

1113122221221111222121212222.content:
Sunset looked back to the school building in fear, there was no way she wanted to go through all of that again. "No," she thought "They stool up for me and stayed by my side when no one else would have. If I was in there being hypnotized by a equality but with the most magical of us a blueberry, the girls would risk their lives to save me. I need to return the favor!" Turning her whole body to the school, Sunset rushed in with the intent of saving her friends. "After all, why wouldn't I save my eq..." Sunset stopped that thought before she finished thinking that word. The girls may be on the same level as her but the magic Starlight had still seemed to be in her. She had to be careful. With that in mind, she kept running through the halls until she heard voices. Not from where she left the girls but from where they had left Twilight. Wanting to see what was happening, Sunset sneaked over to the room and peered in through the open door.

"I know how much you six want to be equal now that I've given you it's magic, however I don't think you truley understand it." Twilight just kept her mouth shut when she had realized they weren't listening to her. "What do you mean Starlight?" Applejack asked, the gray tone more pronounced and her accent a little less noticeable. Starlight took one of the few remaining bottles of serum and gave it to the girls. "You all will join Twilight in her blueberry state until further notice. To be more specific, after school tomorrow. When the students treat you all in the exact way I know they will, then equality's magic shall be a true thought in you all." With a smug grin, Starlight looked to Twilight and said "Then I'll become YOUR teacher Twilight." Twilight said nothing still. Sunset looked to the girls as each took a look at the serum. Each of them had the gray tone just as obvious as AJ and their more unique clothing items were off. Sunset had to stop this, but how? As much as she wanted to rush in, it was 7 to one along with Glimmer's amulet to make things difficult. Plus, just being close to Twilight would throw her off with what had happened earlier.

11131222212211112221212122222.content:
"I'm gonna need some backup if I'm going to save all of them...but who?" Sunset murmured to herself as she made her way sneakily towards the library. "Well, Our Twilight would be a start, and then some of her friends. And no doubt if the Dazzlings heard about Starlight stepping on their turf, hey might join with me too." Her finger tapped her chin as she flittered between bookcases, doing her best to avoid contact with anyone around.

Sunlight filtered down from the skylights above as Sunset, stowed away behind a sizable tome, texted away to anyone she felt could help. Responses were slow to start, but given an hour and a half, Sunset had at least a dozen or so replies promising some sort of assistance for after school the next day.

"Alright, time to stall out for tomorrow," Sunset started, removing herself from her seat and placing back the engorged anthology to its inital place on the shelf. "I hope I've got enough support..."

111312222122111122212121222222.content:
It had been a difficult day to say the least. True to Glimmer's word, all six of the girls were now big blueberry girls. They had to be at a size that allowed entrance into room, but they were berrygirls nonetheless. Despite Sunset's best attempts, the girls were all mocked and teased either openly or behind their backs. Twilight, thinking there was nothing she could do, tried to ignore it as best she could. The others though had clearly been in Glimmer's equality mind control as they were disquested by their differences. Most of Sunset was enraged at Glimmer for doing this sort of thing. There was a small part of her though that still had a piece of Glimmer's power in her. This part felt it was the girl's fault for not being like the other students, but Sunset suppressed this this as best she could.

According the texts, the group all agreed to meet in the library after school. Hoping for the best, Sunset opened the doors. Sure enough, huddled by a table in the most low-traffic area of the place was her squad. Adagio was the first to see her, with a face that bordered between "You have some nerve doing this."..and" what happened to you?" Noticing this, Sunset took notice that there was a slight gray tint left in her color. Quickly, she made her way to the table where an open seat was put. "I want to thank you..." "Stuff it fire-hair!" Aria growled, "We aren't doing this because we want to!" Everyone at the table nodded except for EGTwilight who just squirmed. "Well then why are you here if you didn't want to help?" Indigo spoke up, "I know my friends and I just want the pleasure of possibly punching those game-breakers." Sonata added "And no way is anyone gonna rob me of my personality!" "Yeah..." Aria whispered, "...because then you wouldn't annoy us for fun." Sunset hit the table softly to put attention back on her. "Look, Starlight will be with the girl in the chemistry room, possibly to turn them back. We go in, stop her, fix the girls ourselves and break them from their trance. EGTwilight spoke out, "Well what's in in for us?" Sunset waved a hand, "We'll discuss it later, let's go!" The group(most of them reluctantly) got from the table and walked out of the library.

1113122221221111222121212222221.content:
Their exit was curt, all leaving in a huddled mass around their temporary ringleader. Sci Twi drew close to Sunset, taking her hand with the Dazzlings right behind her.

"What exactly are we up against Sunset?" she asked, sliding her glasses back up the bridge of her nose.

"Some psychopathic ex-student of Princess Twilight. She's got some kind of magic artifact that drains the personality out of people and makes them 'equal.'"

"Equal?"

"...So like a Communist?" Sugarcoat suggested.

"Essentially," Sunset replied. "Don't let her get too close with that thing, as it seems proximity is what triggers its effects."

"Leave that part to us then," Adagio piped up, "we've got just enough magic left over to where we can liely resist it."

"If you're sure..."

"Trust me, you focus on the strategy, and we'll break that petty little charm of hers into a million pieces."

The girls had now reached the doors to the Chemistry Labs, muffled words could be heard from the other side. With a silent nod of final confirmation to her team, Sunset kicked the door open and was taken aback: Not only were her friends still berries, but they had gotten far larger then she had expected! Even Starlight seemed a bit bigger...

"Well well well, look who finally decided to show up for her equalizing! And you brought some friends too, how thoughtful!" Starlight smirked with an ugly smugness.

"This is your final chance Starlight,fix my friends and leave our world or we're going to lay the smack on you!" Sunset threatened, the others puffing up their chests in support.

"Very cute Shimmer, but your world is in as much need of equality as mine is. No dice."

"Then you leave me with no choice," Sunset smirked back, flashing her index finger forward to point to their targets. "Attack!"

The berries began charging towards the girls except for Twilight,who still needed to fully accept equality. Sunset's teammates tried their best to lay any sort of attack on the big berries. Whenever they tried to make an punch or kick though, it seemed to just make their bodies jiggle with juice. Most of the berries seemed uninterested in the newcomers and seemed to be rolling towards Sunset. "No offense Sunset." Rarity said, her high class accent all but gone from her voice, "But it's clear your the one in control." Fluttershy, her shyness obviously degraded, took notice short time in rolling on top of the girl. "Yahhh! Get off of me!" Sunset's muffled voice could be heard. "Not until you join us in equality and your 'friends do the same." Applejack said as she and Rarity rolled on either side of Fluttershy. Meanwhile, none of the other non-berries were having good luck in their advancement. Even with her drive to be the best athlete gone, Rainbow's reflexes were still top notch as her large frame kept the Dazzlings from getting closer to Starlight. Pinkie meanwhile was herding the shadow bolts and SciTwi back, putting the two groups back together. Starlight chuckled as she leaned to Twilight. "Yet another need of equality 'dear student.' It seems your friends are truley able stop this little invasion. They aren't worrying who'll get more praise because third all equal. Applejack and Rarity aren't fighting over who's idea will be better because their equal. Fluttershy isn't afraid to help out because she knows she is equal to her friends no matter what." Twilight just watched as the group was being overpowered by the grey-blue blueberries. They were fighting to help her and Sunset was being squished. Still....Starlight was right. Never before had the girls worked in such a truly perfect sync. Even her friends in the pony world.

"I've told you one too many times Starlight, this is madness! Didn't you read the chronicles of Rey Write and his notations on the dystopia of the 4th year of 1980?" Twilight challenged, once more taking aim at her student.

"I have, and thought it was an inspiration what happened there. Why, that sounds like such a place to have, that 101st room in the Tower of Love," Starlight grinned as she fantasized of how much more her equality could spread. It was just enough time for Twilight to pin her adversary down with her enormous belly once more.

"Sunset! Tickle them and run!" Twilight called out, holding back her own feelings of laughter from Starlight's vicious hands daintily ticking away at her. The Shadowbolts and Dazzlings took this advice to heart as they forced both Pinkie and Dash back, allowing for other to break away and distract AJ and Rarity. Sunset hurriedly made haste to escape from beneath Fluttershy before speeding over to Twilight and rolling her as fast as she could, calling out a sound "Retreat!" The remaining forces doubled back and fled the scene, leaving Starlight with the remaining berried cast.

"That cursed Twilight!" Starlight growled as she finally righted herself form the ground and had order among her berried serfs. "No matter! We shal still spread our equality through this school! And after that, we'll ensure the entire world here knows of equality. And fter that, Equestria will bow before equality as its master!"

1113122221221111222121212222221111.content:
There were quite a handful of students left in the hallways and each got a good look at the odd group that rushed by them. Sunset was doing her best to keep Twilight from rolling off course while everyone else kept running. Taking a shortcut through the main foyer of the building, the group made their way to the gym. Taking a quick look inside, Sunset saw that no one seemed to be in and began rolling the big berrygirl in. "Well....." Aria said after gathering her breath, "...I think we can chock that up as a failure." Sunset looked back to the group after she made certain the grayish-blue blueberry was stable. "Now you all know just why I had you all come here, that Glimmer needs to be stopped." Twilight, now getting a good look at just who it was that tried to save her and her friends, had her jaw drop. "Wh...w...What the heck are you all doing helping me?!" Adagio looked to the girl and gave a smirk, "We may hate you and your little friends for what you all did to us, but there is no way I'm gonna be just a boring face in the crowd." "Me neither." "Definitely not." "No way in Tartarus." Twilight smiled, it was nice to know that it was possible to think even the worst of enemies could decide to help her. No one noticed but for a slight moment, her body gained a tint of blue back over the grey. As the rest of the girls began talking about how horrible the situation now seemed, Sunset sneaked back to Twilight. "Hey...ummm..sorry about..." "No....I overreacted, I think Starlight had affected me more then I realize."
"So, while we're on the subject....." Lemon Zest called out to Sunset, "...you still haven't told us just what you were gonna give us for helping you." The whole group except for SciTwi turned their heads and passed slight glares along. "Oh...ummm.....well....what do you think I should give you?" "OhOhOh" Sonata yelled out as she shot her hand up before Aria slammed it down. "No" "But I...." "NO Sonata! No more of your taco addiction." "At least I have something to be joyful about, you just step aside and act all 'I don't care about anything because I'm a jerk.'" Adagio held the two girls apart like a teacher seperated little kids. "Both of you calm down and be quiet!" Beside them, Sugarcoat snickered to her friends. "Just look at em', little pony world freaks can't keep their heads straight." All three Dazzlings turned at the hearing of the comment and growled. "What did you just say you hoofless human?" Indigo laughed at Adagio's comment. "Oh, hoofless. Is that what passes for an insult in your world?"

Twilight watched as what she thought was a budding friendship burst through arguments. The blue tint she had gained back retreated to grey again as the thoughts of needed equality passed through her head. Even with her magic, her proximity to that equal mark amulet had given her a big dose of the power.

11131222212211112221212122222211111.content:
"HEY!" Sunset barked, grabbing everyone's attention as she stormed into the center of the conflict and broadly smacking both offending parties. "We don't have to fight between species! We're trying to stop a crazed lunatic from turning us into a freaky Orwellian future!"

"Sheesh, when did you get a backhand Shimmer," Aria grumbled as she rubbed her sore cheek.

"When the only hope for saving our world decided to start eating itself!" Sunset complained. "I don't know about you, but something tells me we might need more help."

"And where do you propose we get those people? You barely scrabbled us together!" Sour-Sweet retorted, sharply raising her voice.

"I just texted Moondancer. She can be here in five..." Sci Twi mumbled, shying away and behind Sunset.

"Thanks Twi," Sunset whispered back. "Right, well, some of you must have some friends we can reach out to, right? I mean, I know a few other people who might be available, and I can only imagine who else any of you might know."

"So what you're saying is we need to text our friends to come over here and fight ginat blueberries and a psycho from the world where Twilight got all that crazy magic from?" Sugarcoat asked.

"Sorta-Kinda...?" Sunset shrugged.

The group all looked between one another either with uncertainty or distrust. The silence permeated the room until Aria sighed. "Well...between working with people I can't stand and losing my personality, I'd rather take the first option." After making a quick turn to Sugarcoat and the others, she added. "But none of species joke stuff, got it?" The Shadowbolts all nodded (with crossed fingers behind a few backs.) "We'll see if we can get anyone, but it's gonna be tough to convince anyone."

Adagio's face lit up as she pulled her girls back. "Remember that one woman who sheltered us after our little...." One glare at Sunset and Twilight later. "...mishap? There's no way she'd want to loose herself." After some whispering, the Dazzlings turned to Sunset and Adagio announced. "We just happen to know someone who could be of very good use. A fellow outcast of society that is such an amazing actor that you'd think she could become the beings she imitates. Plus, she has what she likes to call 'drones'" Sunset nodded, "Good, very good. Get everyone you all can muster. While I do the same, I need you all to look after Twilight and....."

1113122221221111222121212222221111111.content:
Sunset was brutally interrupted as the intercom screeched on, a droning voice taing over the airwaves:

You are like everyone else.
You are not special.
Accept your role as equal.
Equality is Good.
Being special hurts everyone.

The rebels winced in pain Sunset running over to Twilight and covering her ears to prevent further damage. Everyone nodded, scattering from the library to escape the awful noise. Twilight suffered the worst, her head pounding as the mantra drained more color out of her as she tried to focus on Sunset's face. Bolting to the park, Sunset and berry Twilight hid among the bushes before Sunset grabbed hold of Twilight, hugging her to soothe her nerves and , in a vain attempt, to reverse any damage the mantra had done. For now, she had to hope her temporary allies could gather the troops needed to counter Starlight and her crazy goons.

11131222212211112221212122222211111112.content:
The Dazzlings were not actually too far off, having run farther across the park then Sunset could while rolling Twilight. All three of them laying in the dense shrubbery breathing heavily after their sprint. "Wow...*huff*huff*....two failures in one day....*huff*...not a record I'm proud of." Adagio said as she tried to regain breath. Aria nodded, taking a few breaths herself before looking around. "Alright then, it seems we need to find our friend more than we realized and.....what the heck are you doing Sonata?" Adagio looked to where Aria was glaring and saw Sonata on her knees halfway out of their hiding spot. As Aria pulled back the girl, a startled voice gasped. The voice was followed by someone coming into the shrub. "Excuse me, are you three those Dazzlings girls Twilight texted me about?" Adagio crossed her arms with a questioning glance. "Depends, are you that Moondancer girl this world's Twilight told us about?" "That's me....uhhh....what are you three doing here? Shouldn't you be....." Sonata got up and into the girl's face. "Like I said, plans had changed and we need more helpers than just you. Considering we don't know where the others are, you'll have to come with us as we get a good friend of ours." Moondancer shrugged, "Alright then, lead the way."

"Ummm...are you girls sure we're going in the right direction?" Moondancer asked as she skirted a flipped-over trash can. "You want to lead the way? Be our guest." Aria said without looking back as the group passed a graffiti-stained wall. "Sorry...it's just that I've heard some pretty bad things about this part of town and I don't want us to get lost." Moondancer squeaked in fear as a piece of a building fell off, causing her to jump right beside Sonata. "It's okay, we've practically lived here for weeks so we know what's up. Besides, we're already here!" The Dazzlings turned the corner into a dimly lit back alley with makeshift steps leading to an armored door. "By the way, this place isn't exactly a crime free place so don't bother remembering it." Adagio stepped up and gave a series of quick knocks. A panel opened in the door and two blue eyes looked over the four. "Password." A male voice said behind the door. "Why does the fly wrap itself in the spider's web?" Aria said in an uninterested tone. The eyes squinted before the panel closed. Multiple chains rattled and locks clicked before the door opened up. The three sirens stepped in with their 'friend' close behind with a guy wearing black and green clothes and black hair standing before them. "Where would we happen to find Chrysalis?" "She's teaching some of the other 'drones' in the room three doors on the right. Welcome back by the way." Moondancer stayed close to the three girls as her eyes wandered around what she could only assume was an old stage. Many teens, all of them with the same blue eyes and black and green colors were either digging through undoubtedly stolen bags or.....reading off scripts. A slightly older female voice became obvious as the four girls came to the room. "...most important thing about impersonations is to keep calm unless the person you're imitating is a nervous person." Sonata opened the door and a woman who looked about graduate age looked over a group of 'drones.' Her clothing style was the same color scheme, but her eyes were green and her full body seemed to be a shiny black. "Ah, my dear little Dazzlings, what can I do for you three today?"

"We hate to interrupt your lessons Miss Chrysalis, but..."

"We facing impending doom from a wacko from Equestria!" Sonata blurted out.The other two glared at her before Adagio started again.

"Well, let me clarify that: It seems a former student of Twilight Sparkle has found her way over here and is planning on converting everything into a state of equilibrium. Think dull grays and uniformity under a psychotic dictator."

"That is unacceptable! We cannot have this rude cur stand in our way! Where is this...?"

"Starlight Glimmer. She's currently based at the High School where that Sunset Shimmer goes. What's worse is she has some strange magic that works in our world! Some strange amulet that brainwashes people to her bidding."

"Well then! My drones! Gather your brethren and meet me here! We have an assault to be had! My darling Dazzlings, thank you for informing me. It's best you stick around, we'll need your help with the assault."

"As you wish Miss Chrysalis," the three bowed in respect, Aria dragging Moondancer down with her.

1113122221221111222121212222221111111212.content:
All it took was a few minutes for word of the impending invasion planning to spread throughout the 'hive' as Chrysalis called it. Moondancer took a moment to look around the old building before meeting in the main theater with the rest. Many rooms were similar to the classroom the girls found the 'queen', as Chrysalis like to call herself. Others seemed to be storage for untold amounts of stolen items, black market merchandise, and more makeup and costumes then any working theater Moondancer saw had..(which isn't many but it's still a lot of makeup.) One last room that surprised her was what seemed to be sleeping quarters. Instead of average beds, it seemed the drones slept in some sort of green waterbed/sleeping bag hybrid. Putting her focus back to what was important, Moondancer made her way to the stage where everyone else was seated. The one empty seat she could immediately find in the audience section was in between two female drones in the front row, which she quickly took as Chrysalis continued her speech. The Dazzlings were on separate sides of the stage with a picture of Starlight Glimmer and a large map of Canterlot High tacked to a billboard.

"....mantra is most likely coming from the Principal's office here. What that means is that it is another key area we need to pay attention to." Adagio stared to the large crowd before her and began to speak. "Believe us when we say that this Starlight girl is smart and powerful, it won't be easy to fool her or anyone inside that school. This is especially true if she has already made the school into grey equality lovers, which makes them all boring, dull and similar down to the slightest movement. This means studying patterns before choosing who to impersonate is critical." Aria took a few steps before continuing. "All three of us are aware Miss Chrysalis has taught you all much about obeying her, but don't think this alone will keep you safe. The magic she holds is capable of making friends turn on friends if necessary, so you all need some sort of ear protection to keep safe." Sonata took a step forward and added her own words. "It seems Starlight has an odd thing for blueberries as she has turned all but one of Canterlot's magic-users into her blueberry slaves and seems to be growing herself. Take that into consideration if you all may." Chrysalis rolled her eyes. "Yes...well...do you all understand? Impersonate the students after giving them our 'usual treatment', get close to Starlight and the office, turn off the mantra and smash her equality necklace. As stated, it would be better if the intercom comes off first as it can serve as a signal. With both sources of the spell gone, the students will be easier to revert to normal. If the principals, the 'blueberries', or anyone figure you out, non-lethal force only! I've trained you all well in breaking and entering so each group of seven should be able to sneak in from different angles. Make sure to refill makeup and costumes holders, and overload them both with grey's. Any questions should be directed to either our Dazzlings or to your queen:ME. We all meet back in ten minutes before heading out, do make your queen proud my sweet little drones. A collective "Yes Queen Chrysalis." sounded before everyone started getting out of their seats.

1113122221221111222121212222221111111212.content:
"Okay, we should be safe over here. Twilight, you okay?" Sunset wheezed, kneeling down to her friend's head.

"Yeah, I think so. Ergh, it's just so hard to suppress all this equality in my system," Twilight groaned, uselessly flapping her hands.

"Here, let me help," sunset placed her hands to Twi's temples and rubbed them, soothing the agitation

"Thanks, that helps a lot." Twilight sighed contently, her brain buzzing with the wild conflict of ideals inside it.

"Don;t mention it. But now we're all separated..."

"Don't you have them on your phone?"

"I do, but that's not important at the moment. What matters to me is that you're starting to feel better." Sunset grinned slightly as a bit of Twilight's blue bega to creep out against the grays covering her body.

"For now anyways...Sunset, I...I don't know if I'm going to be able to go back in there with that mantra going off..."

"You're right...but I'm not sure how we're gonna be able to turn it off at this point," Sunset assented before her phone went off.

Twilight grimaced at the notice but realized with her coloration and shape that she had to keep positive. Knowing Glimmer however, there was the small possibility she was ready for anything. "She won't go down easily, I've taught that girl so much and she was smart to begin with. Her notions of......" Twilight caught herself before even saying the word, thinking it would cause a relapse. "....her false beliefs are so strong she would do anything to see them come into fruition." Sunset nodded and put a comforting hand to her friend. "Don't worry Twilight, we'll fix this and stop Starlight. I promise." From her spot in the shrubbery, Sunset peeked through said bushes to take one last look at the school. Her gut wrenched at the thought of what Starlight was doing at that moment. She was only on the receiving end of the magic for a minute or so but it was near traumatizing. Now with the 'announcement' blaring on the speakers, it was only gonna get worse. She was pulled from her thoughts when her phone buzzed again. We've made it back to the school, where are you?"

112.content:
The school bell pealed for the 2:55 final call, small cheers of joy as a long weekend was finally before the students and teachers. A nice long break to enjoy all the fun and fancy free they could squish into the normal weekend padded with an extra day to recover. A few teachers were eager to remind student of assignments and tests that would loom shortly upon their return, but such was lost amid the plans and chaos of the buzzing student body. And none were buzzing more than Twilight "Science" Sparkle and Sunset Shimmer, the biggest pair of love nerds this side of the mirror portal.

"Are you as excited as I am?!" Twilight twittered with glee, a manic grin smeared across her face as dozens of thoughts raced across her mind. "We'll finally be able to do all those long-form experiments we've been dying to do! I've been getting all the supplies and printing out walkthroughs and-"

"Twi~ You sound like Pinkie with how wired you are," Sunset teased, placing a finger to her friend's lips. She shared her friend's smile, if a bit ore controlled as the pair strolled along th halls, ready to walk home. "But yeah, I'm stoked your Mom said we could have a huge sleepover for the whole weekend~ Especially with your dad on business like this."

"It's pretty unusual, but I guess it's a pretty big deal for him. Still, I'm just happy we'll get to spend so much time together~"

"Can't complain about that. Anyways, I'm gonna go grab some stuff from my house and then be over for tonight. See you at Six."

"See you then Sunset!" The pair parted, Twilight rushing home and getting everything ready for her perfect weekend of fun and laboratory work with Sunset. The only thing that threw her off was a missing mother.

"Mom? You home?" she had called out, only to find a note explaining that she had gone off to visit an old friend and would be back later, leaving a small snack and pizza money for her to enjoy with Sunset for their night in. Twilight could only shrug, not recalling her mom mentioning seeing friends, but she supposed it was a last minute arrangement and would be fine. It jut allowed her more time to focus on getting preparations finalized.

***

Within a few hours, a knock came expectantly at the door.

"Sunset~ Come on in!"

"Thanks Twi. I brought all the stuff I could think of us needing," Sunset wrapped her friend into a warm embrace, doing her best not to let her duffel bag and guitar case crumple the frailer girl. "So, what are we gonna do first?"

"I've got a couple of thing set up in the lab ready to go when you're all set. But since we have all weekend, we can pretty much do whatever you'd like to start."

"Frankly, I'm right int he ood to be cozy and settle in a bit. It's pretty rare I get to hang out for so ong here."

"Sounds great~ I'll go change upstairs, feel free to us the bathroom in the hall."

***

After a quick change into their pajamas, the girls were ready for a fun night in. As they settle onto Twilight's bd, a warm rumble escapes Sunset's belly.

"Heh, guess I should have gotten something to eat back home."

"No worries Sunset, I've got just the thing~"

1142.content:
Twilight looked through her locker, making sure that everything she needed was out of it. Then again, she didn't have to look hard because luckily she didn't have anything to study or any project to work on. Even better, it was a four....not three....FOUR day weekend. With a smile, Twilight closed her locker and saw Pinkie standing right beside her with her usual grin plastered to her face. "Hey Twilight!" Pinkie said gleefully "Are you excited? I can't believe the luck we're getting! I mean a three day weekend is great enough, but a FOUR day weekend is wonderful as all getout! By the way, I wanted to ask you something. Do you have anything that your doing this weekend?" Twilight giggled at Pinkie's happiness and shook her head saying "I've got nothing important that I know about, I guess I'm free to......." Before Twilight could say another word, Pinkie grabbed her by the arm and started dragging her along. "Great Twilight, cause I've got something that I just know you'll love!" Twilight rolled her eyes, but said nothing. She knew that once Pinkie was this excited, you could only play along.

Twilight looked at the delicious desserts thst surrounded her. Brownies, pies, cakes, so many delicious goddies she didn't know what to choose. Her eyes darted around until she came to an eye-catching piece of peach cobbler. She licked her lips and prepared to dig in until she was pulled away by her friend."No silly." Pinkie giggled "That's not what I wanted to show you." Pinkie pulled the grumbling Twilight to a locked door, entirely painted blue. Pulling out a key, also painted blue, from her hair, she unlocked the door and pulled Twilight through it. Twilight looked around the room and saw the amount of blue and guessed what was in them. "Blueberries?" Pinkie nodded and said " I've been working with a whole load of blueberry recipes. I've been planning for all my friends to taste them. However, sence you've been such a superiffic friend, you can be the first to try them." Twilight grumbled, her heart still placed on that peach cobbler she saw. Not wanting to displease her friend however, she grabbed the closest thing she could.... a piece of blueberry pie. Holding it in her hand, she slowly bit into it. The warm sauce burst into her mouth, the flakey crust the perfect constast to it's smoothness. She could feel the lumps that were blueberries rolled across her mouth and swallowed. "Oopsy" Pinkie said as she pulled out a napkin, "You got some blueberry sauce on your face."

Lightly slapping herself though, Applejack's head cleared. "Come on..." she thought to herself "....are ya forgetting that those delicious things are what's turning Twi and Rarity into..." The second Applejack thought of her friends, she looked over to them. They looked so happy, gorging themselves and growing into blueberries themselves. The sounds of them eating the blue treats didn't help either as it reminded her of her hunger. Applejack licked her lips again as she took a step forward. "They look so good." she whispered to herself, "So tempting......so perfect"

"Yah'll don't understand Dashie." Applejack said as she scooped up a handful of frozen blueberries. "We're the ones who need sense talked into us." She turned, holding the blueberries tightly. "Here we are, afraid of what is clearly something to rejoice about. Twi and Rarity know the joy of blueberries, that's why their becoming part of them." Applejack then popped the blueberries into her mouth, her tongue turning blue as she swallowed. Before the girls could stop her, Applejack kept eating, the blue quickly spreading across her body. "That's it Applejack." Twilight said as she already began to grow, "Enjoy the perfection of blueberries, become a part of the perfection, just eat and enjoy." Applejack did eat and indeed she was enjoying every second. "Ah was so foolish girls." she said through a mouth full of cobbler, "I'm sorry fer resisting, ah didn't know how wonderful this feels." "It's okay darling, your right, you didn't know. Now you do however." Rarity looked to the others and smirked, slightly showing her blue teeth. "Soon, you three will too."

"Sunset! Run!" Fluttershy screamed as she grasped her friend's hand and bolted out fo the room, slamming the large door behind the two of them. She dragged Sunset down several halls before pausing to catch her breath. "I'm *huff* so glad *huff* you came!"" she spoke before clinging to Sunset in a deep hug.

"Wha-what the heck did I just see?!" Sunset shouted in her bewilderment as her friend turned her face up to see the exasperated face of her friend.

"It was Pinkie Pie and Twilight! Something happened to Twilight after she ate some of Pinkie's baking goods and then she started turning all of us into blueberries like her!" Fluttershy explained as she clutched tightly to Sunset's jacket. Sunset slowly nodded, gently running her hand through her friend's hair to soothe her. Taking a few minutes ot let the information settle in her mind, Sunset gazed down to Fluttershy and asked, "So, what do we do now?"

1142221132111111212122121122212122112113.content:
"Fluttershy...?" Sunset asked again, her voice taking a slight tremble as she drew close to her friend. She noted the sudden paleness in Fluttershy's color, even the rich blues and violets had shifted more to periwinkles and lavenders. Those eyes she saw, those eyes wide with an unearthly sort of terror to them. What would cause such quivering beyond its usual extent in her friend? Her eyes shifted once more, peering into the shallow depths of the refrigerator. Horror, raw and unhinged, shot through her system, the urge to scream and make known her displeasure caught in the base of her larynx. Sunset's eyes grew round and glassy, pupils nearly taking up the full interior of her eyes as her gaze fuzzed on the edges, barely able to hold in the sight she held before herself. For there, sitting with little comfort in a small plastic bowl, rested what appeared to be several dozen berried people, each shrunken down to true blueberry size and wriggling about with their useless appendages.

Sunset's body automatically stepped back, allowing her the room to rotate herself and prompty relief her stomach of its content into the local waste bin. Once, twice, three times did bile and the remains of Granny Smith's "Apple Dapple Surprise" come out of her, a small course of dry heaves followed to ensure all was lost and accounted for. Sitting herself down, Sunset put both hands to her face, the overwhelming tensions taking their toll on her psyche. She felt a small hand to her back, her mind alerting her to Fluttershy's comforting touch. With an internal nod, she embraced her friend, tears streaming between them.

"I-i'm... so sorry...Fluttershy..."

11431.content:
It had been a harsh exit to say the least. The Dazzlings, the soon-to-have-been conquerors of Canterlot High School and the world at large, were fleeing on foot to escape the inevitable wrath of the student body they had just tried to mind control with teir siren songs. Unfortuantely for them, those accursed Rainbooms and that Sunset girl had foiled their plot and shattered their only means of taking control over the simple for of CHS. Adagio was fuming, her mind reeling with how to solve the current predicament while her cohorts, Sonata and Aria, bickered back and forth at who's fault it was.

"If you had actually managed to hit one of those Rainbooms, I wouldn't have to have covered your flank!" Aria raged.

"It's not my fault that you're a poor shot yourself!" Sonata shouted back, resting on the fin line between her usual happy-go-lucky attitude and a seething frustration that welled inside her.

"Will you two shut up for once! Celestia! I can hardly think straight with you two at each other's throats!" Adagio barked at them, silencing the two for the moment. Rubbing her fingers against her temples, Adagio tried to figure what was their newest plan. Something bold and ensuring of their revenge. But, they only had a little magic left between the three of them, so everything had to hinge on that contingency.

"Quick, what do have in your pockets," Adagio commanded. The other Dazzlings rapidly rummaged through their pants to find a paperclip, seventy-two cents and a stick of gum. "Ugh, mostly junk I see," she growled, "but it'll have to make due. I can;t see anything worthwhile outside of the gum, so we'll need t enchant that with what we have left."

"What's gum gonna do? It's not like it can get our powers back..." Aria grumbled, her arms crossed.

"It's all we have left Aria! Unless you have some better idea?" A long pause followed. "I thought not. Come on, let's get this thing going before anyone sees us." The other two nodded and began to harmonize with one fina, although rather short, song which infused the gum with a dark and mysterious blue aura. "Now all that's left is to bring our little payload to the right target."
11431.title: The Plot Begins, the Dazzlings Prepare

114312.content:
"This is so dumb.... were gonna get caught." Aria was whispering as she crouched in the bush. She was no more then a few feet away from the entrance to the school. She held a walkie-talkie close by, slipping slightly in her hands. She was so nervous that she was starting to sweat, then again, who could blame her? Her nervous sweating got worse as she saw students coming to the door. She looked through the small number coming in, though shook her head. When she was certain they had passed her, she turned the walkie-talkie on. "Students have come in but Twilight isn't with them. Considering she seems to be the smart type, she would be as early as now." "Okay then...." Adagio's voice could be heard through the speaker., " Then she's somewhere already in the school like I thought. Sonata and I will keep looking, but tell us if more students arrive." Aria waited for a moment before saying, " Where the hell is Sonata anyways?" A muffled voice came through, "I'm definitely not in the kitchen making tacos." Both girls groaned, but Adagio's voice said " Wait..... I see her.She's sleeping at a desk, I'll have to be quick about this."

Keeping her disguise on, Adagio crept to the sleeping girl. Carefully, she put the gum the girls had infused with magic into Twilight's hand. "She has it," Adagio whispered, "I'm getting out. Before she could move, she heard the door handle jiggled. She quickly used he costume to her advantage, staying out of sight. "Hey..." She heard outside her costume, "...who left this trashcan here?" Adagio could feel her hiding spot moved, but not before an unknowing person threw a piece of gum in, landing g right on her hair.

Before the lunch, the chemistry lab seemed to have a wailing spirit somewhere around the new trashcan.

1143121.content:
The Dazzlings continued to stalk their target throughout the day, keeping a watchful eye for when she would bite down and begin their enchanted work. Time continued to tick on, hours dragging by and no progress, that is, until the final bell peeled and Twilight departed form the school grounds, the trio of sirens following along in the shadows of her path. Through the streets of town and across the parklands, Adagio and crew kept a close beat to Twilight until reaching a small homestead on the opposing side of the park.

"Let's hope she takes the bait here, my feet are killing me," Aria grumbled in whispers, wanting to remove her shoes and rub her sore soles.

"Just keep focused! I know she'll chew it here," Adagio said with a firm voice, a small clump of hair missing from her otherwise bouncy hairdo. And as she had predicted, the trio could see Twilight rolling the stick of gum between her fingers and feeling it down.

"Nobody claimed to have given me this, and yet you were in my hand when I woke up..." Twilight muttered to no one in particular but the gum before her. "Where did you come from?" She stroked her chin thoughtfully, pondering ideas and ruminating in her thoughts until she ultimately sighed. "Well, there's no reason to really distrust you, so in you go," and with that, Twilight began to chew away at her mysterious candy from the morning.

The instant Twilight had begun chewing, the unmistakable taste of blueberries spread through her mouth. Twilight licked her lips at the taste, believing it to be one if the greatest things she had ever tasted in this world. Twilight sat there for a few minutes, merely enjoying the taste of the gum. As she chewed, she felt a tingle resonate throughout certain parts of her body. Curious to these tingling, Twilight looked to herself. At first she noticed nothing, everything seemed fine. But then, a tingle went through her hand. This was followed by the hand's color turninf from purple to a very dark blue. Twilight watched as the blue spread out, covering the whole hand. Rolling up her sleeves, she saw that the blue had already gone through her arms and around her body. Twilight figured her whole body was blue by now. What she wasn't ready to figure was why she swore she could feel her stomach blow up a little.

With Twilight's conscious nothing more than a departed memory from her head, Adagio gave the signal to the others and their song of enchantment came ot a soothing end. Smirking victoriously over their collective prey, Adagio cupped Twilight's face in her idle hand, feeling about the smoothness of her berry's features.

"Worry not Adagio, my sweet pet, we will soon have her whether she cares to join our cause or not. Rather, I can sense the time right. Adagio, get your fellow sirens and return to me with haste. Adagio bowed graciously, turned and made haste to gather her fellow Dazzlings. With due haste, the trio returned to find Twilight's berry body resting comfortably on an elevator that had not been previously there.

"Come along my pets, we have an audience to greet," twilight beckoned, her loyal retainers standing comfortable next to their source and mistress. With a snap f her fingers, Twilight forced the elevator to rise, causing a fair section of the room above's floor to recede.

"Behold guests, our illustrious Master of Ceremonies!" Adagio announced, a record scratch killing the music and all eyes turned to face the giant blueberry.

"Greetings everyone. I presume you're all having a good time?" her question was met with silence. "I'm so glad I've left you all speechless, because now is when the real fun starts!" With another snap of her fingers, Twilight's body began to shimmer and shine radiantly, a blue aura spilling forth from her bold form. All the patrons inside did nothing but stare in awe as the aura swallowed them up, the light blinding all who saw. With a sharp pulse of energy, Twilight's body buckled, streams of juice gushing from her and into each guest, causing all to begin the same process as she had. Many screamed in fright before joining those who were now embracing the sudden changes. Twilight herself was changing also, her dress elongating, hair catching up into a more flaming appearance, a bold pair of dark violet wings and tail spawning and a piercing horn and mask. With a loud and menacing cackle, Midnight Sparkle had come down upon her newest prizes with great pleasure in her work.

The whole building merely shook with the cheers of the new berries. Midnight gave a dark and maniacal laugh, she never got this respect from being a hero. She could see why many prefer the dark path, it felt so GOOD! "Speaking of feeling good...." She thought as she turned to the three sirens that had served her so well. "Adagio, Sonata, Aria." All three stood at attention as their mistress motioned towards her. "I believe you three have garnered my graditude. You deserve a nice little reward in exchange for your wonderful servitude." The three bowed their heads in reverence though their bodies shook with pure excitement. With a flick of Midnight's hand, three large chalices appeared in their hands. Sonata looked in the cup, but saw nothing in it. "Um...Mistress?" Midnight chuckled, "Oh silly me, I almost forgot..." Midnight took another deep breath and her body glowed a mix of purple and blue. The Dazzlings felt weight in the cups they were holding and noticed they were filling up. "Go ahead my dears, drink up, I know how much you all enjoy my juice." None of the dazzlings took hesitation and began chugging.

Adagio's whole world had vanished around her, the delicious blueberry juice flowing into her the only thing on her mind. Her already blue skin had begun darkening, but she didn't care. Her stomach was slowly beginning to swell up, but that wasn't important right now. There was something that was proving curious though. No matter how much she was drinking, the cup still seemed as full as when it started. It wasn't a bad thing however, that just ment more juice for her to drink. Through the haze of the juice, she could hear the voice of her mistress. She seemed to be talking to the crowd. "Behold my new slaves, behold the transformation of the three that you all will obey alongside me. As with me, you all will obey them without question. Adagio let the cup drop slightly, only to breath but she wasn't happy to do so. As she did so, she was able to get a good look to herself. Her clothing had become something similar to Midnight's but nowhere near as beautiful. Turning to her other sirens, she saw the same changes had happened to them. She could also tell they had all.swelled up like blueberries. Moreso then the crowd, but less then her mistress.

AJ and Sunset looked at the scene in front of them with wide eyes. None of them believing what they were seeing and only thinking of how the heck they were gonna fight this. Either they could run now and try to find someway to stop this, or they could go running head first and try to get their unsuspecting friend turned evil off their game.

Jamie's trying to run from our blueberry mistress!" Applejack tried to reassert herself in her attempt. However, she soon felt the large body of her brainwashed friend slam her against the wall. She soon felt another berry body press against her, leaving her no wiggle room. "Now really Applejack, first you try to make me question our mistress and now you are trying to leave us? So rude." The two berries pressed AJ against the wall further before shifting themselves ever so slightly. The cowgirl struggled with all her might but the two berrygirls were too close and squeezing her just hard enough.

Sunset smiled as she flapped her indigo hands in excitement. "There now Sunset, don't you feel so much better?" The new berrygirl nodded to Adagio with a tear in her eye. "Thank you...my mistresses. I can't believe I was so stupid to try and resist Mistress Midnight." "Exactly now where is your little friend?" "Over here Mistress Adagio!" The four berrygirls turned to see Pinkie and Rarity rolling along with a struggling Applejack pinched between them. "We found her trying to escape." Adagio smirked as she motioned to her fellow sirens. "Well, were just gonna make certain she doesn't do that again. From a hidy-hole up above, Midnight watched as her three siren slaves began to sing AJ into submission. There was no denying she now had complete control over her friends, the only limit she had now was wherever she wanted to stop.
