Adagio sighed, there was no way they would be able to hide this from their mistress. "We have no other choice girls, we need to tell Midnight about this little problem." Aria and Sonata nodded, but not before gulping fear. Sonata took a deep breath and turned back to Sunset with the best smile she could give the girl. "You just stay right here until we get back Sunny, we're not done with our song yet." Sunset mindlessly nodded, feeling too relaxed and mindless to say anything.

"Um....Mistress?" Midnight turned at the sound of Adagio's voice. All three of her berry sirens were there, though something seemed different about them. They seemed.....frightened. "Is something wrong my dears?" Midnight could almost see tears in Adagio's eyes as she spoke up. "Sunset is in your power...but.....well...." "Applejack got away!" Sonata cried before shielding herself against Aria(with limited results.) "What? How did she escape?" Aria seemed to be comforting Sonata as she said "We don't know how...she just slipped away." Adagio put herself in front of her fellow sirens. "I take full responsibility Midnight! I should have kept an eye on her. Please don't punish the others for my mistake!" Adagio looked into Midnight's eyes, expecting a punishment most horrible. The removal of her powers maybe...loosing her berry form.....even worse....never tasting her sweet blueberry juice a...." "None of you will be punished." All three girls looked at Midnight in shock. "What?" "I suppose it was my fault as well, I was so preoccupied that I forgot Applejack can be so stubborn and defiant, as well as smart." Midnight put a magic extension of her hands over them motherly, calming them down. "You didn't need to be afraid to tell me the truth. And seeing s you did right away, there is no reason for me to be mad. I may be evil, but I still care for those who mean something to me." The three sirens, overjoyed by this, rolled to Midnight and hugged her tightly. Adagio kept quiet, feeling Midnight said everything that needed to be said. Sonata was cheering to herself if only to help calm her down. With Aria though, Midnight could feel a tear coming off the girl as she whispered "No one was ever so kind to us as you are....at least without brainwashing them first." Midnight sighed in her sirens' embrace, but pulled herself together. "However, now we have to worry about Applejack again. She might not go back to the mirror, but she probably thinks we don't suspect....We have to think of something to bring her to us...."

1143121221211111121212222112121222111221.content:
As the last of the light from the streetlamps nearby faded, Applejack was greeted by the infamous fog the swirled about her, snaking and coiling around her lithe form as though to constrict the courage from her. She paid it little mind, flinging herself deeper and further into its throng. In spite of the warm spring weather that had graced the world around it, the woods around her were cast into the everlasting twilight of late autumn, trees barren of leaves and jaggedly clawing to the sky for a foul revenge. Losing wind in her lungs from the frosted bite of the oxygen around her, AJ slipped behind a nearby hus of a tree and took the moment to catch her breath.

"Tarnation, the folks weren't kiddin' bout the spook out here. Hopefully it'll keep that pesky Midnight at bay for now," she grimaced as she better observed her surroundings. Tendrils of fog flitted in the air, wisps of curling plant tips ticked the ground-abiding clouds with barbs and briars. Shadows danced in delight, leaving no look at the same object twice the same. Despite her brilliance in hiding, AJ now feared she may have duped herself into missing her backup should she never break free of the darkness about her. It was a frigid feeling, casting an icy glaze over her stomach. Nothing but the faintest sounds of her former friends could be heard, all of them nowhere near courageous enough to bother searching this far out.

"And Ah'll be happy it stays that way..."

"To whom are you addressing, Child of the Apple Kindred?" a voice spoke out from the depths of inky blackness behind her. Applejack's eyes slowly panned down to her shoulder and took note of the smokey blue hand grasping it. Her heart skipped a beat, the Enchantress! Locked by the fear, AJ could barely hold her ground against the living legend of her town. Perhaps her luck had truly run out after all.

I have something very important to address to at this moment. At the top of the hour, I'll be back to continue, and please apologize for those waiting." Excusing herself, Celestia made her way to the Tower of the Sun and began to pour over the note she had received:

Dear Princess Celestia,

This is your former student, Sunset Shimmer, and I have grave news. There has been a massive outbreak of transformation over in the human world, and Twilight and her friends have been afflicted by it. My dimension's Applejack is currently ruling over a large population of apple people, and I have strong suspicions that the Dazzlings have transformed Twilight;s friends into blueberries. I fear for the worst, as it seems the leader of a given fruit is consumed with megalomania and some form of dark magic. I cannot do this alone, and am requesting some kind of help. Spike and I are currently trying to plan an uprising of sorts against the fruit people. I look forward to hearing from you once more.

Your former yet faithful student,

~Sunset Shimmer

"Creepy..." Spike muttered as he sniffed about, picking up a rather fruity scent. "Guys, do you smell that?"

"Smell what? I'm getting dusty paperback, but that's about it," Sunset spoke.

"No, not that. Something fruity and sweet."

"Wherever you're getting that from, follow it Spike, it could be just the clue we need!" Sunset and Luna tailed the canine companion as he guided them between twisting and turning bookcases, right into the romantic fiction section.

"The scent seems to be coming from beind this one over here," Spike pointed with the tip of his nose to an unassuming shelf of books.
1143121221211111121212222112121222111221.title: Hot on the Trail

choices: Luna has followed them and the alarm is raised
The three try to get thier attention.
1143121221211111121212222112121222111221.content:
Sunset looked at the bookshelf with curious eyes, not quite sure what the dragon-turned-dog was going for. Looking to the books however, Sunset noticed something odd about a few of them. "The Siren Song of Canterlot? Blueberry Farming 101? How To Keep Your Hooves Clean?" "What odd books for one to keep in a romantic fiction section of a library." Luna stated, "Let alone a human library where hooves are not the common part to walk with." Sunset put a finger to her chin, realizing she had seen such an odd setup of books in many mystery novels she used to read. Reaching for the first book, she pulled it out and shook her head. "What are you doing?" Spike asked. "Looking for something...." Sunset said as she pulled the third book out with similar results. "Like what?" Sunset pulled at the blueberry farming book, but it wouldn't come out. Instead, the entire shelf itself began to swivel around, revealing a hole in the wall. "Like that." "Fascinating." Luna said, "We are impressed by such an interesting sight in this world. And judging by the state of this secret passage, it was made recently." Sunset noded and looked to Spike as he began sniffing again. "Oh yeah, whatever it is, it' this way." The trio began to walk down the staircase before them, unaware of just who was watching them do so.

As the three went deeper down, a noise began to make it's presence known along with the growing scent. It sounded like....liquid sloshing about.....and someone chugging it down. "Looks like we've found them you two, let's just hope they're still blueberries." "Why do you wish them to be fruit? Did we not come here to dispel of both apple and blueberry curses?" "Just wait until we get them, I'll explain then." For a minute or so more, the group went down until they reached the bottom. Sure enough, in front of them were five large blueberry girls. Each was large and blue, chugging down large funnels filled with what was undoubtedly blueberry juice and had headphones on that were no doubt playing siren recorded songs.

"Just be sure not to drink any yourself. THis stuff is super contagious. Even a single drop might be able to mess your system up."

"Duly noted Ms. Shimmer."

"Gotcha."

"Hey, AJ!" Sunset shouted, taking a moment to rip off the headphones encasing her ears.

"Huh? Who said that?"

"It's me, Sunset! You know, Twilight's friend, the one who asked you here."

""Well, Ah'll be! Pleasure to finally get to meet y'all now that yer not all evil and whatnot. Say, have y'all seen our mistresses around?"

"You don;t have a mistress Applejack, you never have. The Sirens ambushed you and brainwashed you with their blueberry juice."

"Now that sounds ripe-plumb ridiculous! Ah've always been an obedient berry to my mistresses."

"We must disagree highly Applejack. You've always been faithful t family and apples, not the sirens who've sorely tricked you," Luna spoke stroking AJ's side.

"And how would y'all know that?"

"Because We've been in your dreams Applejack."

"Wait a sec...Princess? Argh!" Applejack's face scrunched up as her brain sparked with mixed signals, old memories battering to be reawakened against new commands.

"What in the hay is wrong with your Applejack?! Doesn't she know how important being a blueberry is?!" EqRainbow Dash questioned, flailing her tiny hands in disbelief that anypony wouldn't be able to comprehend the importance of being such a magnificent fruit.

"Alright then, let's go get your world's AJ and go blueberry on her flank." "Rainbow, I hardly think that rushing in is going to do any...." "Actually Rarity, Rainbow's right. Without a leader, the apples will be helpless to resist turning back into blueberries. Especially if we convert Twilight back to Midnight." Rarity nodded at the logic, trying hard not to glare at RD's smug face. "Well....what about the Dazzlings? We've been waitin fer them to come back only to just now hear this happening." Sunset shrugged at Applejack's remark. "Last thing I knew about them was that Applejack sent them into the forest after turning them into apples. They might have returned so keep your eyes peeled. Now that we're all in agreement, let's go!"
As much as the group wanted to merely charge up the stairs, the three had to account for the size and mobility of their new rebel blueberries. After a few minutes of climbing and pushing, the berries, hybrid, humans and dog made their way back into the library. "My sister is aware we're here, once she sees us on the security cameras she will alert the others. As for that blueberry-hater, I think she is in the gym setting up for a conversion show for if she catches you." Rainbow nodded at the blueberry-apple's notice and grinned. "Well then, let's get rolling!"

Celestia stared at the screen showing the library doors with suspicious eyes. "The one room we didn't put cameras in and it had to be there." She sighed, Luna should have given those non-apples a taste of apple life by now. Without warning, the doors burst forward and Celestia rolled forward in hope. Hope that was turned to anger when she saw that not only were the fugitives not apples, but that her own sister was once again tainted by blueberry juice. Leaning far to reach the intercom button, a small click was all that was needed before Celestia put on the alert. "Attention all apples, our little fugitives are loose in the halls. They have blueberry girls in their possession and have turned Vice Principal Luna into a hybrid! All possible measures must be taken to ensure our mistress is safe!" Upon hearing the news, all the apples in the school were on the approach. The group had no worries however as there was one thing truly positive about being a blueberry: Round shape= greater mobility!

EqAJ chuckled as she heard the intercom news. "Yah see Twilight? Us apples always have an extra eye over everything, somethin yer blueberry ways didn't have." "I know Mistress Applejack." Twilight said as she looked over the apple-themed stage with pride, "What was I thinking? Being a blueberry was ridiculous. By the way, are you sure they'll be here in time for the celebration?" "The Dazzlings? Ah wouldn't be surprised if they're already back and......" Applejack's talk was cut short by the sound of doors slamming open. Taking in a deep breath, she turned around to see the rebels standing before her. "Ain't this a suprise? This saves me the trouble of having to hunt yah'll down mahself. Why don't yah'll just get on the stage and ah'll tell Celestia to call to students here?" The blueberry AJ rolled forward with a scowl on her blue face. "Bein an Apple may be a great thing, but bein the fruit is when it goes too far. Yah'll need to learn respect fer the only fruit worthy of such a transformation." The apple shrugged and motioned at Twilight. "Twi, could yah'll take take of this fer me?" Twilight nodded though not without the slightest bit of hesitance for hurting her friends. She went forward, ready to defend her mistress.

Ahh,,ahhhh,ahhhh,ahhhhh,shoo-bop, dah-wahhhh,ahhh, Mistress Midnight making a comebacka!

Within seconds she was happily sucking away at the whips and her pleas entry would soon be matched by Luna and Spike. "The beginning of my true life....I will never forget that glorious day." Floating through the hallways of the castle of Blue Divinity (formally the Castle of Friendship), she was followed by a mare who attempted to overthrow her once before she was shown the light. "I trust your studies in the company of the Dazzlings have increased your understandings Starlight?" "Yes, the commanders of what is now known as Canterlot Gardens truly have taught me much about the power of blueberries. They suggest I come back if only to ask when you will visit again." "You may go, tell them I will be back in a day or two, there are some matters I must clear up." "Yes my mistress." Starlight said as she tried to bow down and rolled away. Looking over her window, Midnight laughed upon the mares and stallions she used to believe were equal to her. When she had returned with her berrygirls though they all fell to her. If they were not working on another statue of her or drinking juice from various sources, she didn't care. Unless it involved remembering the important of her and blueberries. Passing by a darkened door, Midnight heard the grunts of her former mentor and her brother, possibly the only ponies left who refused her rule to this point. They never have broken their resolve but sooner or later. "Mistress Midnight!" Midnight turned to find her world's Rainbow: Captain of the Blue bolts before her. "The festival The Obediant and Blueberried Trixie has created in honor of your first year of discovering Blueberry dominance is ready. She is humbly waiting for you to come and open the festivities." With a nod, Midnight teleported both herself and Rainbow out to the stage in front of her castle. "My dear blueberry servants, today marks the first year anniversary of my discovery of the power of blueberries. I have granted it to you, and you all obey me as you should. Already, Equestria is falling under my power and soon I shall control all!" The crowd, both of humans and ponies alike cheered a their mistress's words. "I urge you all to enjoy yourselves my servants. Bask in the glow of your mistress and your chosen fruit." With a collective "Long Live Mistress Midnight Berry!" The crowd watched as the show began.

Midnight chuckled as she let her whips down with a large sword forming on both sides of her body where her hands would have been. Sweetie Belle put her her on the table with half-closed eyes and actually yawned. "Kinda happens when you've already done everything before. Right now, even being a model for Rarity's fashions sounds like a good idea. Applebloom on in the large comforter in thought, seeming to remember something her sister had said. "Hey girls, ah think ah know something we can do! Mah sis was going to pick some wild blueberries at the edge of the orchard. We make snacks and all kinds of desserts out of them and she said if ah helped then I'd be one of the ones to get first pick!" Both Scootaloo and Sweetie Belle jumped up at this notice. "Well, what are we doing here and not over there? You know where the berries are?" "Sure do...ah think....anyways let's go!"

Such beauty...you just keep getting riper by the second. You're going to make such a perfect blueberry when you're ready."

With all of the pleasure and pollen surrounding Applejack and her new body, she wasn't even able to say another thank you. As far as she knew though, blueberries didn't need to speak anyways.

Maybe simpler blueberries, but you my dear are a special one indeed. A vine caressed the girl's stomach as the voice continued. If a blueberry is special enough, I can choose to grow it for a special purpose. True, your nature and destiny is no different than any other blueberry, but you have the ability to help my berries grow and flourish. For now though, just relax and let your loving caretaker take care of you.

"How much farther?" "Mah sis said the bushes are on the far side of the orchard, we won't be much farther." "But that's what you said five minutes ago." "Well this time ah mean it. In fact, ah think ah can see the bushes over...." Without another word, Scootaloo and Sweetie Belle rushed forward while dragging their friend along.

The girls rushed along, snaking past fallen logs and shrubs before stopping at a dead halt before a miasmas of blue swirling about in the air. Each too a careful step back, careful to avoid making contact with whatever anomaly was before them.

"What in the hay is that stuff?" Scootaloo asked.

"Ah have no idea! But mah sis might be stuck in it, we outta check to be sure!" Applebloom said, preparing to charge into the mists.

"Hold up!" Sweetie Belle yanked her friend back. "We have no idea what that stuff can do to us! We need something to protect ourselves..." Applebloom rolled her eyes, covering her mouth with the top of her shirt.

"There. Protected." And with that, she charged once more into the mists beyond.

1232.content:
Applejack groaned as she moved to her chemistry class, her distaste clear on her face. She didn't hate the class, that wasn't the problem. The problem sat upon a certain girl that sat directly next to her. As she walked into the class, Applejack scowled at the very sight of the girl sitting the the desk next to her own. "Howdy Juicy Berry." Applejack said without even lookin to her. "Howdy herself Applejack." Juicy said in an equally unfriendly tone.

Juicy Berry. The minute her family came into town, things just seemed to fly south for Apple Jack's enjoyment. The Blueberry family might not be as widespread or as well known as the Apple family, but they seemed to be getting closer every day. Applejack and her family were never bothered by any Blueberry family members until Juicy Berry and her family moved in. The family immediately took up land not too far off from Sweet Apple Acres and started cranking out blueberry products like nobody's business. Some customers who weren't apple fanatics or close friends of the Apple family started turning their heads and wallets to the new family. Despite this, Applejack had tried to be friendly. However, when she had gone to the farmer's market one day. She became enraged at a blueberry stand standing where her family's stall usually went. That was when she first met Juicy Berry and the two certainly didn't hit it off. They were almost identical in personality except for one small difference. Juciy Berry seemed to be unbelievably certain that her family was better. She would often say to Applejack how her family would be working at Berry Blue Fields by the end of the year. The two bickered often and threats and a few sabatoges were flinged every now and again. The two had become quite the rivals, and nothing any of AJ's friends could say would keep AJ from such.

"So how does it feel AJ? Having to sit next to yer future employer?" She always asked that question. Applejack groaned at the girl's words, sick and tired of every day of this. Juicy smirked at AJ when she wasn't looking. Applejack didn't know it, but this time she was serious. Soon AJ would be a happy friend of both her and the Blueberry family.

Once all was assured and her sister put to bed, she flciked down her own lights, snuggled deep into her sheets and gently began to snore, her mind far and away from the tangible world about her.

If only she had sensed the being outside her homestead, who had prepared to strike as the final lights blinked out and silenced for the night. With a quiet grasp, the figure latched a cloth around its Apple victim, ensuring that no opposition would occur. With a mild bonding with thick ropes, the figure placed its Apple into a hardy burlap sack and made with haste to its home ont he Berry Blue Farmstead.

123311221112213231.content:
As if one cue, the vehicle came to a rolling stop, parking itself easily. With a collective nod, the group members got into position and prepared to roll the berrygirls towards their new "home". The back hatch flashed open, revealing a manicured lawn and an extensive estate of mansion. Much of the front looked more to be like an office building, but the back hinted at something far more inviting for the likes of the berried sisters. Rolled along, the group and the berries maneuvered into the enlarged front doors, directed down the nearest hallway and further on.

The halls of the estate were of a pale blue color, many sets of double doors hiding secrets behind them, florescent lights buzzing softly above them all. Soon enough, the lot gathered before a rather impressive set of rich oaken doors. With a knock, a voice called to them.

"Come in please~" Swinging the doors aside, the group rolled the sisters into a spacious office space, a few scant chairs placed before one jet black desk with the high-backed matching chair turned away from its intended audience. "What have you brought me today Cream team?"

"Madame President, we've gotten two more subjects, recovered from the Sweet Apple Acres. Appearances suggest farm hands or family workers. Highly addicted towards our "A La Mode" enhancers and having ripeened extensively," the first member replied, bowing before the chair. It swiveled to reveal a rather tall woman, still young but with a domineering face and an icy cool to her eyes. The stranger part was how her skin shone, a deep and saturated violet color glowing from her form.

"You've done me well Cream team. Please, leave me to these two. I must shower them with my love before I decide what fate will befall them."

"O-of course Madame President..." the first member nodded, ushering the others towards their lab for further developments. Now, left alone, the two berries were at the mercy of one Madame President Violet Hue.

"Welcome my darling blueberries to your new home here at the Berry Foundation! Mama Violet is here tomake sure you get all the loving you'll need to grow and ripe into the perfect berries for the rest of your lives~"

Come pick them up in my office, and if either of them gets hurt I'll tear out your vocal cords and keep digging until I reach you lungs." Unfazed by the calm and cutely saw Violet said that, a voice on the other end said "Important berries, got it." Nodding and releasing the finger from the button, Violet went back to snuggling against the two big berries.

Within a few minutes, the door opened and a being wearing a mask covering their mouth came in. "Madame President?" Violet sighed at the thought of letting go but did so quickly. "Remember, not a hair or juice drop ruined or so help me. Oh and check in with the Cream team to make sure they weren't followed." "Yes Madame President."

She couldn't make out any facial features, but only seemed to see round shapes.A few loud rings signaled the shower was coming to a close and Starlight felt the locks releasing. Taking one last glance, her eyes widened. "No! Nonono...." Starlight ran off, wanting to get as far away from the door as possible. As she turned the corner out of sight, the double doors slammed open revealing Violet with no changes whatsoever. "I've been drinking berry juices for years Glimmer! I can't be berried! Which is more than I can say for you!" In hindsight, Violet had long suspected Starlight was against her work. She had rarely attended the foundation's gatherings and always took way too long when she filed reports over her actions. "Be a good group of berries my dears and go give Starlight a little 'push' for Mama."

Hearing those words, Starlight's blood froze over with panic claiming her stomach. Gotta go fast! Gotta get outta here! Her feet revved up and shot off down the winding hallways, streaking and striking the floor at breakneck speed in the vain hope of outspeeding her once loyal band of berries. She should have known better than to put faith into a bunch of mindless, juice-addled ballooned berrygirls, but what choice did she have?

"...*smack*...starlight...*smack*...come...and...*smack*...play..." the voices of the berried girls called out, waddling here and there in their search for Mama Violet's next target. As best as they tried, none of the could hope to catch up to Starlight, who had managed to reach the flight of stairs leading up to the next floor's labs.

"Once I'm up there, I can break for it through the south exit..." she huffed between wheezed breaths, taking the stairs tree at a time. Once at the top, she turned back one more time before rushing inside the double doors, locking them tight and barracading them to ensure her safety. "And now, to escape this crazy place!"

The only problem was that she had the physique of a human being, albeit a slight pooch in the stomach. "Sorry...who are you?" The blue girl said in a southern accent while holding her white head in her hands. "Ah...can't...*smack* remember...squeezing....than...fog clearing...so...*smack*...hard to...think..." While the plight of this girl was pitiful, Starlight saw it as a chance to help expose Violet and end all this. "Listen to me very carefully. I need to get you out of here, these people mean to give us trouble. Do as I say, understand?" The blue girl nodded before banging came from the locked door. Starlight grabbed the girl's hand and ran quickly yet stealthily. "Do you at least remember your name?" "Ughh...*smack*....name's....Applejack...."

1331.content:
"Ah yeah! First one home!" Rainbow Dash exclaimed as she raced up the stairs to her home. After what felt like a rather stressful early start to the school year, it was awesome for her to have the Labor Day weekend to look forward to. "And with no homework, that means I can do whatever and have that last wee fo Summer I wanted!" Her wide grin further expanded as she noticed the day's mail. And not only that, but a pachage nonetheless.

"Huh, wasn't expecting a package...oh well, hope it's something cool!" she beamed as she snatched up the mail while unlocking the front door. Stepping inside, she flicked through the letters not addressed to her before throwing them aside upon the kitchen table.

"What a bunch of junk! Nothing but bills and advertisements!" she momentarily ranted. "Well, except this thing. Wonder what's inside?" Her imagination raced as her own form raced up to her bedroom upon the second floor. Safe and sound within the confines of her room, Rainbow jumped oto her bed and tore away at the edges of the box. Once no longer an obstacle, Rainbow plunged her hand into the darkness of the box and trawled back a catch of a letter and what seemed to be a package of gum.

"Weird, only gum? Maybe it's one of those sponsership kind of things," she thought aloud as she uncrupled the letter and gave it a read:

Dear Rainbow Dash,

Hi! This is a letter from your absolute biggest fan! I've been watching you since first started playing here at CHS and I wanted to show my appreciation for your awesomeness! Sorry if it doesn't seem like much, but I've been working on it for quite a while and I think its ready for you to try. It's a special kind of gum that can give you the taste of three courses while still keeping you in perfect shape! Hope you like it!

Sincerely,
~Your Biggest Fan

"Woah! That's so sweet! And three courses huh? Well, guess it's as good a time as any to give it a try!"

Applejack carried a basket over her head as she walked through the orchard. It was unlikely that any of the apples were ripe so soon but her brother was form over taking an early search. Glancing about the trees, Applejack took a moment to appreciate the visible health of the trees. Thier thick trunks, thier oversized height that would make her feel like a child, their leaves which would change color from green to yellow, orange, blue,red.......

Applejack stopped and turned to the tree, where did that blue color come from? Glancing into the trees, AJ could indeed see a blue color within the leaves. A blue color that was periodically shifting about. AJ growled as she put the basket down and walked to the tree. "It's too early fer this." Kicking the tree in a manner described to her by the Equestrian Twilight, AJ marked an X in a specific spot in the dirt. A few weak leaves fell down, followed by an eaten Apple core, which was then followed by the body of a teenager falling right on the X. "Darn it Rainbow, this is the third time this week." AJ knelt down and prepared to slap her friend silly. As she lifted her head though, she noticed the girl was still sleeping. Within that moment, a small thought entered the cowgirl's head. It was time to give Rainbow a punishment she wasn't about to forget.

"rainbow.....Rainbow....." The athletic girl yawned, thinking to herself. "Wow...that was an awesome power nap. Now to get out of the orchard before Applejack fi.....why can't I move my arms?" It was true, Rainbow couldn't move her arms or her legs for that matter. Opening her eyes, Rainbow found herself surrounded by large barrels with spouts of different sizes. In front of her was Applejack, smiling like a fox in an unguarded henhouse. "Hey AJ. Uhhhh...how's it going?" "Oh fine, fine really. Ah was just walkin through the orchard and looking about when ah noticed that ah had a trespasser." Rainbow gulped. "Uhhhh.....you better talk to Fluttershy then...." "Don't go playin dumb with me! Anyways, ah wondered what ah was gonna do with the dear and had an idea." Applejack pulled a jar of what appeared to be blue jelly from behind her. "We've got a load of jelly and after all that sleeping ah bet yer hungry."

"By the will of your goddess, you name shall serve as a reminder of how you have brought me to the light of my divinity. I name you: Bushel Brightwell!" As Rainbow said this, she squished the blueberry over Bushel's head now cemement her name into her. "Thank you your blue divinity. I have a gift for you as well." With another double clap, a blueberry larger then either berrywoman opened up and a glorious apparel was revealed. It was a large green toga similar to a leaf with a small crown of golden blueberries and matching golden blueberry earrings. "It is the dressings of the goddess, which is you now. It will be much better suited for you then those drop pesant clothes your wearing." Rainbow nodded and with a flash of magic, her new harp was on and her old clothes vanished to oblivion. "Thank you Bushel, now I must visit my subjects so they may bask in my glory." "Your people will be pleased Rainbow: Goddess of Blueberries." Taking a deep breath, Rainbow pulled herself from the dream world and back into the world of mortals. Breathing in the glorious Mist of Meditation one more time, she waved her hands and it all vanished. The iron door opened and Ocean Blue stood in a reverant position. "Our Goddess has truley returned to us....our age of decline is at an end." With her regal tone, Rainbow jiggling with prude while saying. "Yes Ocean my servant, you are all blessed to be in my presence. My first act as goddess of my people is...."

13332112121121.content:
"...That we pack up what little we have among these ruins and mkae for an exodus to a new land: one of true bounty and prosperity. Come, gather the masses and tell them to gather their belongings. We shall make our way very soon," Rainbow decreed.

"A-as you wish Goddess," Ocean replied, whisking the two guards with her out into the throngs of the dank ruins. For her part, Rainbow rolled along the winding hallways and passages up and around to reach a minor plateau resting above the homestead of the berried people.

"My, how has our home fallen. Surely, there must be a land of salvation beyond this mess of a jungle." Her gaze traced along a rushing river, watching the channel flow far and along towards what seemed to be a flaccid lake not incredibly far off. "There! That is our place of being!"

"It's a lovely location, is it not Goddess?" Ocean asked, having snuck up upon her patron deity.

"It will be perfect my servant, perfect for all of us..."

133321121211211.content:
"Yes...." Ocean said, "Soon our hundred or so tribes folk will be ready for a new age." Rainbow turned to Ocean in surprise. "Hundred? Is that truley all we have?" Ocean's smile disappeared as she looked to the ground below. "Without a goddess, our people began to wither away like the berries that once grew in the gardens. My mother would tell me stories of how our tribe was once thousands strong until the disappearance of the last goddess. Our people became fearful, fearing the changing world and powers of those changes. However, we have a goddess once more." Ocean's smile returned and a hopeful glance came with with. "Yes my servant, soon our tribe will be as strong as it once was. When will my subjects be ready for our exodus?" "Within the hour your juiciness. I have informed them to come to the courtyard once they are ready."

As Ocean foretold, an hour hadn't yet before the tribe was assembled. All looked in awe at the large figure up above, knowing her to be the goddess they were hoping for. "My subjects..." Rainbow began in a loud yet regal tone, "for too long have you watched as this tribe withered away. Now your goddess has come to bring you all a new future of greatness! Sadly, we must leave this land as it is no longer suitable to sustain us. Our journey will not be tiresome however, for I have seen a suitable place for our tribe to regrow!" The people below cheered at the proclamation as Rainbow began to float in midair. Follow me my subjects, TO OUR FUTURE!" Without hesitation, the tribespeople turned into the direction their goddess was drifting.

Within minutes, the berry-bodied diety came to the ground, leading her people in the direction of the lake that would mark their new home. As she rolled along, the divine aura radiating from Rainbow came into contact with the flora and fauna around her. Within seconds, the greens of the forest began to be overshadowed by a more blueish tone. Vines and trees hit the ground or shortened and plumped up. The hard ground under the tribe softened, becoming like clouds under them. The mark of the goddess became etched into the trees and ground, showing they were touched by Rainbow Dash: Goddess of Blueberries. Those behind their goddess looked in awe at the Majesty before them. With this sign cementing Rainbow's divinity into them, the loads they carried were no longer so heavy.

From way within her hut, she could tell something was wrong. The mask was glowing, it shouldn't have been glowing. It hadn't glowed for more than 30 years when she saw the being trapped. She took it off and began to examine it further. The dark indigo color was indeed flashing ad mid the sky blue tones of the mask. With the odd cutting for the cheeks, it seemed an unusual mask for wearing. It was not a mask to wear, rather a mask of caution. Caution of a tribe she thought was long forgotten. She had to investigate, she could only hope what she was witnessing was wrong. Grabbing her cloak and hiding her black and white markings, she pointed the mask around her and headed out. "The signal is close and yet so faint, the start of the journey there is no debate. A member was here not long ago, now my guide her place you must show." Zecora burstfrom her hut, following the glow of the mask.

13332112121121122.content:
Settled pleasantly for another long night of scribing her mythical adventures into the pages of fiction for the mass audience and her publishers, A.K. Yearling was at ease. Sure, her most recent adventure had left her with a few more scrapes and bruises that were hard to write off for anyone who saw her, but the thrill of returning the Crystal Horseshoes of Akahorse to their rightful owners was exactly what she lived for.

"A real shame it doesn't come up more often, things have been getting quiet around here lately," she sighed before noticing a faint glow of sapphire blue from her study. Trotting across the way and nosing into the overstuffed room of trinkets, she found one of her many ancient masks shimmering with a brilliant aura about it.

"And there I go, running my mouth again..." Yearling snorted, knowing all too well what it meant. "In thirty years, never did I think these idiots would be at it again. Wonder who they suckered into their little cult this time?" With a heavy sigh, Yearling placed away her glasses and fished up her typical attire for her line of work, readying for another adventure back into the depths of Vaccinium Jungle.

133331.content:
Rainbow Dash, arguably the best athlete in Canterlot High with records and trophies to back up the claim. Well liked by her peers and even deemed loyal by many. A girl embued with magical friendship horse powers shared by her closest friends. With this, the Dash was capable of the impossible. Tonight however, she faced a threat that even her magical might could not stand up against. The ever present, unstoppable, limitless evil of....

"BOREDOM!!" Rainbow groaned as she flipped through the tv channels. "Over 1004 channels and all of them are nothing but BOREDOM. Even the sports channels are just showing replays." Rainbow's thumb kept clicking the guide button, hoping that some late night movie was bound to start soon. For a moment, Rainbow glanced to the piles of finished homework stuffed into her bag and sighed before turning back to the screen. Again and again the channel number went up as Rainbow sank lower and lower into her seat and again and again she was uninterested in what layed before her. She wasn't even looking at the remote anymore, so she had no idea her thumb was sliding gently away from the intended target. In an instant, her thumb hit the number 3 along with the guide button. What came onto the screen next baffled Rainbow. The channel number specified read Channel 1.w3, which was odd enough but the real spectacle was on screen. The screen showed a oddly lit indoor stadium with few people lining the rather small bleachers. Inside a plastic dome area, Rainbow was amused to find large, ball-shaped beings rolling around and into each other. It was hard to see thier faces but they were definitely feminine and and many shades of blue to boot. Rainbow couldn't help but snort at the spectacle, especially the rather tight looking bodysuits the women were wearing. The camera panned onto one green suited woman being pushed by two red suited ones. With a shove, the green suited ball was pushed into a goal similar to a soccer goal. "Goal! That two points more for the Juicy Scores and it looks like time is about up so....wait!" The camera panned again to another green suited woman charging at another red suited...berry person?....set in front of a ramp. Within seconds, the person was sent flying into a ring a few feet above the goal. "I don't believe it! That ten points was all the Raging Brightwells needed to pull back to the lead! And with that bell the clock has run out! It is Raging Brightwells 16 and Juicy Scores 12, this has been an excellent game of Blueberry Derby which you can only find on channel 1.w3: The best in sports so unusual, the big wigs and snobs refuse to call them sports. If you out there wish to get in on this action, go to the website listed on your screen. Goodnight from all of us here at the Apploosa Stadium and keep your ball rolling!" As the screen faded to static, Rainbow sat on her seat in awe of what she had witnessed. Her mind quickly locked the website name (www.berryderbyrollers.com) into it's vaults. Hopefully there was no school tomorrow because she knew where she was spending her time. Whatever this sport was, Rainbow was about to find out all she could. Quickly turning to her phone, Rainbow checked tomorrow's date.

1333312.content:
Rainbow smirked as the word Saturday came up in tomorrow's date. For now, she needed some sleep but when tomorrow came.....

Rainbow looked to her laptop in interest. She had just pulled up the website from last night and was taken straight to a condensed rule guide.

Blueberry Derby is a sport where two groups of ten girls inflate to large blueberries and try to push members of the opposing team into a goal. Game can be set to time or point limit. Use of hands and feet is prohibited unless the rules of the specific tournament say different. At least six girls should be on the field at all times while the other wait on the sidelines to be tagged....

Even condensed there was a lot to go over, size requirements for berries, field types, weather conditions, optional tools. Rainbow's curiosity drove her to look deeper into the website. There was an ordering service for official bodysuit for the nonsewing type, shades of juice that do and don't count as blueberry and the steps used to inspect, there was even an area for accessories and a link to a Buckstarter page for a Blueberry Derby video game. What really caught Rainbow's eyes however was a tab reading "Age groups." Curious, Rainbow clicked it and was surprised to find a few different age groups....including one the enveloped more of the girls in her school! "So...if we wanted to....hmmm....is there a trophy involved?" Rainbow types her words in and found there was indeed a keepable trophy. In fact there were different levels ranging from city to world champion. That settled it in the athlete's mind, "Get ready Blueberry Derby world. Cause Rainbow Dash is about to enter the scene! According to the website, there was actually a tournament in Canterlot happening in a few months and sign ups were already in effect. "Alright, I'm sure my friends are gonna love this so they'll be in. We are gonna need more players though, but we'll think about that later. Right now, I need to get my friends on board." Grabbing her laptop, Rainbow rushed out to find the first of her friends and hopefully one who will have the others close by: Pinkie.

Rainbow blazed with speed along the sidewalk leading her to Pinkie's house. Grass burred, voices were a mere whiz as her feet jettisoned across the pavement and along stray patches of dirt. Nothing could stop her beyond the rare halting hand of a "do not walk" sign. Nevertheless, she hopped the fence into Pinkie's yard with a second shaven from her previous record and promptly knocked on the door.

"Just a minute!" came the singsong voice from behind, The sound of trundling, bounding feet came before the door swung open, revealing one Pinkie Pie. "Oh, hey Dash! What's up?"

"Hey Pinkie! I was wondering if you were free for a few minutes?" Dsh asked, taking a step inside.

"Yeah, I was just hangin' with Juniper and Rarity. The more the merrier!" Pine giggled, leading Rainbow into her living room.

"Rainbow darling, what a surprise!" Rarity greeted her friend with a hug.

"H-hey...!" Juniper nervously waved from the couch.

"Hi Rarty, sup Juniper?"

"This!" Rainbow beamed as she opened her laptop and began to explain the strange anomaly she had encountered the previous night. "And so, I wanna get a team together and win the derby for our age bracket! What do you say?"

13333122221.content:
“We’ll see you later girls, we can meet up at Rarity’s for lunch.” Rainbow said as Rarity hanged up the video call.

“Okay then that only leaves Applejack and Fluttershy left, then we can focus outward, and figure out how we’re going to practice. Have you gotten word from Fluttershy or Applejack yet?” Rainbow Dash said.

“Unfortunately, AJ and Fluttershy aren’t answering their phones. I tried sending them texts and voice mails…” Pinkie replied.

“Well…” Rainbow interrupted, not worried and knowing there was some good explanation, “AJ probably got chores to do, and Fluttershy usually likes some quiet time by herself. We should just visit them in person.”

“That’s a great idea, Rainbow Dash. Wanna come along Rarity?”

“Uh, no thank you dear. I would like to get started on the outfits as quickly as possible if you don’t mind.” Rarity answered, as she finished her notes on the uniform guidelines and then returned Rainbow’s laptop.

“Thanks Rarity.” Rainbow said, “Oh, and Juniper, could go down to Twilight’s? We need to make sure Sunset can pass inspection, and don’t worry I’ll email you the inspection guide.”

“Sure thing, Rainbow.” Juniper answered.

The four teens were ready to head out with things to do. Rainbow Dash and Pinkie Pie would take the bus to try to recruit AJ and Fluttershy, and Juniper, with a copy of the blueberry inspection rules in tow, had headed out to see if the now blueberried Sunset. Rarity rode her bike back to her home to get straight to work on the bodysuits. Pinkie and Rainbow walked down to bus stop and just caught the bus making its stop.

On the bus, Rainbow did some brief extra research back on the blueberry derby website for a short while and discovered in addition to the trophy, the tournament was also giving out title belts and spectacularly large cash prizes for the winners in addition to the trophies. For Rainbow’s Age bracket of course, the money would only be available in the form of a scholarship, unless there were some emergency expenses that needed to be paid off. The was championship belts are what caught the athlete’s attention far more than the money. The large belt was designed with plates of blue tinted platinum with gold and silver accents, decorated with blue gemstones such as Lapis Luzlis, aquamarines, diamonds, and a large blueberry shaped sapphire in the center. Rainbow just pictured it being hanged on one of the walls in her bedroom, or maybe how it would look on her, both normally and blueberried. Unfortunately, that feeling faded from her face after a minute when she realized getting her two friends to join was starting to look realistically impossible.

“Something wrong, Rainbow?” Pinkie asked noticing her friend’s gloom with concern.

“I’m fine, it’s just… I’m thinking this is going to be a tough sell. Fluttershy is just not into sports and AJ can be conservative and stubborn. Recruitment really been hit and miss, and I really wanted all of us to be in this together.”

"Don't worry Rainbow Dash, they'll come around. Applejack has always been there for you, And Fluttershy is full of surprises sometimes, so you don’t know what to expect. I bet even Twilight and Rarity will open up and change their minds once they give it some more thought.” Pinkie assured her friend, putting an encouraging hand on Rainbow Dash’s shoulder.

“Your right! Thanks Pinkie” Rainbow said as her confidence came back. The bus arrived at the duo's destination...

Pinkie could make out the light from the TV, with Fluttershy staring intently at whatever seemed to be on. At this time, Rainbow was digging through her pockets with a concerned look as if trying to find something. "Let's see here, I know I have that spare key in here somewhere. Just where...aha!" Pulling a key from her front pocket, Rainbow turned the lock and consequently the handle. "Hey Fluttershy!" Pinkie exclaimed as she rushed into the house, "Would you like to join a club were making!?" Rainbow Dash half expected Fluttershy to have a heart attack the way Pinkie barged in without warning. Her eyes just stayed glued to the television screen as her friends glanced around. Understandably worried for her friend, Pinkie poked the yellow teen in the head while Rainbow glanced to whatever Fluttershy was watching. Rainbow was surprised to see a review of the very Blueberry Derby game she had seen last night. A small squeaks of surprise told Rainbow that Fluttershy had been sucked back into reality. "Oh! Girls, I didn't realize you were coming!" "We tried to call you Flutters but you weren't awsnering your phone so we came in." Rainbow turned to her friend and pointed to the tv with a quizzical glance, to which Fluttershy quickly flipped the channel. "Umm, I don't know how that for there. I was just looking for....ummm...." Fluttershy sighed as she realized there was no way she could lie out of this if she wanted to. "Alright...what you saw was a sport called Blueberry Derby and...I find it so....fasinating. Watching all those women filled with juice and rolling it just...oooo I love it. But I figured you guys would find it embarrassing so I didn't tell you. It just sucks you in it's so fasinating." Pinkie raised Fluttershy up while Dash smiled with the knowledge this was easier than expected.. ""Ya know Fluttershy, I've been enjoying Blueberry Derby as well. In fact, there's a tourney going on in town soon and I'm looking for recruits to join me in taking it on." Fluttershy's eyes went wide and a smile stuck to her face that got even wider. "Yes. Yes! Rainbow, sign me up. If our friends are getting into the sport than believe me I am going to love this." "Really?" Pinkie asked, confused by the rather upbeat nature if her usually calm and shy friend. "Are you sure you won't be bothered by the people staring and the bouncing into berries and things like that?" "Well of course I will be a little worried Pinkie, but I been wishing to have a chance to be a Derby berry and I am not going to pass this up!" "Perfect!" Rainbow exclaimed as she hugged Fluttershy tightly. "Come on girls, let's get to AJ and see what she thinks."
133331222211.title: Shy sure, but a fan of berries as well.

choices: Fluttershy has an idea: a secret B.D fan club, which she's a member of.
Pinkie suggests they check in with Juniper, Sunset, and Twilight
Cut to Rarity, as she's working on the suits, she opens up to joining the team.
1333312222111.content:
“Excellent! Just let me get something girls.” Fluttershy said. She headed to her room and pulled out a blue duffel bag from under her bed. It was used to store the Blueberry Derby apparel and souvenirs she collected and some other things. She opened it and got out some blue baseball caps resembling the upper half of a blueberry for her and her friends to wear. Fluttershy then put the duffel bag’s strap over her shoulder and headed back outside with Pinkie and Rainbow.

“Aw thanks, Fluttershy!” Pinkie said, “You’re full of surprises today.”

         The three of them made their way sprinting towards the apple orchards of Sweet Apple Acres. When they arrived they found no one home. The apple trees all looked stressed from the heat and several had some heavy damage from pest damage. When Pinkie took a look into the farmhouse, it was of empty of furniture, floors were water damaged, and the ceiling had a gaping hole that lead to what looked like a bathroom. The three teens had such concern for their friend is that they briefly forgot about blueberry derby. They found Applejack in the barn loading the family truck with crates and kegs.

“Hey Applejack…?” Rainbow asked in concern.

“Ah can't talk to y'all. Ah’m going to be very busy for next couple of days.” Applejack told them, not making eye contact.

“What going on Where's everyone?” Fluttershy asked.

“Granny and Big Mac are at the farmer's’ market and ah just dropped Apple Bloom off at Scootaloo’s.” AJ answered, applying some rope to tie her cargo on to the truckbed

“What happened here? Everything was was all bright and sunny when we were here last week.” Pinkie asked.

“Ah’m sorry, but..” Applejack turned to face her friends, “We’ve caught ourselves a bit of a debt problem ‘ere at Sweet Apples.”

“Debt problem?” Fluttershy asked, only for the farm girl to point to a notice taped to the farmhouse front door. Rainbow Dash walked up and ripped the tape out and read the collection note out loud.

“Predat Lenders: Collection Notice!? If loan is not repaid in the coming months, Property will be seized and residents will be evicted!?” Dash read aloud with fear and concern.

         Predat Lenders, Rainbow Dash heard that name from overhearing some gossip at school. It was foreign money lending company that set up an office in Canterlot months ago. One good look at them screamt trouble. A few family farms who thought they were getting cheap and affordable loans found out that Predat Lenders blantly lied in their contracts, 8% interest turned out to be 40%, and Five years turned out to be five months. And when they couldn’t be able to pay, they ended up having their lands taken and worse, their livelihoods razed and burned to the ground.

         Some of the more extreme rumors the tomboy heard was that the thugs were getting involved with some sort of demonic power. one rumor was these mobsters were going to be summoning carnivorous animal-like demons, the other rumor was they were the demons themselves, and the loan company was merely a front. While Dash had dismissed those last two rumors as ridiculous, she hadn’t worried herself about them, because mainly the predatory lenders’ threats always fell flat at school. The principals Celestia and Luna have both stood up to them and got them to leave on multiple occasions, and the police were investigating them

“It all started when we noticed water on the ceiling. When mah brother took a look he discovered our whole second floor was startin to collapse The plumbin was burst, the joists were rotted, the beams were being eatin by termites, and the upstairs floors began started ta sink. We needed some serious money to make repairs, but due the drought an' pest problems that been going on, the harvest wasn’t able to cover it. Mah family tried to avoid those creeps but all the banks didn’t wanna lend us the money. Grr… Predat Lenders must of threatened them, that I know. When we did get the loan, We were hit with a forty percent interest hike immediately and they want all that money upfront. Make matter worse, If even we sell the farm to those monsters, it still wouldn’t enough to pay off the loan, and those dang gangsters said they’ll turn the farm into a weapons factory. Just like what happened at that blueberry farm.”

The three teens then remembered what they came to Applejack about .

“Oh that reminds me AJ and sorry if this comes off as bad timing but,” Rainbow said, “We’re forming a Blueberry Derby team!”

“Blueberry what?” a confused Applejack asked.

“It’s a sport where women get into teams, inflate into large blueberries filled with juice and ram each other into goals.” Fluttershy explained, excited and utterly unashamed in explaining her secret passion.

“I found out about Blueberry Derby last night. There’s going to be a tournament for it for girls our age, and I plan on getting our friends together and winning it.” Rainbow announced.

“Inflate like what!?!…” Applejack taken a bit by the premise of the sport before regaining her composure, “Wow, yah wanna compete in anything don’t ya sugarcube? Even if ah loved to join yas, Ah need to be watchin the farm, those predators could be seizing Sweet Apple Acres at any moment.”

“We can use the farm for practice,” Pinkie proposed, “The fields you got is perfect for a whole bunch of us soon-to-blueberry girls to bounce around and be on lookout with our big sizes..”

“Ah still don’t see how rollin around like ripe fruit is going to get the Predat Lenders off mah family’s back.”

“You could the Blueberry derby prize money to pay the loan back.” Rainbow said.

“What?” AJ asked.

“The money is usually in the form of a scholarship, but if you told them your family was in a debt emergency, I’m they would happy to convert it into a check.” Rainbow answered, showing the Blueberry derby website on her laptop.

“...Alright, lemme take a good look at it before ah make mah decision.” Applejack said, taking the laptop from Rainbow Dash.

         Applejack’s rigorous study of the Blueberry Derby website made the three of them nervous. Her stetson was tilted down enough that neither Pinkie, Fluttershy, nor Rainbow could see her expression. Aj’s mind was processing all she could about Blueberry Derby The money the Derby was offering was more than enough to pay the Predat Lenders off to the point they couldn’t pull any sort of stunt, and there was enough money left over so the Apple family could finally get the farmhouse repaired. The tournament was took place before the loan deadline by a good three weeks. The website looked legitimate and from the comments from the officials, athletes, and eccentric millionaires financing the whole thing, AJ concluded that they were honest people brought together by their passion in the obscure sport. On the other hand, the farm girl had good reasons to be wary, It’s was a sport Rainbow just heard of and yet they’re all putting their passion into competing into it, especially Fluttershy, who ought to be called Flutter-shameless. In addition, there wasn’t any guarantee they would win the tournament, they would be just rookies going up against more experienced teams. Unfortunately the farm girl couldn't think of a better way to raise money for the debt payment that didn't involve price gouging some unnecessary zeros to the family crop, or the Apple family working 10 jobs per family member every week.

“All right, if this Blueberry tourney money can fend off those loan sharks and save mah home, then ah’m in.” Applejack announced, with some reluctance.

“Excellent! Welcome to the team AJ!!” Pinkie exclaimed, hugging the newest member of Rainbow Dash’s Blueberry Derby team while Fluttershy smiled on.

"How many team members have ya got? Ah'm little certain our circle doesn't meet full team." Applejack asked as Pinkie Pie let go of her.

"True, our team is at six right now and consists as now the four of us, Sunset, and Juniper." RD answered.

Rainbow took her phone out and texted Rarity and Juniper the good news. When she returned to the phone's main menu, she got a good look at the time and was surprised on how, “Okay it’s 10:20, we still have roughly an hour and a half before we have to head out to Rarity’s.”

“Even Rarity’s involved?” Applejack asked.

“You’ll see AJ.” Dash answered her new recruit. “Okay team, we’re ahead of schedule, so... any ideas what next?”
1333312222111.title: Sweet Apple Blues

choices: We need to make a stop in town."
I'll log-on onto a chatroom and talk to the club."
It''ll be a while before the meeting starts so let's focus elsewhere for now."
13333122221111.content:
“I got an idea.” Fluttershy said, pulling out a flip phone that looked like it came from the last decade and had a faceplate of blueberries from her duffel bag.

Fluttershy flipped the phone open, and texted a code to a few phone numbers. She then took a photo of Pinkie, Rainbow, and AJ together and attached it to her texts. Her friends never saw that phone before.

“Uh what did you with that phone Fluttershy?” Rainbow asked.

“I called for a club meeting.” Fluttershy answered.

“Meetin?” AJ asked, confused.

“Well, I found out a few years ago I wasn’t the only girl in school who was a fan of Blueberry Derbies.” Fluttershy explained, “I found out about this secret fan club for the game and while I was nervous at, I joined them and was able to fit in. We meet in secret to watch, discuss, and enjoy everything about the sport without the student body ever finding out. We even pooled our money together to buy tickets for a few blueberry derby games. I know the girls would love to join…”

“Wait there’s a secret Blueberry Derby fan club at school?” Pinkie interrupted excitedly, “How many members are there? Are there any cool secret initiation rituals or anything?”

“ At most: um…” Fluttershy counted her hand, “including me: four, maybe five girls. We’re a very small group.”

“Yah think a sport like this where women become giant fruit would attract guys.” Applejack said to herself.

“So what happens next?” Rainbow asked.

“Well...”
13333122221111.title: Fluttershy has an idea: a secret B.D fan club...

choices: Pinkie and co have good news of thier own
She is called by Juniper and things sound odd
13333122221113.content: As Pinkie and the gang tried to plan out thier next move, things were going very swimmingly over in Rarity's domicile. After wadding up and/or trying a plethora of ideas that fell into her head, she had finally come up with the perfect suit design. "Although normally I would try to add a little more flair to these designs, the girls will need a near seamless surface of they want to roll efficiently." Rarity mumbled to herself as she looked to the bodysuit sketch in front of her. The design was indeed simple, befitting more a gymnast than anything else. "And of course, in line with the 'sport's' guidelines, the material shall be a rather hypoallergenic form of latex. Now what kind of colors shall these suits be?...." As the white skinned teen glanced at the sketch, she tried to imagine on of her friends wearing the suit. Pinkie would really fit in anything and even if she didn't she would somehow make it work. Juniper wouldn't have too much trouble with many colors either.....but 'whatever worked' didn't cut it for Rarity. "Oooohhh, if only the girls would tell me who else is joining...." Rarity stood up with the intent of taking a deep breath to center her thoughts. In one second however, she froze in place. Her eyes had landed on a full body mirror and pose she was near exact to the sketch on her desk. "Mmmm....I wonder......" Rarity's mind began to look at her own self wearing the outfit. A nice fit that wasn't too tight but just enough that she could feel it with every step. Then she heard it in her head, the coos and ohs of people watching her head onto a field in such an outfit with admiration. Then she imagined the juice, filling her up and causing her to slowly expand. The latex squeaking as all of her limbs began to grow, and the feeling of the material against her belly. Pockets at the shoulders and legs for folding them in. Finally, the light shining off the team's suits in the picture of thier trophy, being hung in every sport store that would sell such apparel. "Hmmmm....maybe I could be a blueberry if I wanted to...." With that idea, Rarity's mind was made up and she reached for the phone to ring the girls up.
13333122221113.title: Cut to Rarity, as she's working on the suit...

choices: The girls arrive at Twilight's without incident.
Dash's announcement has got a few CHS girls curious about BD.
The girls discover some competition for the tournament.
133331222211131.content:
Rarity reached her phone and quickly snapped a photo of her suit design sketch. She attached the photo to simple text message and sent it to Rainbow Dash for approval.

Rainbow and company were being driven back into Canterlot since Applejack still had a delivery. AJ herself was the driver while Flutters, RD, and Pinkie got in the back in order from left to right. As they were a few blocks into reaching the farmer’s market, Rainbow’s phone pinged, she got it out and took a look.

“Hey, Rarity just sent me a photo of the suit.” Rainbow Dash said, opening the image and showing it to Pinkie and Fluttershy..

The drawing was in black and white, and used roughly sketch version of Rainbow herself as the model, both normal and blueberried. The suit was latex that covered the body, stopping short of the neck, wrists, and ankles. A series of stripes ran across the uniform, which Rainbow guessed had to resemble... well rainbows. The suit also had a built-in elastic sports underwear for both comfort and support. Rainbow knew Rarity made it with her mind, and she was itching for the color version.

Pinkie’s phone started to ring, and the caller ID said it was from Rarity, the party girl answered and quickly put the call on speaker, “Yell-O Rarity!”

“Hello Pinkie, did Rainbow get my suit design?” Rarity asked.

“She sure did, though she’s wishing for the color version.”

“Don’t worry, I’m still trying to figure out the color pallette, we will want to look our best for when we take to the field after all.”

Rainbow Dash picked up on that, “What do you mean ‘we’?” she asked.

“Remember when I said I wouldn’t take part in the that sport? Well, I gave it some more thought and I changed my mind. If my outfit is going to be stylish and spectacular, than being a blueberry won’t be so bad after all!”

Rainbow, Pinkie, and Fluttershy’s smiles went wide with excitement, while Applejack was just blushed in embarrassment.

“Awesome!” Pinkie said, “I knew you’d come around!”

“Thank you darling. Have you and Rainbow recruited anyone else?”

“We have! Two of them in fact, right Dashie?”

Dash signaled Fluttershy and Applejack to lean their heads close together. Thankfully the truck just arrived at their destination, AJ had put it park and turned off, and she and Fluttershy just got out. Fluttershy beamed excitedly while Applejack’s body language was that of reluctance and nervous. When Rainbow snapped the photo with her phone, she immediately sent it to Rarity.

“I never expected Fluttershy to be the excited one,” Rarity said surprised for a second, “Anyway, I’ll get to work straight away. I’m getting closer to figuring out the color palette. Oh have you thought up a name for the team dear?”

“I uh… no, I haven’t gotten that far yet. I should start thinking about a team name.” Rainbow answered.

“Doncha think you’re going to be busy?” Pinkie asked.

“I have the house to myself currently, I’ll be able to get a prototype ready for you and get some h'orderves for lunch in no time.”

“Awesome, as for us we’re going to help Applejack for a bit then we’ll pick up Sunset and Junie. Ciao!” Pinkie said hanging up.

As Pinkie and Rainbow got out of the truck, the girls had a gotten look at the farmer’s market. At first looked normal with customers present being the same, with several female classmate from school being present, but it was looking emptier than normal because of the fact some of the rural farms were being run out of business by that crooked loan company. As Fluttershy, Pinkie, and Rainbow volunteered themselves and started emptying the truck of its fruity cargo and Applejack headed to the apple stand to tell Big Mac and Granny Smith the news, but she was nervous trying to figure how she was going to leave out the blueberry inflation part.

“You alright?” Granny Smith asked.

“Well, yeah… Uh, Ah just found out some good news. Rainbow formin a team to take on an upcoming tournament called Blueberry Derby an....”

“What’s Blueberry Derby?” Her brother asked.

“That… uh... ain’t important, but the money the tourney’s offerin means we can pay off the loan and we can finally fix our home up good as new so we need some space to practice and...”

“We’re going to be some space because we going to swell into giant blueberries and practice rolling into each other.“ Rainbow revealing what Applejack was too ashamed to talk about.

“Are yah tryin to kill me of embarrassment sugarcube?” Applejack asked, covering half of her face with her left hand.

Applejack's relatives were suprised at the premise but it was clear and without words, they wouldn’t judge her for participating. But what would be a heart’s warming moment was soon interrupted.

“Ke-yahahahaha!”

When that psychotic laughter filled the air, the farmer's market froze in terror. Rainbow, Pinkie, and Fluttershy (the latter hiding behind the former's back) looked around At the front entrance, two of the Predat Lender’s collection goons had arrived to “serve” the community another collection “reminder”. The girls got a good look at him and they weren’t sure he were even human. The one on the right, the Apples learned his name was Hammer Head, seemed normal with tan skin and greyish suit that wouldn’t look out of place in an old gangster movie. However he had eyes that just looked a little farther apart than most people’s do, a skull ridge that look like it was pushed more forward than usual and was covered with a long monobrow, hands that were webbier than normal, but the most prominent feature was the scars that ran across the sides of his neck, they resembled gills and seemed to breathe like such. The other, allegedly named Heckles, was browned skin, white attire that was utterly stained with spots of dirt, and torn all over place. He had the bloodshot eyes of a pyscho, his back was very hunched over, and his stance was very feral looking, almost looking like he was on all fours. The sadistic maniac’s smile seemed to have larger canine fangs than normal. It was obvious that sinister laughter everyone heard had originated from him.

“Well… Well... well well well, I ain’t hearing debts being paid." Heckles observed.

“We don’t want any trouble fellers,” Applejack said, trying to get some peace into the situation. “We…”

Unfortunately she was cut off when Hammer Head grabbed her by the shirt and lifted the farm girl off the ground, “If you wanted avoid to trouble, then you should started paying us back.”

“We can’t even.. fix our home because of your…”

“Otherwise, the liquidating process tends to eat its victims.” Hammer Head threatened, snarling his teeth and watering at the mouth, when he said that last part...

“Leave them alone!”

Hammer Head turned around to see who dared to oppose him. It was Rainbow Dash with her arms crossed.

“So, some little cutlet thinks she stand can up to us. Ke-yehe.” Heckles chuckled.

“Nobody threaten my friends!” Rainbow said, standing her ground.

Dash had gotten a good look into Heckles face’s, and noticed his eyes had a violet-red glow to them, and that Hammer Head’s eyes had that same glow as well. Heckles also gotten a scent of Rainbow Dash and his snarl widened.

“You waded in too deep, stay out this ya brat.” Hammer Head threatened, “Only a fool can think they can pay a debt of their magnitude.”.

“Yeah, once we win the Blueberry Derby Championship, we’re going to be paying off your stupid loan!”

The two thugs never heard of Blueberry Derby so that made little sense, with Heckles bursting out into mad laughter. Clearly they weren’t going to take her seriously.

“Putting your all your money into some made up sport.” Heckles scoffed while his cohort let go AJ, “Don’t make me laugh.”

“Consider yourself lucky, trout. We’re under orders not to start any fights,” Hammer Head then turned other farmers and produce sellers, leaving them with one final threat, growling out loud, “AS FOR THE REST OF YOU, YOU’VE BEEN ON BORROWED TIME LONG ENOUGH! YOUR PAYMENT DEADLINES ARE NEAR! PAY UP OR ELSE!”

As the two Predat Lenders left, Hammer Head stomped a stray apple that had fallen out of the truck, crushing it into pulp as one final show of force. After they left activity resumed but everyone was still on high alert.

“Are they gone?” Fluttershy asked, peeking out of her hiding spot

“Yeah,” Rainbow answered, “Those guys were intense."

“Them loan sharks make the Flim Flam brothers look like... saints. “ Applejack replied, shuddering at the comment she thought she would never say in her life.

Rainbow and her friends had gone up against serval antagonists before, but the Predat Lenders seemed to be a whole new level. Even without the demons summoning rumors, which were looking to be true after that encounter, these thugs were active criminals and there could possibly be more of them.

“Don’t worry, the Blue Rainbows are going those thugs to take a hike.” Rainbow said, finally announcing her Blueberry Derby team’s name.

A look at the time showed was 11:15. The team didn’t have more time to stay here since they had places to be at.

“Okay, It’s getting time. Let’s go pick up Juniper and Sunset.” Dash announced.

She, Fluttershy, and Pinkie got back in the truck with Applejack telling her family.

“We’re going to be need the truck to pick up a few friends.”

Granny and Big Macintosh just nodded, and they waved bye when the girls drove off to next destination.
133331222211131.title: Pinkie and co have good news of thier own.

1333312222111311.content:
The drive was uneventful but the Blue Rainbows had finally arrived Twilight’s place. Pinkie excitedly knocked on the door.

“Juniper, could you answer that?” Twilight asked, wearing a violet hazmat suit and busy handling a flask of juice.

“Sure thing.” Juniper answered, also wearing a hazmat suit at Twilight’s insistence.

When she opened the door, Pinkie hugged her. “Hi Junie!” Pinkie said.

“Hey girls! What brought you here?” Juniper asked.

“We’d thought we give you a hand getting Sunset over to Rarity’s.” Fluttershy answered, excited to see Sunset’s new body after Rainbow told her and AJ what happened to their friend during the drive.

“Uh… Where’s is Sunset anyway?” Applejack asked.

“I put her in quarantine outside, to give her space. We don’t know if...” Sci-Twi replied.

“You do realize we want to become blueberries right?” Pinkie Pie pointed out, "We can’t play Blueberry Derby if we’re not blueberries.”

“...All of you?” Twilight groaned but was surprised when Fluttershy and Applejack both answered yes.

"Yep, I've been secretly a fan of the sport for a while." Fluttershy answered.

"Ah don't have a choice sugar cube." Applejack said.

“So did Sunset pass inspection?” Rainbow asked.

“Well the good news is Sunset passed inspection, but…” Juniper answered

“Excellent, now we have our method of blowing up into blueberries!” Pinkie exclaimed, but Juniper interrupted soon after.

“Yeah about that," Juniper said, there’s um a minor snag. It’s nothing serious but...

13333122221113113.content:
"The spell does seem to be wearing down, Sunset is already shrinking back to human size. As for the juice inside her...well, I put her in quarantine mostly in case she starts leaking."
Applejack and Pinkie looked to each other with disappointment and Rainbow seemed downcast herself. She should have remembered better than getting her hopes up when it came to Twilight and Sunset's experiments. Turning to her friends however, she noticed Fluttershy had a more quizitive glance. "How long has the spell lasted so far?" Although taken aback that it was Fluttershy of all people who asked the question, Twilight put the flask down and thought to herself. "Well... let's see...we started at about....hmm.....I would say at least 20 minutes ago. It could have been longer but...." "Then there isn't a problem." Fluttershy stated in a matter-of-fact tone. "Innings in Blueberry Derby last about as long with grace periods to refill the players." Rainbow slapped her forehead, almost forgetting she had read that on the website.

Twilight bit her lip slightly, it only now dawning on her how serious the girls, especially Fluttershy, were about this sport. She didn't now wither to be suprised or creeped out but didn't let either get in her way. "Well...it wouldn't be too hard to recreate the spell...." "Cool! So, how about we go see Sunset and explains things to her now, huh?"

“Let’s go see Sunset!” Pinkie excitedly said.

         SciTwi just eye rolled and pointed to the bedroom. When Rainbow opened the door, Sunset Shimmer was on the bed lying face up. Her skin was still blue, and her belly was around the size of a basketball. She had a bedsheet on to cover herself, since her clothes she wore before she got inflated were stretched out to elephatine proportions.

13333122221113113121.content:
Sunday afternoon, the Blue Rainbows were at Sweet Apple Acres. The girls were busy establishing a recreation of an official regulation Blueberry Derby playing field on a cleared-out parcel of farmland. The field was best described as a large octagon. The center was of the field flat and open with clear sight of the six large goal nets arranged in the manner of 3 on each half of the play field. Halfway from the goals to center of the pitch were raised ramps to reach the upper goals. Past the goals, posts were staked down and connected with 6 ropes each, acting as the outer boundaries.

Applejack and Sci Twi were making sure the last post was fastened properly. Pinkie was arranging a large amount of Blueberry edibles for guest on a large table with Juniper’s help. Rarity was putting the finishing touches on the outfits, with the first seven outfits completed, with customized lettering and symbols, and she would complete the remaining once the team members were announced. The fashionista was wearing her own uniform as were the other girls. Rainbow Dash, Fluttershy, and Sunset Shimmer (who was back to her normal skin tone and body proportions) were busy hooking up Fluttershy’s laptop to a projector, preparing it to show the website using the barn wall as a projector screen.

“We got company!” Juniper said, seeing the female students of Canterlot High eager to join the Blueberry Derby team. Lyra and Bon Bon both biked to the audition. Trixie was wearing a jogging outfit that implied the magician ran all to the way here. Derpy rode along with Vinyl Scratch who even managed to drag a reluctant Octavia into the tryouts.

“Thanks for coming everyone.” Rainbow said, “I bet wondering, what is Blueberry Derby? Well I just discover the sport two days ago and all I know is one: it’s a sport involving girls become blueberries, and then ramming themselves into goals; two: they hold tournaments for it, and broadcast said tournaments; and three they have offer excellent trophies and large cash for each athlete!”

Fluttershy activated the projector. The prospective athletes gasped and went wide-eyed at everything the website showed to offer any girl who would answer the call of spherical juice-filled spectacle.

“We have a recreation of the course set up that way,” Rainbow continued leading the girls to the derby field. “Here’s how the tryout will work: We’ll be going over drills and practice with me and the rest of the Blue Rainbows. I’ll have several criteria I’ll be judging you girls on several I think would be best for the team, and the ones who show the top marks in them will find herself a surefire position on the team roster. Now we can only register 3 more girls, but don’t get discouraged as we call always use some backup berries. Now get because the tryouts start NOW!”

Rainbow had given her signal to SciTwi to cast the spell. Twilight sighed and began charging her magic. Once the blueberry spell was cast (and with the caster careful not to get caught), the girls soon noticed the blue on their skin and got excited (except Applejack and Octavia). Soon in only a matter of minutes the blueberry derby arena was now filled with 13 large and round blueberry derby girls.

“Do your best everyone,” Rainbow said, “because the first test for the tryouts is going to be…”
13333122221113113121.title: The Tryouts, part one

choices: Derpy manuevers away in time.
