133331222211131131211.content:
“Like all good sports, being agile is essential in blueberry derby. Being still will only make you an easy target. Every move you make will build up your momentum, so you can strike our opponents. You’ll also need quick on your feet… er… uh... body to evade and…”

         “Excuse me,” Octavia bluntly interrupted to ask, “But how are we supposed to move like this?”

         Octavia did raise a valid concern considering the shape she and nearly everyone else was in currently in, a big, blue, and round sphere with their head, hands, and feet sticking out. Rainbow Dash did prepare for that occasion as the teen had spent last night studying up with Fluttershy and the others on how mobility as a blueberry would have worked.

         “It's Easy!" the blueberry Rainbow Dash answered, "All you have to do is find the center axis in your body and then just shift your body. It’s just like one of gyroscope things the astronauts train with. We’ll be doing 10 figure eights’ around the field! We're looking good hustle and mobility here!”

         It’s was a struggle at first as it took the girls a half hour to learn how to roll themselves effectively. After her first lap, Rainbow Dash took a brief look at her blueberry teammates. Almost all of them were enjoying themselves, with Pinkie smiling and giggling when Juniper had bumped into the former’s backside, Rarity admiring how her outfit looked on Sunset, Fluttershy was utterly euphoric being able to live out her fantasy, and Applejack at least she was going to see this sport the whole way through. Among the prospective berries, two girls stood out, Lyra and Derpy. The two of them were the first to figure out rolling and had gotten a head start. Derpy was klutzy as usual, but made up for it with an unpredictable mobility, and her bounces had a long stride to them. Lyra was able to handle corners better and had better top spped then the cross eyed girl. The two of them were heading to one of the ramps, so Rainbow decided to personally test them. Rolling forward, the blueberry captain would try and cut them off. Rainbow used her spine as a spring to launch herself directly into Derpy and Lyra’s path. At the speed Rainbow Dash was going, only one of the auditionees would be able get past her and the other would get launched into a goal.
133331222211131131211.title: The trial of agility.

choices: Three pitiful, miserable former sirens stand on the step
One look and a fight breaks out
13333122223.content:
As the video on the laptop turned off, Rainbow calmed herself as she still needed to find 6 more volunteers. "Rainbow....if I may...." Rarity said with pen already to to paper for design brainstorming, "....even if Applejack and Fluttershy both join in, which might be unlikely in Fluttershy's case, we are going to need to step outside our little circle." "I know Rarity, but who in our school wouldn't want to join in on the blueberry action?" Rarity was already scratching out designs and wading up paper, slightly distracted by the conversation. "Most of them I believe." Pinkie jumped in from the couch with a look of oddity to her face. "She does have a point, I mean it wouldn't be like someone else in the school is trying to make a team for the derby let alone know about it." As the three girls wondered aloud, Rainbow saw Juniper typing into her phone. "Hey J, you could contribute to the team effort over here." "Don't worry Dash, I'm calling some friends I made recently who might want in." Rainbow watched as the once-antagonist started her call, wondering who exactly she was calling.

"Hey girls, I think I might have found something for you three. It's a....well.....I think it might be best if you come over to hear about it." As Juniper relayed the adress to the reciever, Pinkie walked to her shoes with the silent declaration that she was going to get Applejack and Fluttershy. "Okay, see ya later Sonata." Juniper didn't even have time to put her phone back before all three girls swarmed her. "Sonata!?" Rainbow cried first in a mix of rage and disbelief. "You were calling the Dazzlings here!?" "I know you may want friendship dear, but those monsters?!" "Why would you let those meany no beanie hypno horrors into this?" Juniper was taken aback by the shouting and stepped away for a moment, brushing her hair back as she tried to speak up. "You said we needed teammates and I thought those three girls would be fine?" "You clearly you havent heard of what they did to Canterlot High. Turning the whole school against one another in an effort to create negative magic to rule the world ring any bells?!" "Those three? You're joking, they seemed so nice whenever I met them. Desperate for attention, but nice." "Just trust is on this Jupi..." Pinkie said as she walked to the door, "....those nasty sirens even so much as arriving on your doorstep would be horrible, which is why I'm going to defend the step otherwise." Pinkie stuck her arm in her hair as she grabbed the handle, pulling out a large bag of barbed wire and boards as she opened up. As Pinkie started to lay the wire down, a taxi pulled up from the streets with three distinctive hairstyles silhouetted through the tinted windows. The pink teen quickly rushed inside and pulled the curtains shut, putting the living room in darkness. "It's alright, I don't think they saw me. If we just don't move they might go away." Juniper sighed as she turned to the faces giving glanced her way. "Look, I don't know what these girls actually did to you all but they certainly can't be the cause of any trouble now. Just give them a chance, please?" All three faces stayed stone stiff at Juniper as the sound of knocking began. After a minute of silence, Rainbow sighed in defeat. "Well....without thier gems I guess they can't do too much harm. But one wrong move and they are gone!" Juniper nodded and walked to the door. "Listen girls, I'm going to....get Applejack and Fluttershy's word on the matter. "Rarity quickly left through the back door as the front opened up.

1432.content:
Sweetie Belle heard the door open with an unsettling squeak. Looking up from the television,she took note of her sister in a state that didn't say anything about happiness. The teen sulked to the couch and plopped herself down, staring ahead with somewhat vacant eyes. Having lived with her long enough, Sweetie knew that only a particularly stressful day would dish out this sort of body language. Despite better judgment, Sweetie made an effort to get her sister's attention if only to find a way to calm her down. "Umm....sis? Anything wrong?" Rarity instantly burst into tears and cupped her hands into her face. "Today was horrendous, simply awful in every sense of the word! First my own work betrays me in the form of my shoes becoming difficult to walk in and making me late!" Rarity now got off the couch, pacing away with her dramatics enhancing with every word. "Every class had pop quizzes which I was woefully unprepared for, my locker kept jamming, someone had made a degrading picture of me in art and passed it out and the worst part THE VERY WORST PART!!....." Rarity pointed to a small blemish on her shirt that was almost unnoticeable. "My favorite shirt is mud-splattered!" Rarity once more broke down crying, this time walking to the freezer. "This day has been the worst I can ever recall and it isn't even over yet!!" Her hands fumbled around in the cold storage until they reached a section marked "Drama Foods". "No....not grape.....no..no....oh...you'll all do..." The tears now close to staining the makeup on her face, a crying Rarity marched up the stairs with multiple tubs of ice cream in her arms and a scoop balanced on them. "I need to be alone!!!!" Those words were all Sweetie Belle heard before hearing the door slam. "A simple yes would have been fine."

"Ohhh....my best friends, how I've missed you both so." Rarity whined as she uncovered her ornate fainting couch and opened up the first container of the frozen blueberry dairy product. Taking a big scoop and flinging it straight into her mouth, a shiver ran down the teen's body. The delicious taste of blueberries and the always welcome comfort of her fainting couch, this was a combo that Rarity was quite pleased with. Placing another scoop into her mouth, the poor girl was unaware of just what was in store for her.

14321.content:
"Goodness, am I out already?" Rarity moaned in displeasure as she scraped the bottom of the last container of her beloved ice cream. Looking down to the floor, she grimaced at the fact that several containers now were littering her floor, each and every one of them licked clean of their contents. "Hmph... I guess this spoils my diet for the week. Still," she patted her full tummy, hearing a very subtle sloshing sound, "I suppose it was well worth it." Rising from her place upon th ecouch, she gathered up each container and placed one inside the other until all were in one neat stack.

"And now, to the rubbish with you all," she chimed, unsealing herself from her space and traversing down the stairs. Upon entering the kitchen, she promptly placed the rubbish in her possession into the can. "Oh dear, it's getting later then I thought...no matter, I'll just get to working on something and all will be well!" she grinned warmly to herself as she made her way back to the hall and back up the staircase.

"Hi Rarity, glad to see you've finished your episode," Sweetie elle said as she passed her sister, pausing idstep as her face grimaced.

"Well, you know how much a good helping of ice cream helps my nerves. Something wrong? I've got something on my face, don't I?"

"I think so, give your nose a wipe," Sweetie said as she flicked her own nose with her thumb in demonstration. Rarity obliged, and Sweetie's grimace remained. "I think you've smudged it."

"But my thumb is clean, how could I have smeared it?" Rarity questioned as she ran her fingers over her nose.

143211.content:
"I don't know how sis, but the smear just keeps growing." Rarity flug her hand up as if she was in a meger annoyance and began to walk away. "Well dear sister, this is nothing a little soap and water cannot fix." Rarity walked the shirt length to the closest bathroom and closed the door behind her. Turning the sink knobs to a medium lukewarm and squirted a small splash of soap onto her hands. Lathering them up, Rarity began to scrub away at her face. Sure the problem was on the nose but why not clean the rest of the face in the meantime? As she kept her eyes tight and scrubbed away, Rarity began to him away at some tune that had been lodged into her head. After a few minutes of her musical melody, she began to splash water onto her face. "Now..let us see that beautiful face that I knoooooo!!!"

Rarity's eyes opened wide as she looked upon her reflection. She could now see the spot Sweetie had mentioned, big, blue and covering her whole nose. Rarity gulped to herself as she touched the spot, not noticing the very slow spread.

14321122.content: Rarity watched as the students along the hallways glanced from their conversations, books or whatever else they had to distract them from the body walking along the hallways. Rarity smirked as she walked through the hallways, proud of the attention she was receiving. On one hand, she did feel a little faith in her student's sanity fall if such a change in skin color would bring about such attention from her peers. But the fashionista couldn't care less, enjoying the gaping sight of students as they stared at her form. Of course her full body recolor wasn't the only thing that was new about Rarity, the seamstress having slaved over last night to create a new dress to accentuate her body. With two leaf clips in her hair, she had on a sparkling dress of various blues and violets, seams against her sides and a cut along the stomach area to make some room for her slightly larger stomach. As Rarity walked into the circled center of the school, she was aware of a few people following her from a ways off along with all the new eyes glancing to her. Without even bothering to think, she struck a pose for the crowd with the oohs and ahhs saying all she needed to hear. Through the hushed whispers of the crowd, she could hear Photo Finish's camera snapping pictures. "You are impressed are you not? It's alright to look, I want to show this. Just don't miss your classes for little old me." From within the crowd, Rarity could hear Trixie's voice call out, "Is this some sort of magic trick Rarity? Trixie thinks you are merely bamboozling us." "Trixie my dear, I am certain that this is all natural. Or are you just being jealous of all my attention?" "How did you do this to yourself?" "Oh Bon Bon, you can't just expect a lady to divulge her beauty secrets. Besides, I don't have the time, my classes begin in a few minutes so I really should be going and I suggest you all do the same. Good bye for now." Rarity walked away from the slowly dispersing crowd, sighing with glee over the rush she was getting from all the attention.

143331.content:
Being the resident magic users of Canterlot, the girls believed it nessacary to come to the aid of those that requested help. Thankfully, there hadn't been many problems that required thier assistance, but one person in trouble was too much in the eyes of the group. Sometimes they didn't even need to be called forward, they just found the trouble themselves. Such was the reason they girls found themselves on the grounds of an abandoned Manor a ways out if town.

Rarity shook her shoes, ripping the caught grass away. "Pinkie." She grimaced, "Are you sure you saw something fly this direction?"

"Positive" Pinkie Pie stood right up against a worn out tree while Applejack knocked on it. The resulting crash to the ground suprising no one. "I was standing on the roof when I saw something big and bright fly through the air. It didn't have wings though. And Twilight figured from all her math stuff that it would have to have landed somewhere here."

The manor overlooking the yard the seven walked across had clearly been in need of repair for quite awhile. Much of it's paint was falling off and it's roof was a checkerboard of shingle and shinglelsss patches.

"Well, I don't know why anyone in thier right minds would come to this miserable place." Rarity said. "And looks as if no one has for quite awhile."

"Even still..." Sunset said as she held the cowering Fluttershy close, "...if there's even a chance that something magical came here then we have to find it before someone else does."

"I know darling. But we haven't found anything yet." Rarity wanted to lean against something to show how tired she was getting, but she wasn't going to soil her exploring clothes on those raggedy trees, no mam.

Twilight shook her magic detecting device and sighed. "I hate to say it girls, but Rarity is right. And I can't get this darn device of mine to work right. Some kind of interference. We're gonna have to do this the old fashioned way. Split up. Anyone finds anything, they report back with thier geodes."

None of the girls liked the sound of it, but at that moment it looked like thier only option. Each girl was given a partner, except for Rarity who stated herself no one would want to put up with her displeasure of the area. As such, Sunset and Pinkie walked towards the house itself, Applejack and Rainbow entered between two rose bushes while Twilight and Fluttershy walked towards a grove of trees. Rarity, being alone, walked off towards two tall walls of topiary. Which oddly enough were the most pristine areas of this worn down place. Little were any of the girls aware that each of them, while heading a different direction, were all heading to the same place: a hedge maze. As each girl went thier ways, walls of greenery silently rose up from the ground, blocking each group from one another.

Unaware of this, Rarity continued on her way. For minutes, she walked left and right and all around, trying to keep a mental note of each direction she was going. But all the while, something was continually fighting for her attention.

"My, my these hedge appear to have been expertly kept. No overlaying branches, hardly a leaf out of place, it's impossible to find much wrong in this place. Quite a feat considering the state of the rest of this place." Rarity walked on and on, each turn making more and more lost.

1511.content:
Fluttershy glanced at the town around her, the evening sun casting a warm orange glow about her. As she gripped her backpack straps, her sweater rustled about. After a long day at school and helping her friends out with whatever they needed it with, Fluttershy was more than prepared to head home and take a nice little nap. As she passed by an alleyway however, she heard a small whimpering sound. Fluttershy's mind nature immediately lead her to follow the whining to it source. A source which seemed to be a pile of trash. As she picked up the garbage, her mind raced in fear over just how badly the animal in question. Which was why she was somewhat relieved to find it was only a recorder and a piece of paper which read "Behind you." Fluttershy gave a sigh of relief at the thought of no harmed animals. A sigh that became a scream as she felt two hands grab her and drag her down into what appeared to be a portal.

"Ooofff" Fluttershy grunted as she hit the floor when the hands let her go. Fluttershy looked about, gathering her bearings on the situation. It appeared she was now in the castle ruins a ways out of town. "Quite beautiful aren't they?" A horribly familiar voice said, "I'm planning on redecorating when phase one is done." Fluttershy looked to the sky and found the culprit soaring above one of the broken ramparts. "Midnight Sparkle! But...I thought Sunset had..." Midnight let out a huge laugh as she fluttered to her captive. "You honestly thought what little she did was enough? No my dear, it takes a lot more than that if someone wants to destroy me. For now however, that is not your biggest problem...." Midnight's hands filled with a dark blue energy.

1512.content:
Fluttershy hummed a comforting tune as she walked down the path that she had gone many times. Then again, walking around the forest close to the park always did calm her down whenever she was stressed. Taking a break from humming to breath he turned her head slightly to take in some of the flowers on on side of the path. As she did so however, a soft rustling came from the bushes behind her. Upon hearing said rustle, Fluttershy jumped slightly in fear and ran to the other side of the path. After a few seconds, the rustle came again followed by a tiny squeak. "Oh my..." Fluttershy said as she took a nervous step forward, "... are you alright?" Another frightened squeak sounded, leading Fluttershy to believe that a small animal like a mouse or squirrel was stuck in the bush. This was quite common in the park, many of these bushes weren't kept nicely enough and animals often got tangled in the branches. Gathering up her courage, Fluttershy stepped towards the foliage. She slowly reached through the leaves, eager to help the little animal. When she reached the rustling though, Fluttershy was quite suprised at what she found. In her hands, she was beholding to what appeared to be a smaller version of her. The differences being her skin color was blue and covered by a blue tinker belle style outfit. What was really a difference though was the fact that the small being seemed quite...bloated. Looking up, the small Fluttershy squeaked again in fear and unfolded two wings from it's back. It quickly took off, with the real Fluttershy close behind. "Hey! I need to see if your hurt!"

The chase kept up until the small fairy figure dropped down into a small cave hidden beside a few berry bushes. "Hello?" Fluttershy called into the cave on her hands and knees. The echo sounded before dying, leaving Fluttershy to believe the little thing was just shy like her. "It's okay..." She called out as she made her way into the cave, "I don't want to hurt you. I want to helllllllAHHHHHHHHHH!" Fluttershy hadn't gone through the cave for more then a few feet before the floor disappeared entirely. She found herself falling down a hole.
1512.title: Story 2

choices: Fluttershy braves the tunnel
Fluttershy cowers and remains with the bushes
15122.content:
While feeling like several minutes of falling, Fluttershy came to a pleasant and bouncy end as she landed at the bottom of the cave upon a large group of berry bushes.

"At least the landing was soft," she mumbled, picking stray leaves from her skirt as she became more aware of her surroundings. "But where am I?" She glanced down at her cellphone, and to her dismay, there was no reception. "This isn't going to end well..." Deciding it was better to see if the cave ended else where and perhaps opened up. gazing around, she came to see she was at the base of a sheer drop, sunlight filtering in from the top down unto the hardy berry bushes around her. Otherwise, the cave opened into a dark and foreboding maw of a tunnel.

*Gulp*" Guess I'll have to head into the super spp-spooky tunnel..." she hesitated, her knees knocking in fear of the darkness that lay ahead of her.
15122.title: She softly hits the bottom and explores

choices: A forest..with everything blue
A swamp with odd blue muck everywhere
151221.content: Fear or not though, Fluttershy knew quite well that nothing would happen if she just stayed where she was. Gathering up her courage, she began walking towards the darkness. She gave a gulp of fear and her knees were knocking harder, but she soon reached the tunnels edge. As she did, she could barely make out a light at the far end. Taking a deep breath, Fluttershy ran in. The darkness became so thick that she could barely see where she was going. She wouldn't be looking anyways as she did her best to focus only on the light at the end. Many fears of tripping and falling or even stepping on an innocent creature flew through her head, but she kept running. The light kept getting closer and closer until she could see herself again. Fluttershy kept running however, and didn't stop until she found herself at the end of the tunnel. Fluttershy breathed deeply for a second before talk ng a good look at where she was now.
151221.title: Fluttershy braves the tunnel

choices: To town
Down the dark path
1512211.content:
Her eyes looked around the scenery before her and found it all to be an odd sort of beauty. An entire forest surrounded her like the park back home, the main difference was that everything was of a blue color. It wasn't all the same shade of course, there were so many shades and mixtures that everything was distinguishable from itself. A very light scent of blueberries wafted through the air, understandable as the place was littered with blueberries and blueberry bushes. Fluttershy looked back to the cave and knew she wouldn't be able to get home that way. With the forest do inviting, there had to be someone in there who would be willing to help her. Maybe she'd find that little fairy and figure out what she was so scared about.

As Fluttershy walked through the forest, hands in her pockets, she began to feel a strange sense of self conscience. Everything else was some shade of blue or another while she was almost any color but blue. As she came to a fork in the road, she put that thought away and looked over her choices. One path had a sign that probably meant civilization while the other path had thick blue cobwebs. Her choice was near obvious but before she walked, a familiar squeak came from the darker path. It sounded much like the fairy, but this sounded more desperate and worried. Fluttershy gulped at her options, maybe the fairy brought her here in someway but she couldn't help thinking she was really in trouble.
1512211.title: A forest..with everything blue

choices: A berry in regal clothing with a worried glance
Berry in a scientific looking garb
15122111.content:
Fluttershy turned towards the dark path and was about to take a few steps. However, the squeaking abruptly ended with no feeling it would return. Fluttershy held herself back, trying not to shed tears as she turned towards the lighter path. She wasn't fast enough...there was nothing she could do. She kept thinking this as she walked down the road, noticing already a difference in the neatness of the violet-grey gravel. "Well...whoever did this might be able to help me..." Fluttershy sniffled with the guilt fresh in her mind. Another sign appeared on the path, a little bright than the first and had clearly been put up recently with the firm look of the indigo wood.

Taking a few steps out of the forest, Fluttershy stood in awe at what layed before her. She found herself standing at the edge of what looked like a small village. The structures around her looked like they were fresh from the pages of a fairy tale...if that book was printed with blue paper but still. The smell of freshly baked blueberry muffins and pies hung around the air and the 'sky' above seemed bright and cheerful without a real sun to speak of. What really caught Fluttershy's eye though were the people she saw on the streets. All of them were different shades of blue and round as giant balls. With all the blue and sizes around, Fluttershy's feelings of self-conscious returned. "Oh my...just look at you poor dear...." Fluttershy turned to the soft, warming voice to find she was being approached by...
15122111.title: To town

choices: A huge castle
A giant pond
151221111.content:
Fluttershy turned around and saw that she was being approached by a berry wearing a queenly outfit which looked similar to a character she saw in a book once though the name of the book escapes her. But, what really got her attention was how large she was. She was easily bigger than people here and even most of the village. Fluttershy couldn't even see her head or limbs due to her sheer size. Then Fluttershy saw four of those little blue fairies appear from behind the large berry including the one that looked like her (which was a huge burden off her chest and she thought what she heard earlier was just that dark path playing tricks with her mind) and began to roll the large berry person forward so that she was at Fluttershy's eye level. Fluttershy then noticed that the other citizens stopped what they were doing and immediately bowed their heads in respect.

“Oh you poor thing look at you so small, skinny and discolored.” The woman said in a worried tone. “This will not do, this will not do at all.”

Upon closer observation Fluttershy noticed that the person’s face was very similar to Principal Celestia minus the skin color but her voice, personality and mannerisms were closer to that of her friend Rarity. Just then Fluttershy heard finger snapping and four more fairies appeared before the giant berry woman and then woman started to talk to the fairies in a language she couldn't understand. Then she was done talking, the four fairies who just arrived circled around Fluttershy and proceeded to lift her up and carry her.

"For such small creatures they sure have a lot strength." Fluttershy thought to herself. “Um, excuse me miss-.”

“Oh where are my manners, I forgot to introduce myself.” The woman said in realization. “I am the ruler of this land, Queen Blissful Blue or Queen B for short.” “So what is your name?”

“I am Fluttershy.” She replied. “ So um, what are your little friends doing"

“Oh I told them to take you with me so I can treat your ailment.” Queen B stated.

“But I don't feel sick.” Fluttershy said, confused by what the queen told her.

“Of course you do sweetie.” Queen B replied while giving a royal chuckle. “But fear not, for I know just how to treat it.”

Then the first four fairies began to roll Queen B out of the village with the other four that were carrying Fluttershy following close behind. Fluttershy was wondering where they were taking her and the queen meant by her “ailment”. While it had only been a few minutes since they left the village, Fluttershy could see where the Queen was taking her which was...
151221111.title: A berry in regal clothing with a worried glance

choices: A lavish bedroom with a blueberry banquet on the side
A room filled with more faries, bottles of potions and a cauldron
1512211111.content:
The village certainly did give the idea of a medieval city but the castle she was being floated towards inserted that idea tenfold. Even from her position, Fluttershy could tell it was built up from a violet colored stone and at least ten times bigger than Canterlot High. Staring at the place in fascination seemed to pass the time quite well as the girl soo found herself being floated past the gates with Queen B rolling ahead constantly glancing to Fluttershy.

"You really are lucky I had found you dearie, such a sick subject in my kingdom is unacceptable. I can only imagine the pain and embareesment you were going through before I found you." Queen B seemed to be genunly worried about Fluttershy, though the girl still didn't have clue why. For the moment however, Fluttershy decided to keep her mouth shut until the queen was slightly more attentive to her words. As the faries continued to float her along, Fluttershy looked to the multitude of maids, guards and servants around the hall, all either bowing to thier queen or giving her worried glances. "Don't you worry miss Fluttershy, all you need is some treatment and then you can go back to being another happy berry citizen." Fluttershy tried to open her mouth to proclaim that she wasn't sick and furthermore wasn't a berry like her, but the Celestia lookalike and the faries rolling her shushed her before she could say anything. "Don't speak child, I can assure you we'll have you feeling better in no time." The group rolled through the halls until reaching a rather large door, two of Queen B's faries pulled at the door and opened it to reveal.....
1512211111.title: A huge castle

choices: Fluttershy's skin starts turning blue
A blueberry maid enters the room
nothing happens...yet
15122111111.content:
The fairies pulled opened the doors to reveal the most lavish bedroom that Fluttershy had ever seen. It was probably three to four times bigger than her own house and every piece of furniture was big and elegant. The bed was round, the sheet colored sapphire and could easily occupy someone of Queen B’s size possibly even two. The vanity mirror almost reached the ceiling and it looked like it belonged in a funhouse. To the right of the mirror the were doors to a closet looked more like a warehouse storage room. The to left there was a large balcony area where the view went on for miles.

Then the four fairies that were carrying Fluttershy laid her on the giant bed and when she tried to get up one of the fairies notioned her to stay where she was.

“There’s no need to get up dearie.” Queen B said as she was rolled to the side of the bed. “Just relax and enjoy yourself.”

Then Fluttershy heard finger snapping which she assumed was coming from Queen B and then as if on cue two blueberry maids bring in a huge cart blueberry baked goods including blueberry muffins, bagels, pies, cobblers and tarts. The aroma coming from the treats smelled divine and Fluttershy thought the goods smelled better than the ones she saw in town.

“So what is this all for?” Fluttershy asked curiously.

“For the treatment of course.” Queen B replied with a slight chuckle. “Just eat to your heart’s content and everything will be better.”

Then one of the fairies picks up a muffin and brings it toward Fluttershy.

“Well I haven't eaten anything since breakfast.” Fluttershy thought to herself. “Plus it would be rude to the queen since she went through all of this trouble for me.”

Fluttershy then took a bite of the muffin and her eyes lit up like fireworks. The blueberries in the muffin were warm and rich that it took the flavor of the muffin to the next level. Fluttershy finished the muffin in no time and then another fairy brought her a bagel. Fluttershy quickly took a bite out of the bagel and just like the muffin was was bursting with blueberry flavor. Fluttershy was becoming so wrapped in eating that was starting to become obvious to her surroundings. That was until...
15122111111.title: A lavish bedroom with a blueberry banquet on th...

choices: As big as the average berry citizen
Bigger than the average berry citizen
Almost as big as Queen B
151221111111.content:
As Fluttershy was eating the last blueberry tart, Queen B was amazed that Fluttershy was able to finish every blueberry treat she brought in under half an hour.

“*groans* I think I ate too much.” Fluttershy said sluggishly while patting her belly.

“Everything is going to be fine dearie.” Queen B stated with confidence. “Since you ate every delectable treat that I brought, you're aliment will be cured in no time.”

“But I keep telling you I’m not sick.” Fluttershy replied in a less sluggish tone of voice. “Also,why do you think…”

But before Fluttershy could finish her sentence she saw that her hands were starting to turn blue and began spreading to the rest of her body.

“Wh-what’s happening?” Fluttershy said with panic in her voice.

“The treatment is starting to work.” Queen B said happily.

Within a matter of seconds Fluttershy’s skin and hair had turned completely blue. Then she started to hear a gurgling sound coming from belly. Her eyes widen as she saw that her belly was starting to inflate. Fluttershy was about stand up in a panic but the fairies pinned each of her limbs on the bed to prevent her from struggling.

“Just relax child.” Queen B said in motherly tone. “It will be over before you know it.”

Fluttershy saw that belly was starting to grow at a rapid pace and soon her limbs started to become thicker as well. Before long Fluttershy’s body started to become more spherical and she started to hear a sloshing sound coming from within her body.

“Am I filling up with j-juice?!” Fluttershy thought to herself as her body continued to inflate.

In a matter of minutes Fluttershy’s inflating body began to absorb her limbs (which the fairies finally let go of) and even her head was beginning to sink into her body. Fluttershy thought that she was done growing but little did she realize how big she was going to grow which was…
151221111111.title: Fluttershy's skin starts turning blue

choices: Berryshy
Flutterberry
Writer's choice
1512211111113.content:
“Oh look how big and round you are becoming dearie.” Queen B said cheerfully.

While Queen B while was happy with the growing blueberry in front of her, Fluttershy on the other hand was not. At this point Fluttershy’s hands and feet have have been reduced to stubs and all she do flap them around helplessly. Fluttershy’s head has also sunk a bit further into body causing her view to be obstructed and making her look like Queen B. However throughout this entire ordeal, Fluttershy’s clothes have managed to stay intact (though they are stretched out beyond belief) without even showing the slightest tear which is something that she is completely surprised about.

Fluttershy continued to grow bigger and bigger for what felt like eternity to her until she finally stopped growing. Then the fairies rolled Fluttershy into an upright position and looked at the vanity mirror and saw that she was enormous. Fluttershy was almost as big as Queen B being about two-thirds her size and felt like she could barely do anything on her own anymore. Just then Queen B was rolled right next to Fluttershy who was sporting a great big smile.

“There we go big, round and blue just like a happy berry citizen should be.” Queen B said proudly.

Then one of the fairies flew towards Queen B’s head and begun to whisper something into her ear and it was done Queen B’s face went from happy to complete surprise

“When will these travesties end?!” Queen B shouted. “First I find this poor sick child in the village and now I’ve been told that she doesn't even a place to call home, this is unacceptable!!”

Then Queen B snapped her finger and one of the fairies approached her while carrying a pen and a small sheet of paper.

“Take note.” Queen B ordered. “I Queen Blissful Blue being of sound mind and body full of juice, hereby adopt Fluttershy as my own daughter.”

“WHAT!!” Fluttershy said in complete shock.

“Oh, it will be perfect dearie.” Queen B said happily. “I always wanted a daughter of my own and your almost as big as I am.” “Of course Fluttershy is not a proper name for a blueberry princess.” “Let me see….I’ve got it, from now on your name shall be…”
1512211111113.title: Almost as big as Queen B

choices: The Queen's dinner rolls by, catching her attention
The queen drags Flutterberry along
15122111111131.content:
"Berryshy! Oh it is such a cute name. And so fitting for such a cute blueberry princess." As Queen B spoke, the fairy crossed out Fluttershy's name and replaced it with the name she had chosen. The faires around the large Queen giggled and cheered about, as if the Queen had performed some mighty deed.

Meanwhile, Fluttershy/Flutterberry twitched about, feeling and hearing the juice inside her sloshing about. It just felt so strange and unnatural, barely able to even move her head. Her blue body began rocking back and forth, constantly reminding Fluttershy of her new ball shape.

After finishing dictating the documents, Queen B was turned back around to her new daughter. "Well Flutterberry, once those documents are recorded in the royal family archives and presented to the berry folk, you will officially be my sweet little princess." Fluttershy attempted to speak out, once again trying to catch the Queen's attention with the truth, but the Queen's faries shushed her with the queen following suit. "Oh dearie, I know this must be exciting for you. Being adopted by your healer and all, but we have much to do now. I mean we must fit you into some clothes better suited to your status. And then there is having our royal portrait painted after all is made official. And no doubt a cornation service is in order so that the people know in no uncertain terms that you are my daughter." Turning the Fluttershy and watching her wiggle, she gasped. "Of course! You'll need a royal fairy or two by your side as well. Us rulers have better things to use our bodies for than making us roll of course. And I can just imagine...."

As Queen B continued her rambling, Fluttershy was at a loss. She had no idea what to do or think anymore. This woman clearly wasn't listening to her and the fairies she wanted to help were only making things worse. On the side, all this juice sloshing did feel rather nice but it was still wrong.
15122111111131.title: Berryshy

choices: Have the royal portrait taken
Pick out some royal fairies for you
Give you a grand tour of the castle
151221111111312.content:
Before Fluttershy could even wrap her mind around what happened to her, she could feel tiny hands pushing against her spherical body and realized she was being rolled on her back. She then saw the fairies were rolling her and Queen B out of the bedroom and into the hallway.

“Come along Berryshy, we must get you out of those rags and into some royal attire.” Queen B said happily.

The two berry women were then rolled into the hallway where Fluttershy noticed that the royal staff were not around. She probably figured that they were getting the castle ready for her coronation. After a few minutes of being rolled, Fluttershy saw some of the royal fairies opening a door and then was rolled into the room along with Queen B. Fluttershy noticed that the room was filled with rolls of different fabrics which reminded her of Rarity’s boutique. Then in the middle of the room there was a woman who was slightly bigger than the average citizen and was wearing a customized maid outfit who had a royal fairy of her own.

“Greetings your highness.” The woman said as her fairy rolled her into a bowing position.

“Hello Azure how are things at home?” Queen B asked.

“Just wonderful.” Azure replied while noticing Fluttershy. “I take it that this is your new daughter?”

“My, my word does travel fast around the castle.” Queen B said with a chuckle.

“Well you know that the fairies love their gossip.” Azure replied before turning her attention to Fluttershy. “Greetings Berryshy I am Azure the castle’s royal seamstress.” “All the outfits ranging from castle staff to her royal highness Queen B were made by yours truly with help from my fairy assistant.” “Now how can I be of service to you today?”

“My daughter needs a line of outfits befitting her new royal status.” Queen B stated proudly.

“Any particular style you had in mind your highness?” Azure asked curiously.

“Round and regal, just as a royal blueberry should look like.” Queen B replied.

Then Azure bowed once again before the fairies started to roll her and Fluttershy to the back end of the room while Queen B waited. Two of the fairies pulled down a thick curtain for privacy and for focusing on the task at hand. While Azure was gathering fabrics for the dresses alongside the fairies, she noticed that Fluttershy looked like she had a lot on her mind.

“Is there something wrong, princess?” Azure asked while examining one of the pulled out fabrics.

“*sigh* I’ve been trying to speak to the Queen all afternoon, but most of the time she keeps interrupting me.” Fluttershy explained.

“Her highness can get like that sometimes.” Azure replied. “Once she gets an idea going through her mind she almost never listens to anyone else, but she does everyone’s best interests at heart.” “You will get the chance to say what is on your mind soon enough princess.”

“I sure hope so.” Fluttershy sighed. “So what do you think I’ll be doing next Azure?”

“If I had to guess Berryshy.” Azure pondered. “I would say that her highness would…”
151221111111312.title: The queen drags Flutterberry along

choices: A garden in the middle of the castle
A hidden grotto underneath the castle
A floating towder high above the clouds
1512211111113122.content:
"I would say that her highness would pick out some royal fairies for you." Azure said after giving some thought to the question.

"Are the fairies that important?" Fluttershy asked curiously.

"Of course they are princess." Azure replied with a slight chuckle. "For members of the royal family and castle staff the are a blessing as they help us perform our daily tasks." "In fact the number of fairies you have with you is also a status symbol." "Her Highness has 3-4 fairies with her for the main purpose of rolling her around and two more to take care of business when she leaves the castle." "Now hold still princess, we're almost done with your dress."

*fifteen minutes later*

"Thank you for waiting your highness." Azure said as she rolled out from behind a large curtain. "It is with great pleasure that present to you...the new princess Berryshy."

Then Azure's fairy pulled on a rope which pulled back the curtain which reveals Fluttershy wearing a dress similar to what Queen B was wearing.

"*sniff* She is absolutely beautiful." Queen B said with tears in her eyes.

Then the fairies rolled Queen B up close to Fluttershy and she kissed Fluttershy on both of her face cheeks.

"Azure you never cease to amaze me." Queen B said happily.

"You humble me your highness." Azure replied while bowing. "I'll start working on a few more outfits for the princess, that way she will have more options to wear."

Just as Fluttershy was about to speak, the fairies silenced her once again.

"Oh sweetie, I know you want to tell me how much you love your new dress but there is still so much to do." Queen B said in a loving manner. "We still need to pick out some royal fairies for you so let's get rolling."

With that the fairies began to roll Queen B and Fluttershy out of Azure's workplace and off to pick out some new fairies for the princess. Which was at...
1512211111113122.title: Pick out some royal fairies for you

choices: Four
Five
Six
15122111111131222.content:
Fluttershy wasn't sure where the Queen was taking her but she thought that the dress did look nice on her. While the juice inside her still felt weird, it was a feeling that she was getting used to. In a matter of minutes Fluttershy noticed that she stopped rolling and saw that she was at the corner of dead end hallway on the ground floor of the castle. Then she noticed one of the fairies pressing a stone brick that was sticking out of the wall which caused the floor beneath them to shake slightly. The floor began to sink into sink into the ground as Fluttershy saw that the surrounding area was tunneled out.

“It's all right Berryshy.” Queen B said in a motherly tone. “This magical stone elevator leads to the secret fairy grotto which is located underneath the castle.”

The elevator soon arrived at its destination and the fairies resumed rolling the two royal blueberries to wherever they were going. Within a minute the rolling stopped and Fluttershy saw an impressive grotto which featured a small garden, a little spring and there was a medium sized hole on top of the cavern ceiling that had light coming out which lead all the way up to the surface. Fluttershy also saw a large number of fairies flying all over the cavern and some of them look rather familiar to her.

“Oh my it's evening already.” Queen said as she looked at the ceiling hole. “I guess we’ll have to do the portrait and the rest of the coronation prep tomorrow.”

Just then a fairy appeared from out the spring and she was about the size of Fluttershy before turning into a blueberry. What’s more is that Fluttershy was actually able to understand what the fairies were saying compared to last time.

“Greetings Queen Blissful Blue.” The large fairy said as she bowed in respect.

“Hello Serena, I’m here to pick out some royal fairies for my new, precious daughter.” Queen B said happily.

“So this your new daughter that the other fairies have told me about.” Serena said as she examined Fluttershy. “Well she certainly has the potential to become even bigger.”

“Um..what are doing?” Fluttershy asked curiously, unable to move her head to due round body.

“Oh, forgive me Berryshy for not introducing myself properly.” Serena said in realization. “I am Serena leader of the fairies.” “Our people have been supporting the royal berry family for countless generations to help the kingdom prosper.” “As I’ve stated previously, not only do you have the potential to become bigger but you also have the potential to help continue the kingdom’s prosperity.”

“Uh..thank you?” Fluttershy stated, unsure whether to take Serena’s statement as a compliment or not.

“Your welcome princess.” Serena replied. “Now let’s see how many fairies will come to you.”

Then Serena rolled Fluttershy to the center of grotto where the light from the ceiling was and then Serena went back to where Queen B stood. Uncertain of what to do, Fluttershy just stood there waiting for something to happen and wonder how many fairies would approach her.
15122111111131222.title: A hidden grotto underneath the castle

choices: It's there...and jumps onto her
She doesn't see it, time to help the fairy
15122112.content: Fluttershy swallowed a huge chunk of her fear and turned her whole body towards the darker path. Sure her body was shaking like it was in a blender, but if there was something so small and seemingly helpless in imminent danger her instincts wouldn't help but go to aid. "Oh dear...." Fluttershy's hands wiped away the blue cobwebs as she walked along, feeling their sticky texture even after trying to wipe it off. The trees were seeming larger and larger as she walked down the path and the scared squeaking got louder and louder. Despite the darkness and her fear, Fluttershy attempted to brave on with hopeful thoughts bouncing in her head. "Maybe she didn't mean to bring me here. I probably scared the poor thing and it just wanted to get away......ohhh....I do hope the poor little fairy thing isn't in too much trouble. Who knows, it might help me out of here if I help it." As Fluttershy walked along the path, she noticed the webs becoming thicker and thicker as the voice grew. Fluttershy gulped again, fearful of just what all of this was leading up to. Sure enough, Fluttershy entered a small clearing and her eyes fell upon her blueberry fairy lookalike. This poor thing was caught in a spider's web that hung over several berry bushes that were healthy yet larger than any berry bush should. Fluttershy looked around, if prey was in the web then the spider might not be far off....
15122112.title: Down the dark path

choices: We need to help her leave Blueberry land...or else
Their all captivated by curiosity
151221122.content:
After glancing about and seeing nothing dangerous or scary, Fluttershy crept to the web. Noticing her approach, the small fairy began to squirm and squeak even more than before. "Don't be scared little blue fairy, I'm here to help." Fluttershy grabbed at the web, shivering at the gooey mess she was grasping. With the safety of the fairy in mind though, Fluttershy managed to work through her worry and continued ripping the web. "I do hope whatever made this web won't be too upset." The girl thought to herself as she pulled the last few connecting strands off her miniscule doppleganger. The fairy shook itself off as it entered flight. Instead of fleeing, it flew right up to Fluttershy's face. "Thank you...thank you so much. But it is unfortunate you have come to this land." Fluttershy nodded. "I know I shouldn't have follewed you. But I thought you were hurt and..." "No, I mean....just follow me home." The fairy sped off, leaving a trail of bright violet dust for Fluttershy to follow.

The light of the sun flashed once again in Fluttershy's face, though undoubtibly it was a false light meant to seem like the one above ground. "The poor girl has no idea what she is in for if she stays." Hearing the high-pitched voice of the fairy, Fluttershy looked to a gathering by a small pond. The fairy, (which Fluttershy thought of naming Flutterberry) was surrounded by other fairies with resemblance to some other people she knew. She could pick out Rainbow Dash's face and another one looked like Celestia and a few shared resemblance to the Dazzlings. All of them were blue and round like Flutterberry anyways. The Rainbow Dash fairy saw Fluttershy come closer and motioned the others to her presence.
151221122.title: She doesn't see it, time to help the fairy

choices: Fluttershy/berry rush along in conversation
The group teleports ahead of them to set the trap
1512211221.content: "Wow Flutterberry, you weren't kidding about how big she is. Her form too...almost exactly like you." "We'll....she's not blue or a berry or a fairy...." The Rainbow blueberry turned to the Sonata lookalike and motioned the best face palm she could. "She is right though Rainberry, she isn't like us and you know what can happen to non berries in Blueberryland. We have to help her." Having come closer to the little blue balls, Fluttershy questioned. "Well, what's wrong with this place? It does seem rather beautiful...and..well...blue." Rainberry got right up into Fluttershy's face and said. "Well if you don't leave now, you will too!" A blue aura pulled Rainberry away while the Celestia fairy came forward. "Forgive Rainberry's brashness. What sue means is that this place an an odd effect on those who don't belong here. You see, only people big, blue and filled to the brim with juice are really ment to be here. If someone isn't than the magical aura of the land finds a way to make them so." Flutterberry nodded. "Not only that, but depending on how they were turned, they'll forget everything about their old life. They'll become a berry in both body and....oh my...." Noticing that Flutterberry was glancing to her hands, Fluttershy took a look too. In the very tips of her fingers, she could see sploches of blue forming. "The process is already forming. Don't worry, it's quite slow and won't get severe unless something else affects it. Now...we need to get you out." "But how?" Rainberry asked her juicy friend. "Our magic isn't strong enough to teleport her." "You're right, plus I know she can't go back the way she came. I think I know some other holes she can go to to get to the surface. Follow me!" As Fluttershy and Flutterberry ran off, the Celestial berry sighed. "Such a shame, she would have made a cute berry to play with. I know we were all thinking it." 1512212.content:
What Fluttershy saw as she looked around suprised her quite a bit. She was expecting to be standing on a rocky outcropping or maybe some sort of underground grotto. What she saw however was flora and fauna similar to what one would find in a swamp. Part of the surprise came from the fact that she had lived in Canter lot for a long time and never had she heard of any nearby swamps. Then again, she also never heard of magic portals, pony princesses or blueberry-bodied fairys that bear a striking similarities to herself and they all turned out real. Taking a closer look around, Fluttershy took notice of the odd substance surrounding the many little isles of ground. It seemed to be an odd thick substance with a deep blue coloration. What made this stuff even worse looking was that there seemed to be no way to cross over it. Fluttershy looked to the trees, hoping to find some animals that might help her, but instead found only blueberries. "Great, now how will I find that fai....wait...blueberries don't grow on trees!"
"They do in BlueberryLand."
Fluttershy jumped at the sudden yet sleepy sounding voice. "Who said that?" After a loud yawn, the voice said in a more direct voice, "Over here." Fluttershy looked in the voice's direction and saw.

15122122.content: Fluttershy hit herself slightly to make absolutely sure she was not dreaming. She would have done this earlier but what stood before her was good enough reason to do a full reality check. Standing in the blue muck was a woman with a stomach size only slightly less round then the fairy was. That wasn't what really caught Fluttershy's attention though, it was that the woman seemed to be covered in...no...MADE OF the very muck she was standing in. "Hello young one..." The being lazily waved over before taking in another yawn, "...welcome to BlueberryLand." Throughout the current events of today, Fluttershy had tried to keep a relatively level head. With what that was happening now though, all Fluttershy could do was slightly stutter. "B...blue...BlueberryLand?" The woman nodded and began to lay down. As she did, Flutter shy began to see that she was not alone. There were multiple females just like this one, all either sleeping or curiously looking to the girl. "This is a...*yawn* magical place of blueberries, they can go anywhere and can be anywhere...even you." Fluttershy's curiosity peaked as this being now fell asleep. "What...what do you mean?" "Few ever come to BlueberryLand, but in time everyone became a blueberry. The land can do things that...make you change." "There is no point in resisting...." The first one said "...no one can you will become a blueberry girl before long. Fluttershy involuntarily yawned, the tired vibe these women were giving off becoming contagious. Something was just making her want to sleep, and for some reason the muck was looking like the perfect bed. "You look so tired..." the first woman continued with a gleam in her eyes, "...let us take care of you." Fluttershy's eyes began to close as she took a step toward the ground's edge. A few other girls joined the first, outstrechinf their arms to catch their new prey.

Slowly, ever so slowly, Fluttershy stepped down onto the shoreline, allowing herself to be supported by the arms of the murky muck ladies.

"That's it dear, just let us help you..." the first muck lady spoke sleepily as her hand grasped around Fluttershy's arm. The others took hold of whatever their hands could grasp hold of, their bodies seeping into the fabric and skin of their prey. With wicked grins, they finished lulling Fluttershy's mind to sleep before placing her neck deep into the blueberry muck below them. They swirled about the body, encasing her in reeds and slime and all things of the marshlands around them. Their sluggish voices chanted, echoing softly to her ears in a language still unknown to her. A rich nd soft bubbling began to stir beneath Fluttershy, but she had not a care in the world as she dreamed sweet pleasantries without a care.

Each of the murky ladies of the marsh laid a kiss upon her lips, leaving a little trace of each of them within her. Their forms melted into the swamp around them, oozing away to let their work take hold.

All of the love they were giving her, it all just felt so wonderful. "I....I'm beginning to see what you all mean my*yawn* dears. I can feel the love you all are giving me and I love it." Of course, these delightful beings were giving her so much happiness and comfort, she just had to return the favor. 151221221211112.content:
Over the next few days, the being once known as Fluttershy began to settle into her new life. There truly was nothing to do in the marshes, so the muck women were able to do what they felt like. These activities included sleeping, showering each other with love and affection and.....pretty much more sleeping. Fluttershy took part in more and more of these activities as the days rolled on, losing her memorys of doing anything else in life. At first she was slightly upset that she was forgetting her friends from the surface, but she soon easily forgot as her new friends and lovers made her feel so welcome.

Unknown to the former Fluttershy, there was a part of her that was in her human form for much longer. That being the magic she had found with her old friends. It had slowly begun to adapt to it's host's new body but because she couldn't remember it she wouldn't know. Not only was it adapting, because her body was a part of the marsh it was spreading to the other muck women as well. A rich magic was beginning to strengthen each and everyone of them. The effects of this magic would show soon enough.

"Girls! Over here!" Twilight waved over her friends as she crouched next to an exposed cave entrance behind shrubbery.

"What did you find Darling?" Rarity asked, the rest of the group following close behind her.

"There seems to be some kind of hole and scuff marks around the edges here. Someone has been here recently, and judging by the bootmarks, I strongly suspect Fluttershy went down here for some reason."

"But what would she be doing in a cave? Fluttershy is afraid of the dark, and caves at that," Rainbow Dash pointed out.

"That's ah good point Rainbow. I reckon it'd have to be some kinda critter runnin' in all frightened like," AJ replied.

"In any case, we need to go down in there and soon. Who knows how she's doing trapped down there," Twilight commented, a worried look crossing her face.

"Give me just moment Darling, I must have some spelunking gear in my set..." Rarity trailed off as she began to sort through her repertoire of clothes. In a flash, she had helmets and headlamps for each member. Dash took tot he lead, preparing the belay and ropes before settling down to the botom of the cave first.

15122122121111211.content:
With a deep breath, Rainbow began to work her way into the hole. Having done her fair share of rock climbing before, Rainbow had no trouble traversing the rock walls of the cavern. Taking a quick look down, Rainbow could just barely make out the bottom and even then it was still quite a drop. "This thing goes down for quite a ways girls." Rainbow called up as the girls were putting on their headlamps, "Make sure the rope is good then come on down." As Rainbow kept going down, she could hear the girls discussing something inaudible. With the concerned tone of their voices however, it wasn't hard to think what they might have been discussing. Despite trying to focus on the rock, Rainbow was also having her own worry session. Fluttershy had been lost for days and the thoughts of what was going on made her stomach churn. A million thoughts ran around her head and the inclusion of this hole in the mystery only made it worse. Maybe she was lost in a cave-in or maybe she was too scared to want to move. She could be hungry, tired, confused, hurt, anything could be happening to her down there. "Fluttershy!" Rainbow called out with worry in her voice, "Fluttershy!! Can you hear me?! If you can, please tell me you're alright! P..please?"

"Darn it Pinkie, yer bein as jumpy as a fruit bat in a pest control center! Stop it!" "Our friend is missing in a dark cave and you expect us to go so slow?!" "Rock climbing and spelunking are not safe activities dearie, let alooooonnnnnnnnWOAH!!" Rainbow could feel the rope twitching about and started to get really annoyed. "Will you girls get Pinkie under control already?! I want to save Fluttershy from whatever is going on but we won't if we get*DOOFF*" Rainbow's sentence was cut off by a falling body knocking her out of place. Before Rainbow could even react, she had lost her grip and was falling down like the others on top of her. All five girls were now falling down the shaft screaming and unable to grip the rope well enough and unable to reset the belays due to disorienting velocity. Rainbow closed her eyes, waiting for the moment of unbearable and possibly fatal pain of come. It never did though, at first she thought it was because they kept falling but no, they had stopped. Opening her eyes, Rainbow saw that they had landed on some kind blueberry bush. Rainbow didn't know what kind as she had never seen blueberries with such a slimy complexion. "So*huff*help me *huff* Pinkie...." Applejack said, "...Ah ain't*huff* gonna let yah*huff* near any cliffs anytime soon." The girls all recollected themselves, looking around at what they assumed was the bottom of the hole. "Hey, girls...." Twilight said pointing to a path through the cave. "Looks like we might be close to Fluttershy after all!" The girls began walking, hoping that Twilight was right and that everything was gonna be fine.
