Applejack just stood mouth agape at the many odd being before them. "Girls..." Pinkie said...."I think we hit our heads harder then we thought we had." Twilight lightly slapped herself, making certain she wasn't dreaming or anything of the sort. The fact they believed they found their friend was momentarily lost to the wonder of what played before them. "Ummm...hello?" Rainbow said, being all her wowed mind could make. Just looking at these odd and rounded ladies of the blue muck made her question all she knew, an action she thought only a pony princess could do. "We can*yawn* see you are all troubled by our *yawn* appearance. Let us first however be the ones to*yawn* welcome you all to BlueberryLand." Rarity had managed to pull herself together, though that pulling was through very weak threads. "Um...excuse me....are those women...made of...." "The *yawn* marsh?" Flutternuck stated, "We are. This is our home and our place of creation. We are*yawn* so thrilled to see new faces. However....who is this Fluttershy you all spoke of?" Most of the girls were still stuck back upon the idea of the name of the land they now stood in. "BlueberryLand?...I've...never...wait...aren't you..." "It's clear your journey here has*yawn* made you all weary and your minds weak." The lead said before opening her slimy arms in a welcoming motion, "Why not step in and relax. We were*yawn* going to feast soon and there's always more slime blueberries then even our large guts*yawn* can handle."
1512212212111121112.title: The girls recoil, unsure of what to makeof the ...

choices: The Fairy return to hep her out
A mysterios voice answered, promising freedom
151221221212.content:
Still, Fluttershy wasn't going to give up so easily. Calling upon all the strength in her changing body, she charged forward, using her slicker body to squeeze past the grip of the other muck ladies and trek onto dry land.

"You can't escape...*yawn*...your body isn't stable enough to hold you. Come back and...*yawn*...finish with us. We lvoe you," the muck beings called out, watching as Fluttershy rushed into a large bundle of reeds, escaping deeper into the marshland.

"No matter, we'll...*yawn*...find her, after a quick nap..." the first muck being said before melting down into the murky depths, the others following suit as the grip of slumber took hold.

Elsewhere, Fluttershy stumbled among the roots of a bluish mangrove tree, her breathing erratic as she stopped to catch her breath. Taking a moment to study herself, she groped around her body and gasped in surprise as she really came to realize how much of a hybrid she had become. Fortunately for now, she was still partially human, and that was the part that was going to get her out of here.

"But how...? Oh, I'm so horribly lost!" she cried, her fears quickly overwhelming her senses.
151221221212.title: Slippery Escape

choices: We'll have to go deeper into this world
First, you must complete your transformation
1512212212121.content: Fluttershy's crying continued for a few minutes before she could hear movement coming from the tree above. Looking up, she saw something was indeed moving around in the trees. "Hey....who's there?" The rustling stopped momentarily, before a small blue face came out of the foilage. Fluttershy gave a mucky smile at the thought of someone helping her through this murky place. Her smile soon dissapaite as the figure fully showed herself. "You!" Fluttershy said as the fairy from before flew in close. "Why did you bring me*yawn* here? Excuse my yawn, which is your fault." "I'm sorry." The little fairy squeaked, "...but you were not supposed to follow me. That is not important right now though, what matters is bringing you out of Blueberryland and fast. From the looks of it, the muckberries were too close for comfort." Looking to her blue and mucky body, Fluttershy sighed. "They seemed so nice and helpful, but they were entrancing me and making me like them and...and..." Fluttershy shivered in the memory of their 'affection', why exactly she didn't want to know. "If you can help me, that would be appreciated."
1512212212121.title: The Fairy return to hep her out

choices: Fluttershy agrees and follows
Fluttershy's reluctance wins out
1512212212122.content: Not exactly known for her courage, it didn't take long for Fluttershy's fears to go from overwhelming to consuming. Within minutes, Fluttershy was experiencing a breakdown that would even rival that of her friend Rarity. She sat on the ground and buried her face in her mostly slimey hands. "I'm so lost!" She lightly sobbed, "I need help." "I can see that." Fluttershy put her head up, nearly expecting one of those muck women. What she saw that was muck made however was herself and some of the muck in the near-unseeable distance. "Hello? Who's there?" "Someone who has been watching you but hasn't felt obliged to intervene till now." Fluttershy looked above the mangrove tree but still found no source of the voice as it continued. "I can see the "Muckberrys" as I call them got to you." Fluttershy nodded, feeling a need to yawn but trying to suppress it. "Your stomach has yet to blow up, if it blew while in thier power then you would have certainly become one of them. But you resisted so here you are." Fluttershy nodded again, though remembering how she met the..."Muckberrys"...now made her edgy towards this soft yet yet determined voice. "I know you might not believe me, but I can help you. All you need to do is follow my easily noticeable voice and I can guide you to where your fears will vanish and your troubles will end. To put it simply...home." Taking a look at herself, Fluttershy realized she needed someone who knew about this place. Then again, this could be another trap leading her to mindlessness and blueberry girl....ness. As if sensing her reluctance, the voice said. "You can reject my help if you wish, but those muckberries might be able to call you back to them or who knows what else would want you."
1512212212122.title: A mysterios voice answered, promising freedom

choices: The two carry on, reaching a long ramp back to the world above
The Muckladies catch up and confront the duo
15122122121221.content:
"W-well, if you can ensure I get home..."

"Indeed I can. It's your place of being, not this miserable wasteland."

"...Then I trust you to take me there." Fluttershy finished, holding out her drippy hand, as if to shake on it.

"Very well, follow the sound of my voice and you shall be on your way home in no time flat." the Voice stated as it slowly drifted forwards, luring its guest along the bases of trees and through shrubs. "Tel me, what is it like, out there in the world beyond here?"

"Have you never been there yourself?" she retorted, cocking her head in confusion.

"It's just been so long since I;ve been there, my memories are hazy."

"Oh, I'm really sorry to hear that. But, if you know the way out, why stay?"

"Because I fear of what the people woud think of me, for any friends I did have have long since grown up and left this area."

"I see...still, you have me, and I wouldn't judge you. Perhaps you can stay with me and perhaps we can find something for you out there."

"Do you mean that? Truly?" The Voice asked, drawing close enough to really have a tangible presence.

"I do, Pinie Promise. Cross my heart and hope to fly, stick a cupcake in my eye." Fluttershy replied, doing the motions Pinkie had taught her back in grade school.

"I'd like that very much, thank you."
15122122121221.title: Lost Woods Guidance

choices: "I guess I am tired. Let's sleep."
The voice reveals itself
151221221212212.content:
Fluttershy kept following the voice for a ways before it started to whisper to itself. "Let's see...left at the bushes higher then usual...then....right? No...left?" "Umm...is everything alright?" "I told you my memory is hazy alright? I just need to recollect myself. Okay....this way." Fluttershy put a sticky finger to her chin but still trusted the voice as it led her down a path that got darker with every step. "Umm....how much longer is it? Are you sure you know.."
A thick splatting sound brought's Fluttershy's words and walk to a halt. She dreaded to look down, having a clear idea what she just stepped in. "Uh oh...This ain't the right way at all! Wrong lefts and rights! Get running!" Fluttershy didn't need to be told twice for turning around. When she did however....
"Hello sweet*yawn* dear." Multiple muckberries were in front of her, each with either a sick smile or a tired glance. "Wh...how...I thought..." "We're connected to all the muck of the marsh our little hybrid. We*yawn* can project anywhere and can stand outside for more*yawn* then enough time. It was just*yawn* a matter of following the essence we left in you." The muck women stepped forward, their tightly held bodies and close proximity making her believe she might not sneak away. "Stay away from her muckberrys!" The voice cried out, prompting...smiles? "Ah...we*yawn* see you've found our little friend." "Friend?" Fluttershy questioned, still a little unsure who the heck to believe. "Our little friend, we told you*yawn* you would be drawn back to us. In exchange for leaving her alone, she *yawns* sends lost girls to us. Fluttershy didn't want to believe this, however there was something that just seemed believeable. "Don't listen to them! You can fight them! Just.." "Give*yawn* it a rest, we've told her the truth. She just needs to come back into the marshes so we can end her pain and sadness. Besides, she*yawn* misses the sleep we provide, don't you Fluttershy?" Fluttershy was once more in a state where she didn't know what to do. It just seemed like such a believeable deal since the voice didn't want to leave before.
151221221212212.title: The Muckladies catch up and confront the duo

choices: Fluttershy runs away in fear of the rumors
Fluttershy demands for an explaination
1512212212122122.content:
"That's it! No more staling around you lot! I'm gonna finally thrash you like I should have when we first met!" the Voice raged back before leaping form the shadowy above. Fluttershy cocked an eyebrow as a person came into view not that different from Rainbow Dash, save for her also being some kind of Muck-hybrid like herself. "Now you're gonna get it!" she shouted before morphing her hand into a mace-like ball and whipped it into the crowd of muchladies, splattering the women into the murky depths for the moment. "Fluttershy! Run!"

"Okay!" Fluttershy replied, booking it out of the blue goo and next to her saving grace beside her, ducking behind the newest face in the marshes. "wh-who are you?"

"Name's Firefly, part of the first graduating class of CHS. Got trapped down here on a dare day after graduation and been trapped since. Look, we gotta go before..." she said before the muckladies had reformed, their bodies hugging close to the shores, their hands groping for the bodies of the non-conformists.

"Come now, there's no...*yawn*...reason to run away. Join us."

"Quick, up into the trees!" Firefly commanded, grabbing Fluttershy around the waist and catapulting herself into the shadows above.
1512212212122122.title: Emerging from the Fog

choices: Fluttershy gives away their spot...and her freedom
"One slip up and were done."
15122122121221222.content:
The two landed on a branch above, able to survey the search that was taking place. Eith with their tired seeming movements, the beings below wasted no time in combing the area. "Come on out *yawn* you two, you can't run forever." "You must be so tired from all your*yawn* pointless resistance, come down so we can help you sleep." "She'll just hand you ov*yawn*er anyways deary, so just come back to us." Firefly chuckled as the muckladies below merely passed around the tree, her half-slime body resting on the limbs. "Don't worry Fluttershy, they haven't found out how I hide yet and they never will*yawn* Sorry, being half-way one of them does give ya a little need to sleep." Fluttershy wanted to smile, but her mind began to think over just what those muckberries had said about this Firefly character. "What they said about you.....is it true?" "What?" "How you've been helping them*yawn* bring others?" If Firefly wasn't muck, her expression would indicate she was sweating a little. "Look, what they said doesn't matter. All that matters is..." "Tell me please, did they mean what they said?" Firefly still kept acting like she was hiding something, prompting Fluttershy to pull out her main tactic. Within seconds, a cold hard stare began to pierce right into Firefly. "Well? Were they lying or not?"

Firefly wanted to be quiet, but the stare she was receiving just couldn't be beat. "Well.....at first......back when I thought I had a chance to go back...I...may have offered to help." Fluttershy's increasingly disapproving look only added to Firefly's guilt as she continued. "I had resisted thier change, but they were closing in on me. I offered my assistance only to save my sanity. At first, I thought maybe if I could find my way back then I could save those I lead mistakenly. After a while though, I realized what happens when one becomes a full muckberry. The transformation is bad enough, but it gets worse. You forget your name, you forget your past, you could easily forget what happened an hour before. All one would care about is sleeping, enjoying the company of other muckberrys, and converting others. When I found you, you......you reminded me so much of me. I....I wanted to do the right thing for once." Fluttershy stared at Firefly with a look of anger and distrust she only gave to the worst of her morality compass, and that's a short list. "So....how do I know I can trust you now that I know your little secret?" Firefly kept silent, unable to say anything. "Is there even a way out? Am I stuck here?!"

"Do you girls*yawn* hear something?" Fluttershy's tone was beginning to attract some of the muckberries that were still on land. Fluttershy looked between them and the hybrid in front of her, neither option seeming like the best but both had something to give.
15122122121221222.title: Fluttershy demands for an explaination

choices: The two make it to Firefly's treehouse
Firefly points out a shaft of light from above
151221221212212222.content:
Firefly snatched at Fluttershy's lips and held ten shut as the muchberries passed them by beneath them.

"Look, I get it. I'm nobody's hero for what I've done in the past. But look, I really want to do better not just for me, but for everyone who suffered because I was being selfish. I know there's some kind of exit that can get us to the surface where we can get help. Heck, we might be able to save these muckberries and cure them of this blueberry sludge. But we're not gonna be able to if we're caught and converted. I need you to trust me, at least to get out of here. After that, I wouldn't ask anything of you, considering what I said. Can you trust me enough to get us out of here?" Firefly extended her hand out, wanting a firm shake.

"Well I uh..." Fluttershy stammered, her fretful nature interfering with her need to escape. Sure, Firefly had done so pretty terrible things by the sound of it but her voice and face rang true with determination and honesty. Setting her fears aside, she grasped hold of Firefly's hand, giving it a solid shake. "For now, we're partners."

"Excellent! Glad to have you aboard, partner!" Firefly beamed warmly as she motioned for her compatriot to follow her deeper into the depths of the forests above.
151221221212212222.title: A Partnership Forged

choices: Now Firefly is the suspicious one
The two get hungry before the thought could process further
1512212212122122221.content:
The branches were thick and multiple, but with their somewhat slippery bodies, they were able to pass through. The tired calls of the muckberries became farther and farther much to the enjoyment of both hybrids. "It isn't exactly easy here..." Firefly stated, "....but I was able to make a little home here for myself. We'll go there to discuss our plan of action." Fluttershy nodded as she followed quickly yet cautiously. Cautious because she still wasn't 100% trusting of Firefly, but also of the fact that the ground was so far away whenever she looked down. "Relax Fluttershy, there's nothing to worry about falling. Even without our muck bodies, our juice-filled guts would just bounce us back." Fluttershy gulped, but still kept scared. After a few minutes, Firefly declared. "Home sweet home. There she is!" Fluttershy looked and gasped in awe at the marvel before her. It was a large treehouse settled with the thick branches of multiple trees to the point that it would seem invisible from the ground. "Yeah...I prefer to keep hidden even from 'them.' I don't want them converting me while I sleep." The two walked to the wide door and Firefly opened it, motioning inside. "Being my guest of course. Oh, and excuse the mess, I don't really get a lot of visitors up here." Fluttershy nodded as she walked inside. On the inside, this treehouse seemed like a legit home. A couch and some makeshift chairs made of a blue cotton and slime, and.....actually that was all there was. Not really a legit house actually.
"Alright, now onto the subject of getting out of here. If I guess correctly, you came by a hole in the ground right?" "Yes," Fluttershy let out an unwanted yawn before continuing, "...I fell while following a little blueberry fairy." At this mention, Firefly nodded. "I was dared to go down some cavern at the base of a cliff, I guess it was the same case." Firefly put a slimy hand to her also slimy chin as if thinking. "You know, I think a small fairy was what led me to those muckberries in the first place." "Really? What did she look like?" "Well, now that I think about it....she looked......just...like....you...."
1512212212122122221.title: The two make it to Firefly's treehouse

"Now wait a minute...!" Firefly started as her index finger pointed squarely into Fluttershy's chest. "That fairy looked exactly like you! What in the hay s going on? You're not a spy are you? To think I could have been helping the enemy of all things!"

"How does that make any sense? I was tricked by that fairy too! If anyone is to blame, it would be her!" Fluttershy protested.

"I don't know, how does it make sense we had seen the same fairy that looks like your spitting image?!"

"But I just got here! I'd never have the time or the power to make anything that bad..."

"Gah! This is really messing with my head...look, our alliance is shaky as is. We need to keep our heads on straight if we're gonna find that cliff and get the heck outta here."

"Agreed," Fluttershy replied, giving a firm nod. "Is there anything you know of that could help us get to that hole?"
15122122121221222211.title: Momentary Tension

choices: The two hybrids hit the road
They leave the hut....Muckberry Ambush!!
151221221212212222111.content:
Firefly bit her blue lips as her eyes closed in thought. In the silence of the moment, Fluttershy's mind wandered back to the fairy that brought her here. How could it have been possible for such a figure to exist for such a long time? Why the heck was it in her image in the first place? Why did it seem a little too coincidental the same fairy would have led them both here? After yawning unintentionally, Firefly brought her fellow muckberry hybrid from her thoughts. "Well...I have seen this one shaft of light before. I guess I just took it as the idea that I couldn't go home no matter how hard I reached. Darkness is usually what rules aside from whatever keeps all of us from being blinded by it so that must lead some way back to the surface." "Great!" Fluttershy said as she got off the chair, leaving a new blue imprint to the many others on it. "If so, then what are we waiting for?" Firefly fidgeted before letting loose her words. "Well...the reason I can see the shaft...well....just come and see." Firefly pointed to the window and motioned Fluttershy to go to it. Going across it as such, Fluttershy stood in fear. She could see the light...and it was surrounded by a thicker shade of darkness. Not only that, but the jungle seemed more sense and foreboding and she could see more blueberry sludge perfect for a muckberry to melt into and have a wonderful rest, forgetting whatever worthless cares of...

FLUTTERSHY!

"Sorry Firefly, I just couldn't focus." "Anyways, even though I haven't strayed far from this part of Blueberryland, I can tell you darkness is not good. There's no telling what we may run into. We might meet more powerful muckberries or other blueberry freaks waiting to make us like them...or lunch." Fluttershy shook in fear over the thought, her body reacting as such. Noting her body was jiggling as so however only heightened her resolve to say....
"We don't have a choice...we have to leave." Firefly nodded before looking around the hit. "I don't think I'll miss this place either way. Alright partner, let's go."

"Hopefully, this should still be the Muckberry's time. We shouldn't have to worry about any of them on the ground." The two made their way over branches, peering down at the ground below them and the slime-coated fruit around them. "Slime Berries." Firefly groaned. "These things can transform you as much as a muckberry if you eat enough." Fluttershy nodded, although felt a strange slorch coming from her stomach. She tried to look at something else, only to see the muck below her. It seemed thicker in this part of the swamp...."probably a lot more comfortable too." Fluttershy shook her head, trying to fight off her muckberry urges. Unbenounced to our duo, the muckberries below them were waking up. These muckberries, a siren variant noticed the two and felt the weaker will of Fluttershy.

"Frankly, we don't have to many options to go on at the moment. As I see it, if we can stall out long enough for them to nap, we may have a shot at sneaking over the initial muck and escaping," Firefly explained, gesturing with her slimy hand.

"Alright Fluttershy, t's your turn. Just look at me and throw your all into your jump. Don't worry, I'll catch you!" she outstretched her arms in a show of good faith. She holds of as Firefly has a plan

The Muckberries try and intervene once more

"Okay, so this is what I'm thinking: I'll clamber up with some vines from the bushes here and then fashion a rope so you can grab om for me to help you up. Sounds good?"

"Y=yeah, that sounds fine."

"Good, I'll grapple hold of these vines here..." Firefly started as she plucked several lengthy strands of plant, binding them together into a loose coil around her shoulder. 15122122121221222211211222.title: Clambering for Success

choices: She falls into thier arms
She runs off
151221221212212222112112222.content:
Fluttershy began to walk to the vines when she heard something distant. She looked back to the tunnel, knowing perfectly well just what is was that she heard. "Oh no...." she whispered as she took hold of the vine-rope. Being in her slimey state, it was naturally hard to get a good grip on the vine and her current fear wasn't helping her focus. "What's up Fluttershy?" Firefly called down, noticing her partner's frantic pace. Then she heard it too. "Oh great, they're waking up! Hurry Fluttershy before they realize what's going on!" Down below, Fluttershy kept trying to get what she thought was a good grip. As she kept fumbling around, her fears kept getting the best of her and her mind began to create pictures in her head of failure. She began to whimper at the thoughts, hoping that the Muckberries couldn't hear her. Much to the delight of her fears however, the slimy sounds of semi-solid footsteps echoed through the base of the cave. Fluttershy began to shiver in fear and Firefly wasn't too far off. "Just get some kind of hold Fluttershy so I can pull you up!!" But it was too late, they were already at the end of the cavern and staring poor Fluttershy in the face.

Flanked by at least four others, the lead Muckberry took a step towards Fluttershy. "Why dearie....*yawn*..what are you doing being so physical? Haven't yo*yawn*u learned by now that it's just better to rest and not worry?" Fluttershy's not-so-solid back was now up against the wall of the cavern, the hybrid seemingly forgetting about the rope. The lead took a look to the bushes and gave a frown, even though her naturally tired face often made it impossible to tell otherwise. "You didn't even *yawn* bother to have a little blueberry snack beforehand. Slime blueberries, a *yawn* true delight in an existence of endless delight." Other Muckberries began to enter while the leader gave a waving finger to the hybrid. "You must be so tired after all*yawn* that running around. Why not come back and take a little nap? *yawn* We know you'll *yawn* love it." The tired vibe once again began to reach Fluttershy and her already mucky body intensified it. From up above, Firefly called down to the group. "I'd leave her alone if I were you, I don't think you want any of this again!" A few of the muckberries looked up and began walking to the rope before the lead stopped them. "Why would you need to worry about us anymore dear?*yawn* You've finally gotten what you wanted all this time, a way back to the surface. You no longer need to*yawn* worry about us or anyone that stumbles to us. Then again, you never did in the first place. Just let us have this one and we'll*yawn* let you go. However...if this girl really means so much, then you can take her place. So many*yawn* of us have been wanting you a part of the muck for so long. You come down, she*yawn* goes free. We can't take away the gifts we gave her, but I*yawn*think she'll be happy with them." Firefly looked down to Fluttershy, who was taking a tired step towards the waiting arms of the leader. "Fire....fly..." The mumble from Fluttershy was all Firefly heard before she made her decision.

1512212212122122221121122221.content:
With her final words, Fluttershy's knees buckled, her mind blacking out as her limp form sagged into the lead muckberry's hands.

"Well then. Seems we...*yawn*...have to welcome our friend to her destiny." Firefly stepped back in shock, her face taking on a much paler coloration. Shoot! She's out cold! Darn...I've got to save her!... she thought before turning her attention to her vine rope. If Daring Do can pull it off...

"Not on my watch you slimy creeps!" Firefly bellowed from the top of the cliff as she gathered a chunk of vine into her hand. With a jump and a swing, she took to racing alongside the walls of the drop, building momentum. The muckberries simply looked on in confusion, the lead grinning in the hopes of claiming both girls under their collective sway. Her dreams were sadly broken as Firefly's foot caused any muck between her and her friend to splatter and scatter into the floor of the cave.

"You can't stop what...*yawn*...we've started."

"Not like you can resist either!" Firefly cheered as her foot slammed heel-first into the leader's mucky face, causing it to splash and splatter into the rocky ground below. With a graceful flip, Firefly landed onto the ground beneath her, scooping up her friend. "What am I gonna do with you..."

15122122121221222211211222212.content:
Firefly knew it wouldn't be long before the muckberries would reform and she had no intention of sticking around. Making sure her grip on her fellow escapee was as tight as a slimy surface could make it when gripping another slimy surface, Firefly made her way back to the rope. I was going to be difficult, no doubt, but she had to climb out now or all would be lost. With careful concentration, her free hand took hold of the vine and began climbing up. She grunted as she slowly lifted the pair off the ground and to the light above. With only one hand that was free while the other gripped her friend, it wasn't exactly easy to climb up. This in itself was a bad sign as the muckberries below them began to reform. Watching the horror under her though gave the hybrid an idea, she just had to hope that they were muck enough. "I really don't want to do this but if it can free up my other hand....." After a minute of wiggling around, Firefly's plan worked! Fluttershy had now been partially sunk into her body just enough to free up her other hand. Needless to say, the experience was uncomfortable and rather disturbing but it had to be done. With both hand now usable, Firefly was able to pull the two up and out before the lead muckberry was able to reform. "*Yawn* Oh well.....it's too late to stop it anyways......The newer one has nearly finished her conversion. Anyways.....*yawn* I could use a nap." The other muckberries nodded and followed their leader as she made her way back to the muck. None of them noticed a small blue light passing over their naturally tried heads, flying straight in the direction the two hybrids left.

Firefly pushed Fluttershy through the hole first, taking a deep breath in before poking out herself. The first response was brightness, having become accustomed to the darkness below. Once her eyes adjusted, Firefly looked at the world she had left long long. "Wow.....I....it's just how I remembered it." A murky tear fell from her eyes as she looked upon the green vegetation - not blue with a green tint- full on green. In a nearby tree were apples, now blueberries or blueberries shaped like apple, but the real red deal. Firefly looked to Fluttershy, who was still sleeping but peacefully. Firefly sighed, "Sleeping...not worrying about what it will do to you. For once, a nap sounds like a good idea to me." Allowing herself to yawn for the first time in years, Firefly layed her head on the green grass and soft, brown dirt.

Hey!

The girls gasped in horror as Twilight's hands began to become translucent, a drippy murky texture overlaying her skin. Twilight jumped back in shock, clenching her hand as it melded back into its normal flesh and blood.

"Whatever has enchanted them, they placed a strong encryption that prevents me from changing them back while I'm here. At least, not without some very heavy repercussions.," Twilight explained as she curled her fingers, testing the restoration of her hand.

"Ten that makes things simple then," Dash intersected. "You just take them to Equestria, fix them up without the problems of whatever encrypto-thingy blocking your powers and then bring them back, no harm no foul."

Granted, I'd have more magic to work at decrypting whatever is blocking me and maybe have a little extra protection from the counter magic. Still, this isn't going to be a one-day operation to fix this. It could be hours, days, even weeks if it's that bad."

"Oh my, that sounds like quite the experience," Rarity commented.

"But it's worth it! ...Isn't it?" Dash pleaded.

"Of course it is, but the amount of time needed for this could put a damper on things over here for a while," Twilight said as her gaze glanced down to the unfamiliar figure beside Fluttershy. 15122122121222.content:
Under most circumstanes, Fluttershy was never one to push away help. The voice did sound kind and considerate and she really wanted to go home. However, the muckberries had sounded kind too and now her body was a blue mush keeping together. Plus, it always was hard to trust something one couldn't see. Fluttershy remained silent for a few seconds before the voice have a pouring 'humph.' "Well...I guess I can't blame after whatever the muckberries did to you. However, if you change your mind then come on back. I'll see you, I know."

With that, Fluttershy felt like the presence of whatever was speaking had left her. Gathering herself and standing up, Fluttershy took a direction and starting walking. Taking another glance to herself, Fluttershy had begun to notice how big she was. Her clothes must had slipped off as well, leaving nothing of human kind on her except her form. Just as well because her shirt for certain would have snapped. Either way, the hybrid sauntered along, nothing a little more light poking through the darkness of the dismal swamp. Believing it to be a way back, Fluttershy picked up the pace, her blue slimy gut wobbling with every step.

"B-but..." She started to protest before being shushed with an oozing blue finger.

"Please...we promise this transition is...*yawn*...for the best down here," the being spoke softly, lightly caressing Fluttershy's sickly sweet blue hair. Her fingers slide effortlessly around the gooey strands that formed the bangs. "You look so pretty...*yawn*...in blue. It really suits you."

"Oh, um, thank you...*yawn*" Fluttershy replied, still unable to shake the tiredness overtaking her changing form. "Why am I...*yawn*...so tired now?"

It felt so much easier to just let it all happen. Both hands of the woman now held softly Fluttershy's face as her hair began to drip more and more. "That's it sweet dear." She said in a cooing voice, "Just..*yawn* give in. It's pointless to resist so don't worry." "Pointless...don't worry." Fluttershy yawned out as she felt her body blow up a little more. "That's right, you're one of us more*yawn* by the second. Your body i*yawn*is already merging with the swamp. Fluttershy looked down and smiled, her legs were slowly vanishing, merging with the substance she was now mostly made of. Her clothes, between both the strain of her growing stomach and her odd new body, simply sank in. A memory of Fluttershy's old life that she was too tired to care about now. By now, it seemed that there was no fully solid part of transforming girl left. Fluttershy didn't care though, a blueberrymuckgirl didn't need to be solid to be happy. The woman smiled with her eyes looking over the girl once more. "You are*yawn* almost truly one of us, but there is just one more thing*yawn* to do." Before the sleepy Fluttershy could even ask, she felt herself pulled into another kiss. This time, Fluttershy could feel the piece flowing into her and reaching into the one part of her left to transform: her soul. After awhile, the two pulled away as Fluttershy's body was now as big as any other muck girl. "You are *yawn* now one of us. This is now where*yawn* you belong." Others began to rise up from the muck to welcome their new girl, all yawning instead of saying anything. Fluttershy yawned along with them and one by one, the muck women began to merge back into the muck. Fluttershy joined them, loving the feeling of sinking away, becoming one with her new life. Her new purpose. Her new living bed.
151221221221.title: The process finishes its course, Fluttershy is ...

1512212212211.content:
Time never seemed to pass quickly in BlueberryLand, the ladies of the muck always finding time to siply lounge or sleep away their time. So little ever changed, the sky always a murky grey-blue, the grasses tall and plentiful and the slimy murk they called home always the perfect temperature for a good nap. Fluttershy never did figure out how long she had been there, or if anyone ever came to look for her, but neither seemed to bother her. If anything, she could barely remember much of what it was like being a regular human. There was the odd memory here or there, something about saving some school with people she could barely recall. Anytime it came to mind, she would simply shrug it off, the last visages of her humanity slipping away into the voids of the marshlands she called home.

It was true thather friends had searched high and low for her days after she had disappeared. Princess Twilight had searched hardest of all, still coming back weekly to the human world in the hopes to find her friend. But search after search and the nagging duties of princessdom cut the searches down to monthly, then yearly and soon enough, most people sort of just forgot, Fluttershy becoming a fading memory of a hero who's legacy was only found in aging yearbooks. It was sad for some to watch their friend seemingly evaporate from the public conscious, but evidence proved that her reappearance was somewhere between never and dead. And for their sake, they left it on never to remain at least somewhat positive about it.

For what it was worth, Flutterslime was at least very happy where she ended up and had all the loving company she could ever ask for. And perhaps, that''s the best place to leave her, in the arms of those who understand.

1512212212212.content: For many hours, all was quiet within the dark, blue swamp. Soon enough, the newest muckberry Fluttershy formed from the ooze to join her muckberry sisters in their intense yawning. After opening her eyes and closing her mouth, Fluttershy looked to her body. Her slimy hands felt across her stomach, almost two times, maybe even three times bigger than her old boring human body. Without a need for the clothes that had long settled into the unreachable bottom of the marsh, Fluttershy's mucky body was on display for all her fellow muckberries to see as was they. "How does *yawn*...it feel my dear?" Fluttersgy slowly turned to the sleepy form of the lead muckberry who had converted her and smiled. "I...I...*yawn*...can't describe it...already my *yawn* old boring life is leaving*yawn* all traces...." "As they should, they have no purpose for you now..." The two muckberries yawned before Fluttershy put a slimy hand to the her friend's face. "You know....I suppose I should*yawn* thank you.....and I'm not the only*yawn* one who looks pretty in blue...." With a gleeful smile, the muckberry knew where her new sister was going....

"Hmm? Oh, it's just a vine, whew," she sighed in relief, drawing herself closer to the green protrusion from the bush. "Strange, I wonder what triggered it to poke out?" Deciding to act on her curiosity, Fluttershy stretched out her finger and gave the vine a little prod. She flinched back, but the vine merely wiggled a little, unfurling just a tad to reveal more of itself. She drew close, holding out her finger again when the vine curled around her pointer finger, tightly gripping hold of her.

"Wha? Please let go," she meekly mumbled, trying to pull her finger away before being tugged back with a much greater force than she expected. Her eyes went wide as she struggled harder against the sudden dragging force of the vine. "Please! Let me go!" she whined out, digging her heels into the earth and holding out as best she could. Unfortunately for her, she found herself sliding along the ground. More vines slithered out, snagging along her skirt and legs. Fluttershy let out a sharp scream before being consumed by the bushes entirely.

“Fluttershy breakfast is ready.” Ms. Shy said calling from the kitchen

“Coming mom.” Fluttershy replied in a nervous tone.

Just as Fluttershy waking thinking about how she was going to change clothes in her current condition she noticed two strange machines standing standing side by side on the other side of her room. One was labed “Juicer” and the other one was labed “Auto-changer”.

“These weren’t her yesterday.” Fluttershy said to herself in a confused tone. “Maybe that Auto-changer will change my clothes for me.”

So Fluttershy waddled towards the auto-changer and step on the center of it. The machine then covers her body save for her head which was accompanied by sounds similar to a washing machine and in a matter of seconds Fluttershy had on her usual outfit.

“Well that was fast.” Fluttershy said in a surprised tone.

Then Fluttershy waddled out of her room and towards the kitchen where she saw her mom put out blueberry muffins and bagels on the table. But what really stood out to her was that her mother looked like her normal self except for her blue skin.

“Good morning Fluttershy.” Ms. Shy said in her usual calm and polite tone.

“Morning mom.” Fluttershy replied in s slightly curious tone. “Are you feeling okay?”

“Oh don’t worry about me sweetie I just needed to juice myself before I made breakfast, but I should inflate back to normal within a half an hour.” Ms. Shy stated with a slight chuckle. “Speaking of juice, you may need to juice yourself soon as well, you don’t want to get too big or you won’t be able to move by yourself.”

While Fluttershy was putting a bagel on her plate, her younger brother Zephyr Breeze entered the kitchen and she noticed that aside from the blue skin he looked they way he usually does. Fluttershy then remembers that when she looked out the window this morning she noticed that only the females were rolling around as blueberries while the males were more or less the same aside from the blue skin.

“Morning mom, morning big berry sis.” Zephyr said in his usual attitude.

“Morning Zephyr, care join your sister for breakfast?” Ms. Shy asked curiously.

“Wish I could mom but I gotta bolt to the hair salon, can’t keep those berrygirls waiting.” Zephyr replied as he quickly gathered his things.

“Well at least Zephyr is still the same.” Fluttershy thought to herself while slightly rolling her eyes.

With that Zephyr Breeze left as quick as he arrived leaving Fluttershy to eat her bagel in peace. As Fluttershy noticed that the blueberries really elevated the flavor the bagel and with every bite the taste kept improving.

*doorbell rings*

“I’ll get it Fluttershy you just enjoy your breakfast.” Ms. Shy said as she exited the kitchen.

Then Fluttershy heard her mother open the door which then accompanied by two additional pairs of footsteps heading towards the kitchen. Fluttershy slowly turned around and saw her mother along with...

15231.content:
The bell signaling the five minute warning rang loud and clear for all the students of Canterlot High to hear. The beautiful halls became abuzz as students began rushing about to collect thier things and make it to class. Lockers were opened and closed like clockwork with the ticking of combinations adding to the feel. The faces of the multi-colored students ranged from the average 'As long as I don't stay forever' look to the even mkre noticeable 'bored from heck and back' expression. In all of this chaos, one girl was prancing through the thick of it. A particular girl with poofy pink hair and an attitude that could brighten almost anyone's day. This girl, know as Pinkie Pie to her friends, was happily skipping to class with her backpack hidden away in her nearly bottomless hair. No one would question this as......

Hey!! Can we speed this up already?! I'm certain the readers want to get into this fascinating story arc. By the way, Happy 1000th Chapter Goldscout! I'd love to throw you a party but I have a story to star in!

.....alrighty then....

Anyways....Pinkie walked into what was mostly likely her favorite first class: Baking! The stoves all nicely placed at the back of the room with all the ingredients stored in cupboards and shelves all familiar to the happy, pink girl. As she sat at a table, she noticed an odd container on the counter of each station. Pinkie went to examine it as students began coming in. Each container was a blue cylinder with no distinct label except for an inscription on the cerulan cap reading BE-14. The bell signaling the beginning of school was in the last seconds before ringing when Pinkie zipped into her chair. After the ringing ended, intercom box clicked on and the calming voice of Principal Celestia came through.

"Good morning students. It's great to see all of you back from your undoubtibly exciting weekends. For morning announcments, I only have one announcement although it is important. As of today, a new dietary rule is being implemented into the school. From now on, all foods cooked, baked, or otherwise in school must be made using a new supplement: BE-14 given to us by an undisclosed source. Also, all food brought to school must be laced with the supplement. There will be no exceptions to this rule, even for baked goods in bake sales and cooking class. Students or faculty found not following this rule will be sent to me for a.... discussion. I hope I have made myself clear. Anywho, have a pleasant day students."

Pinkie' s eyebrow raised at the notice but shrugged it off as the intercom clicked off and class begin. Pinkie rushed to the freezer and quickly pulled out the cupcakes she had been making. They were baked already, she just need to pour on the frosting, which was also freezing. Pinkie brought both to her station and began mixing. Glancing over to the can of BE-14, Pinkie wavered at the thought of putting it in.
Yeah. I mean I didn't even know what was in it, it could have been some sort of monsters has or some evil force of evil. However, Principal Celestia said it was mandatory and if she said it was fine then it must have been so I put it in. It made the frosting a nice blue tint with it's pink color.
Ahem...Pinkie wisked away at the thawing froating even as she poured it onto the cupcakes. They just looked so good, she wanted to try them so much......

Wait a second, blueberry? But the frosting I had made was pink lemonade flavored. Why would it taste like blueberries?

The thought rushed into Pinkie' s head as she examined the cupcake, particularly the blue frosting that was pink a second ago. "The second I had added the additive....." Pinkie grabbed the cylinder and examined it once more to make certain she had not missed any information. Sure enough, the only label on the container was the top label of BE-14. "What the heck was in this thing?" Pinkie continued to examine the BE-14 holder, unaware of the other students putting the supplement into thier recipes without question. Like that one time when my doctor told me I was eating too much sugar and needed to take some little pull whenever I ate. It gave the most nasty aftertaste but all I needed was more sugar to get rid of it. Anyways, like Mr. Narrator said, I am not about to just judge something from....

WILL YOU CUT THAT OUT???!!! I'm trying to tell a story for the internet to read and or add to and you keep interrupting!!!

"Who are you talking to Pinkie?" Sunset raised an eyebrow to her friend who seemed to be yelling at the ceiling. "Oh...just someone interesting. Anyways, something strange is going on with this whole BE-14 business. Rarity herself seemed rather indifferent to Pinkie's words. "Well, health in schools is getting to be an issue in some places. The remainder of the food was heartily swallowed down, each crumb finding its way into one or another's gullet with pleased sighs of content leaving everyone's mouths. Pinkie's eyes scanned across her friends' forms, finding that all the blue or purple on any of them seeming more vibrant than usual.

No kidding Pinkie, it seems all too obvious to me that whatever this blue stuff is that it's the root of these color anomalies. Hey, is that the lunch bell ringing?

Although my sister has given no complaints over it and she's eaten quite a bit of it." Celestia leaned back in her chair as she asked a question of her own. "Now..why this sudden need to ask Ms.Pie?" "Well...how do I put it? I've been seeing students get a little more...blue after eating food laced with with BE-14. As in color blue, as well as the blueberry taste on EVERYTHING!" Pinkie unintentionally grit her teeth with that last word, prompting a slight shiver from Celestia. However, the principal still kept her grin while her face conveyed thinking.
