The crate wasn't going anywhere on its own, but the person was getting away right now! With her mind made up, Scootaloo too crawled through the window, after the fleeing suspect.

Falling to the ground underneath the window, Scootaloo quickly picked herself up and looked around. The building she entered was in shambles, evident by the many broken windows and near darkness. Suddenly, a clank clank clank of footsteps on metal came from overhead. A catwalk, maybe? But that didn't matter. She had to get up there, or the person would get away!

How though?

Scootaloo looked around the room once more. It was large, like one big warehouse, so a staircase or ladder should be nearby. Or what about those things in the far right corner? They look like stacked boxes and crates. In fact, they could allow her to close the distance between her and the suspect.

A slamming door stole Scoot's attention. She needed to decide.

Applebloom had little trouble rushing ahead, blazing her own path through the hoards of fellow fair-goers. A small table was set up before the staircase leading up to the main platform being manned by one of Rarity's classmates, Berry Punch. The girls spoke to Berry and transcribed their signature to ensure their participation. "Alright contestants," Berry Punch began as she gathered the many competitors together before the main event."It's a pretty simple event. When you here the gunshot, dive your face into the pie and eat as much as you can. When you finish the pie, slide the tin over and take the next one in line. Whoever finishes the most tins of pie is declared the winners. Any questions?"

"I've got one," one of the competitors raised her hand. "How good are the pies?"

"Dunno, guess you'll have to find out," Berry replied, gaining some skeptical looks but otherwise everyone nodded and began to take their place. Applebloom sat herself directly next to Sweetie.

"Alright, we're goin' with yer plan for now. Best of luck to you," she whispered over to her friend.

"Did you hear something dear brother?" Flim asked as he pulled his head in from hanging out of the car.

"Hard to say over the roar of the road brother," Flam replied, focusing his eyes on the road in lookout against any local authorities. "But I should hope if you did, it wasn't our names."

"I've got a bad feeling it was," Flim spoke. His hand rested under his chin in thought. "You don't think..."

"I'd rather not if we don't have to," Flam waved his hand to swat away the negative suggestion. "We did our job as quickly and effeciently as we always do. We've got the cash, let's just make it to our next job."

"Right right. Let's see...what do you think about orchard picking?"

"Sounds fine, how far away?"

"At least fifty miles and is in the next state over!" Flim spoke with a wicked grin.

"We're on our way!" Flam replied with an equally wicked grin, the two making tracks for their newest scam across the border.

"Come on now girls, let's get y'all out of here," AJ spoke as she ranched the two berries into the open. Applebloom and Sweetie Belle, did as best they could to hurry along to AJ's truck, but their constant swelling hindered their walking speed to a waddle as the three skirted around the edges of the fairground. AJ kept her gaze sharp, peering around corners and walls as she waited for the two younger party members to waddle up to her position. She wished the traveling could have a better pace, but their was little she could do outside fo roll the two.

"Considerin' their state," AJ pondered aloud before shaking the thought from her head. "Nah, it ain't right. Be like treatin' them like they were fruits..."

"Neeeeh...AJ? How much farther till we get to your truck? I can barely walk without tripping over myself..." Sweetie wheezed as she reached the cowgirl.

"Yeah sis, this walkin' just doesn't work figurin' al this juice weighin' us down..." Applebloom added, giving her bulky thighs a soft squeeze.

"Not too much farther sugarcubes. Keep it up, we're almost there."

"Guys, get over here and look!" Several more heads poked from around the corner and stumbled to see the commotion their friend had seen.

"Golly..."

"That doesn't look right, not one but..."

"I think I'm gonna be sick..." AJ could see the crowds from the other open side of the tent blocking them rustling, knowing full and well their attention was drawn to the gaggle of Crystal Preppers gathered off the main path.

The whole group is over by mah truck to head off to the farm to 'clean them.'" Berry nodded, thinking over what could be done about this. "Hmmm....okay, I have an idea. If we tell them that I...wait...you said they're by your truck?" "Yeah, oh don't worry about anything like that. Ah have the keys in mah...." Applejack checked her side pocket, and then her other pocket. "Wait....ah thought ah....OH SWEET BURNT BARNBRICKS!!" The two rushed off, fearful of the worst.

"Okay...so.....take a left up at this stop sign." The car swerved left as the sign in question was right beside them. The other Shadowbolts held onto the door and belts with grips of iron. "Are you sure you know where you're going Sunny?" Indigo growled as she took a breath, "That's the third time you made me swerve like that." "I told you it's been a while and....RIGHT LANE!" 15332221.content:
"Ah, how I love the smell of the night! So fresh and clean!" Luna sighed contently as she gazed out open an open starry sky from her second-floor porch. Since she was a young lass, Luna had found a deep fascination and appreciation for the night sky and all the treasures in the heavens above. It was especially helpful after long days spent dealing with troublemakers and boring school statistics that her sister placed upon her.

"Let's see, telescope lens set and focused. Position set in the northern hemisphere for optimal gazing. And...perfect! Alright, time to see what's out here tonight!" she giggled in delight, peeking ito her telescope. Swinging it gently to and fro, she smiled as she pointed out her favorite constellations and satellites passing by. Suddenly, a strange, glowing body rushing across the sky caught her attention. Tracking the odd sight, her scope followed the object as it closed in on her position until it hung eerily over her.

"What in the..." she started before being interrupted by a harsh white light blinding her.
15332221.title: Brilliance in the Night Sky

choices: "What are you two?!"
"Um...sure...come in."
153322211.content: Luna closed her eyes in an attempt to shield herself from the white light, although even with her eyes closed the brightness did not leave. With her eyes closed, all Luna had to rely on was her ears to hear what was going on. She could hear the sounds of machinery coming from whatever structure was above her. The light seemed to ebb ever so slightly as a new sound came in, a strange resonating sound that could have come straight from a Science Fiction film. For a few minutes the sound kept coming along with a strange fruity smell. The light began to away, though Luna debated wether or not to open her eyes. After a minute, an unfamiliar Voice spoke out of the darkness. "Oh no...I think the poor dear is blinded." Curious as to who said that, Luna opened her eyes and found two beings in front of her. The one to the left had the body of a teenage female, jade hair in a bun and soft crimson eyes. Her green skin had dark lines around it and had an oval shaped roundness around it all. The one on the right had the form of an adult around Luna's age with violet skin and blue hair in a small stem like structure. Her indigo eyes looked over Luna and nodded, her hands resting on her large stomach. "She looks fine to me sis, I don't think we did any damge." The blue figure smiled at Luna before turning to the green being. "Now let us make a proper introduction." The blue figure stuck her hand out and her sister did likewise. "Hello, my name Berrona and this is my sister Meloni. We're sorry for the sudden arrival but all will be explained soon. May we come in?" Luna had been speechless during the whole ordeal, though still mindful enough to shake the two alien hands in front of her. Taking in a deep breath or two....dozen...Luna found the strength to speak.

"C-certainly! P-please, come in!" Luna bumbled out between he rlips, failing to hide her flabbergasted surprise at such a rather miraculous set of circumstances before her.

"Why thank you!" Meloni chirped, following in behind her cohort.

"You Earth-dwellers are always so hospitable to our kind!" Berrona chimed in, smiling broadly towards Luna.

"W-w-we?! You've b-been here before?" Luna continued to dribble out, practically unable to hold back her need to know what in all of the world was happening before her.

"Of course we've been here before! Your people are so invested in our mind, what with that awful Roswell accident all those years ago..."

Roswell?! Luna, you're in waaay over your head! You've gotta get rid of these things as fast as you can and pray the Government doesn't come snooping around! Luna thought as she sat in a small recliner opposite the aliens resting on her loveseat. "S-s-so, w-what can a person like me do for people like you?"

Luna's left hand gripped at the chair as the words sunk in while her right pulled at the her nightshirt's collar. "Umm.....excuse me? What do you mean....." "My sister and I wish for you to become on of our kind." Melon said in a slow, clear manner to make certain their host heard correctly. With a twitch of an eye, Luna stayed silent for a moment before giggling. The two fruity aliens glanced to each other in curiosity before Berrona questionsd. "Is there something comical about our proposal?" "Sorry, sorry, I think I am slowly beginning to realize I'm in a dream. Possibly caused by having on too many glasses of the punch in the staff breakroom." Meloni glanced to her sister again, though with a look that showed a smug nature. "I told you she would do this, you always have to be so direct about everything." With a turn to Luna, Meloni continued. "We can assure you Madame that you are awake. My sister and I do indeed wish to turn you into one of us. Just looking at you in person, we can see you have the nessacary DNA structure." Still believing this to be a dream, Luna smiled at the two. "How do plan to do that; zap me with some kind of DNA rearranging ray that would tailor me to whoever uses it?"

"Well, it's funny you put it like that," Berrona explained as she revealed a rather sleek, chromatic gun with odd knobs and electrodes attached on the sides.

"You're serious? Ha, I'll have to ask Ms Cheerilee what she put into the punch!" Luna guffawed as she started down the barrel of the futuristic gun. "Go ahead and fire! I'll just wake up and everything will be fine!"

"Glad you're willing! It'll tingle for a second, but it should settle shortly," Berrona explained as she fired, a wild purple bolt of lightning-like energy zapping and arching across Luna's body.

"Wooah!" Luna groaned as she felt the mutative energy plow through her every cell, as if all the fibers of her body had caught fire and then was blown away in a typhoon. And just as suddenly as it had came on, the surge vanished in a huff. "Gracious...that almost felt real..."

"We keep telling you that you are awake madame, why can't you understand?" Berrona complained, shaking her head. "Just look at your nose, it's already happening!"

Her nose, while still having a blue color, has a spot that seemed a little darker than the rest of her body. "What....what is happening?" "You said it yourself Madame. Our ray has changed the structure of your DNA and your body is already beginning to adapt to it all." Berrona said with a strange grin. "I do hope this will help you understand we are in reality." Luna felt across her nose, watching as it grew at a fair speed. Already her whole nose was consumed by the color and felt strangely different than skin. "Feels....I can feel it...this really is real." Meloni got off the couch along with her sister as they approached the woman. "Now that you know this is real, let us tell you there is no cause for alarm. We can assure you becoming one of us is quite a pleasure." Luna tried to drown out the words of the fruity alien as she saw and felt the blue creep across her face. 15332221223.content:
Unknown to Luna, she was still dreaming. Her room still looked normal, but when she opened the window she was greeted to the sight of a bright, blue, and futuristic city. For some reason Vice Principal Luna didn't seem to panic, it was like she was reliving a past event or something. Her room was mostly empty of her possessions with the sole possession she had was a helmet that looked like a metallic blueberry with a clear crystal visor attached to it on her nightstand. The helment Luna grabbed it and put it on. With a simple telepathic command from her mind, a drone was ejected and activated a recording camera. Luna cleared her throat and began to talk.

"Virtua Diary of Lieutenant Captain Luna of The Starship Cyanocus, Entry #1: Launch Day: Today is a proud moment for the planet of Blue-Berriea! My sister, Captain Celestia, and I will be leading some of the Blue-Berrien Federation's greatest scientists and engineers on a mission to colonize our first extraterrestrial planet!. This will be the greatest highlight of our careers in the Blue-Berrien Space Force keeping both the peace and diplomatic relations in the Fruictus System. To think for millennia, our spherical single gender species has developed so fast in the fields of science, culture, and prosperity, the possibility of Intergalactic travel is now but hours away. The colonization mission will be a brave undertaking since the planet my sister has chosen is outside our home galaxy, the Juicy Way.”

Luna then paused to take a look at her body, currently not a juice filled sphere, and had to address that, “Speaking of juice... I had juiced myself last night. Just to give the ship's reactors some extra energy as a precaution. Hopefully I can inflate back to size in time for the briefing, a full round body is a sign of good faith in the mission. Lieutenant Captain Luna out."

When the recording ended, a bright light forced Vice Principal Luna out of her vivid dream. Shielding herself from the bright light with her forearm, took a look at her surroundings. She wasn’t in her bedroom back home. The room Luna was in looked a large guest room, with a pair of circular beds with dark blue colors, a nightstand between the two, and a table on the far end with a pair of chairs, designed to seat something bigger than herself, and of course that bright fluorescent lighting on the ceiling which her eyes finally got adjusted to. The aesthetic of the room was clean and metallic blue, and generally looked like something out of one of those science fiction shows on TV. When Luna took a look to her right and she gasped when saw the planet Earth and outer space in view of the large window. Luna ran to gate and began to pound with her two fists.

"Hello! Is anybody here? Where am I? Where are you taking me? What have you done to me?" asked she loudly panicking. She didn’t get her answer, but her voice seemed to have activated a panel nearby.

"Voice recognized: Welcome back to the Starship Cyanocus, Lieutenant Captain Luna.." The panel spoke

"Lieutenant!? That doesn't make any sense! I’m a Vice Principal, not some space captain." Luna said worryingly.

The doorway slid open, leading to a hallway as the scent of blueberries emanated in the air. As Luna wandered out into the hallway of her abductor’s ship, something strange was going on in her mind. The ship looked abandoned for decades but everything was starting to look familiar for some reason the vice principal couldn’t explain. It was as if something deep within her subconscious was guiding her to something. She started to wonder if that dream was more of a flashback.
15332221223.title: Space Berries

choices: Luna keeps watching the entries
Luna wants to examine more of the ship
153322212232.content:
As much as Luna thought about pushing that idea from her head, there was just this feeling of calm homeliness around her that she couldn't shake off. Luna nevertheless continued to walk along the dusty hallway as it began to slowly light up as if her very presence was giving it life. Blue and white lights streamed across the sides while dark blue lighting came from the ceiling. Taking a deep breath of the blueberry scented air around her, Luna couldn't help but ease up some of the tension she was feeling. As the confused vice principal walked by a new doorway, she had to stop and look at the design. Specifically, she noticed two insignias of the sun and moon that she and her sister had been so strangely fond off all their lives. "What is this?" The panel to the side of the door shot sparks as an indistinguishable voice echoed through the halls. The door slid away, creaking and squeaking to reveal a rather uncomfortable scene. Large computers lined the rounded room, some screen blank while others were showing signs of static. Metal shavings littered the floor while almost invisible burn marks coated what few tables remained. Multiple chairs, rounded and large like the ones in the bedroom were either overturned or still together with two particularly large ones in front of a giant window showing the vast reaches of space. Luna glanced at the seat on the right and rushed over to see if she was indeed seeing what she was seeing. Lifting the object from the chair, Luna was certain it was the same helmet from that dream she had. In fact, it was almost in perfect condition save for a little dust on the visor. Without even thinking, she placed the blueberry-shaped device on her head and was soon enveloped in the colors of the visor. Two small pangs came to her head, but Luna showed no worry. The feeling of familiarity was slowly becoming greater and that only fed her curiosity to mentally request to view the previous recordings. The helmet made a ding sound before a screen popped from the device and grew to the size of a small television. To a lack of surprise, Luna saw her own self with her cheeks slightly pudgy and blurred workers behind her.

"Virtua Diary of Lieutenant Captain Luna of The Starship Cyanocus, Entry #2: Launching the ship yesterday was a success. Within minutes we had passed through our planet's gravity pull. Our ship has brought us right outside the Juicy Way. As I speak, the rings of planet Wato-Mela are a mere speck from the view of the cockpit. A few of our ship navigators have yet to directly find our target planet's current position but that is to be expected due to it's distance from us. Once we are in range, I will notify. Further more, our energy supplies are keeping a steady pace thanks to my extra fuel add-on. The crew, my sister and myself included just need to juice ourselves every once in awhile and we will have more than enough fuel. Nothing further to report. Lieutenant Captain Luna out."

There was no denying in Luna's mind that, at the very least, the being certainly looked like her. However her mind just refused to believe it. So many things just didn't add up. Nevertheless, Luna found it difficult to resist looking into more of her....these diary entries.

"Virtua Diary of Lieutenant Captain Luna of The Starship Cyanocus, Entry #3......
153322212232.title: Visions of the past

choices: Luna decides to skip ahead to the last few entries.
Luna decides to investigate the rest of the ship.
Luna's session is interrupted by a signal of some sort.
1533222122321.content:
"...It took a whole week for our navigators to lock on, but we were able to obtain the coordinates to our destination planet. A few crew members and I questioned the captain on why she had chosen that planet for colonization. My sister's answer was that the planet has many similarities to that of Blue-Berriea: It is capable of harboring life without the need of expensive terraforming; the planet has roughly the same rotational and orbital pattern as home, with twenty-four hours in one day and 365.27 solar days in a year; and while 71% of the planet is water, Celestia has assured everyone that there will be enough space for establishing a thriving colony. The Cyanocus is preparing for its first in a series of hyper-speed jumps which will make the voyage last as of now, 3 weeks. I looked at the stars of my galaxy one last time. As a young berry, I loved spending the weekend nights staring at them, and being amongst the stars was my main reason for joining the Space Force alongside my sister. Now I'm going to be leaving them, but I know the new planet have beautiful new stars to gaze at. Lieutenant Captain Luna out."

Luna had noticed that the counterpart's skin was now a more darker blue, her hair seemed to have a dark blue neon glow to it, but most importantly, the being's belly had grown to the size of an exercise ball. She was also wear a blue and silver spandex like uniform, that had a golden badge of a blueberry with a pair of space rings around it near the bottom of uniform's neck ring and a personalized moon emblem on both shoulders. Some of the content about the entry had Luna curious, the planet that was just mentioned almost sounded like Earth.

"Virtua Diary of Lieutenant Captain Luna of The Starship Cyanocus, Entry #4: We've just completed our first hyper-speed jump. We have to wait for the spatial Warp capacitor to cool down and recharge. The Cyanocus is not designed for prolonged use of hyper-speed or else we'd risk the ship breaking apart. We aren't in total deadlock as we still have our all engines engaged and the ship is still moving forward to the destination planet. Nothing else to report, Lieutenant Captain Luna out."

The next couple of diary entries after the space jump seemed to pace slowly, mostly about time spent in Cyanocus's Amenity Deck, participating in drills with the security officers, or overlooking the ship maintenance while preparing for another hyper speed jump. The vice principal could see some of the other crew members in better clarity this time, and they started to look familiar. Luna swore some of the alien berry women resembled... teachers at school and the other members of the Cyanocus crew were the mothers of the students attending Canterlot High. Her mind was still hazy due to what has happened to her so she couldn't put any names to the faces at the moment. The more she studied the entries, the more a part her of mind was opening up, but Luna was still anxious and confused.

"Are we really... aliens?" She had asked her self, as she put a darkened blue arm on top of the growing bulge of her abdomen.
1533222122321.title: Luna keeps watching the entries

choices: Luna's mind unlocks the memories of what happened next
Luna questions how this ship would still be running after so long
15332221223211.content:
With confusion and the intent of answering her questions, Luna continued to view the videos hidden in this Visor Berry.....it felt right to call it that. Mentally, she passed over a view entries feeling like they were going to be more of the same and instead reached the last few entries left. Mentally clicking on the video file, Luna was greeted by the sight of her very blue and visibly worried counterpart in what seemed to be the guest room.

"Virtua Diary of Lieutenant Captain Luna of The Starship Cyanocus, Entry #23: Sadly, the asteroid belt we had to blast through last week has indeed set us behind our suggested timetable. It certainly would have been worse had we decided to fly around it but I digress. Furthermore, I am beginning to suspect that we are being followed. Although it is most likely a stray asteroid caught in the path of our ship upon exiting hyperspace, something on the scanners triggers The Cyanocus' protection field and we swerve off course for a moment. But it is most likely paranoia. The real importance is that the galaxy that holds our captain's target is almost seeable on the main radar. What did she call it....'The Milky Way?" The entire crew has become excited as have my sister and I. I cannot wait to see what wonder await us on the planet's surface, what foods and spices and beauty are on that rock waiting for us to discover them? Look at me, I feel like when I received my first telescope. I need to head for the lounge and relax. Lieutenant Captain Luna out."

The Milky Way......the answer was becoming more and more clear to Luna as she put herself in the chair the Visor Berry was resting on. Despite this, there was still that part of her that was still questioning this. Everything she knew was coming into question and there was still no definitive answer to this. As the next video began, Luna's stomach was beginning to show through her shirt.

"Virtua Diary of Lieutenant Captain Luna of The Starship Cyanocus, Entry #24: We have just exited hyperspace and the planet is now on radar! While we still have a few more days before we enter the Milky Way, our crew is now ecstatic as am I. Our technicians are preparing the scouter pods for the moment we will be able to send them to the surface and mark our landing site. My sister and I already have our personal saucer ready in the docking bay, we want to make sure the first steps on that planet's soil by our kind are documented. Oh the excitement and suspense is... Warning! Warning! Unidentified object approaching ship's hull. Ready evasive maneuvers. .....what....what's going on? Unauthorized tethers detected. "Guards, defend this ship to the last berry! Security Monitors, activate the electro field and get those tethers off our ship! Signing out momentarily."

Luna held the arms of her chair while biting her dark blue lips. For a moment it almost sounded like the ship was saying those words just now. As her mind clicked on the last entry, her body shivered and jiggled with the sounds of juice. The screen was opened to a view of Luna in her seat whizzing past metal tubing.

"Virtua Diary of Lieutenant Captain Luna of The Starship Cyanocus, Last Entry: Our ship has been attacked by some unknown scourge, a near ethereal force that looks like that line of equine toys sold back home yelling to go back. Whatever it was, it seemed to want us gone. Our security fought it off with no casualties, but the engines have been exhausted and the juice converter appears to be either broken or stopped. We should have enough energy to make it to something but the crew has already entered the escape pods. What little of our scanners are left indicate that the target planet is the only livable area in galactic miles so we can only hope they are heading there. My sister and I are worried as much as the rest, our pods were not built for space travel of the distance required. Noberry could even imagine the possible effects on our mental and physical states. But we have no choice. With limited space, I am afraid I must leave the Visor Berry behind to bring along more essential supplies. If anyone or anything finds this message, please send word to Blue-Berria. This is Lieutenant Captian Luna, shutting down."

Luna wached as the seat stopped and the visor was torn from the vision's head. A plan view of Earth all that was seen before the seat began to rise again and shut off.
15332221223211.title: Luna decides to skip ahead to the last few entr...

After recording, Luna investigates how the ship is still functional.
Writer's Free choice
153322212232111.content:
Where the Visor Berry ended, Luna's mind began to fill in the blank as she flashed back to that fateful event.

***
Luna had just left her Visor Berry back the at bridge, and was rolling with sister to the evac bay. The ship was losing energy and soon the lights went out, with the Blue-Berriens with only thier glowing hair as the sole source of light. As they arrived they took a look at the equipment, those beings did some irreparable damage to it, with Celestia thinking it could only be fixed that stuff of young girl's tales known as "magic", and a good portion of it was now space debris when they forced the attackers out of the airlocks. She notice Luna staring at the wreckage.

"Are you okay?" Her sister asked.

"I'm fine, it's just..." Luna replied, trying to hide her tears of juice. "We were so close, and now the effort our planet has put into is gone..."

"It's alright Luna," Celestia assured, hugging (more like squishing their bellies together) her in attempt to comfort "we'll make it through

"Do you think those... things came from the planet?" Luna asked.

The captain gave it some thought, but then shook her head answering, "No, I don't think so. They must of followed us from that Asteroid field from when we exited hyperspace."

The Escape Pods were not ideal at all, looking a large blocky rectangle (her future self would of identified it as a van). It appeared fine from the outside and didn't look too damaged. Celestia opened the small cargo trunk and loaded whatever was left salvagable into a footlocker. After she put that into the trunk and closed it, Celestia then got into the pilot side, while Luna entered the passenger side and she could tell space would be cramped. Their bellies already began to chaff against the furniture of the cramped cockpit, and their heads started rubbing the cockpit ceiling. The only equiment was basic piloting, a guidence system, and no form of communication. The pods guidence system had set its coordinates to Earth and to meet up with the other evacuation pods. The escape pod's speed was good enough to catch up to ther others, but nowhere as fast than the Cyanocus.

"Hey, we can see the others!" Captain Celestia said.

"Would be great if we could communic..." Luna replied, before spotting something, "Wait a minute, what's that light? Is that a cosmic ray? We need to take evasive action."

"Relax, the shields will... oh, crap! The shields aren't activating, they must of been damaged in the attack!" Celestia yelled, recognizing they were powerless to protect themselves from it.

The cosmic ray shined it's bright light into the vessel on to the two Blue-Berriens, and it overwhelmed them. Luna and her sister tried to keep thier eyes closed, but instead, feeling light headed. Celestia was the first to pass out, and as Luna saw when she opened her eye, her sister's skin was changing color from a blueberry blue to a pinkish color. Luna unfortunately passed out into a coma soon after, not knowing her skin tone was changing as well, though not as radically as her sister. The glows from their hair was also vanishing. Worst, their minds also were also tampered with, making them lose their memories of their beloved home planet of Blue-Berriea. Every escape pod from the Cyanocus was affected by the cosmic ray beam with the inhabitants suffering the same fate as thier captains.

The escape pod flew towards the destination planet. It was a slow pace, and the only thing keeping the unconscious space travelers alive was their juice, slowly being drained into their bodies, losing their roundness. One and a half weeks passed and Cyanocus escape pods have reached the Earth. The pods were quickly pulled into the earth's gravity and began theier descent into planet in a spread, burning in the atomosphere in what the people of earth thought was a meteor shower in the night sky. The pods would normally extinguish after a while, but Celestia and Luna's pod had a fuel line malfunction that eject the footlocker and kept the vessel a burning fireball while crashing into the planet surface. When Luna awoke, the vehicle she and her sister were in had crashed into a ditch in the side of the road, and was now a smoldering pile of scrap. Two good Samaritans had gotten both Celestia and Luna out of the crash.

"What happened?" Celestia asked disoriented and confused.

"That crash must of done a number on you. We can't even find the tires to your van." One of the humans replied.

"Crash?" Luna replied hazily, "Yeah, it must of been that..."

The rest was history, Luna's human memories from that point on flashed before her eyes in quick succesion. Any human memory before that point in time must of been artificial constructs based on her alien ones.

***

Luna's flashback had ended. She could feel it within her as the juice started to slowly fill her legs and arms, Vice Principal Luna had finally remembered and accepted she was an alien blueberry woman known as a Blue-Berrien. She still had fear and anxiety as she realized there was now some serious implications this revelation has brought forth. A majority of an entire gender of Canterlot were secretly an extraterrestrial life. The students of Canterlot High would most certainly panic if they found out their mothers were aliens, especially the female students... who had Blue-Berrien DNA in their bodies completely dormant their whole lives. Luna wasn't sure what was the apporiate choice of action to take, but she had the feeling this truth would soon come out one way or another. With a mental click, Luna's Visor Berry deployed a familiar probe.

"Virtua Diary of Vice Prin... I mean, Lieutenant Captain Luna..."

1533222122321111.content: "Uhhhh...Twilight?" Are you sure this is safe?" Celestia's eyes twitched at the sight of large metallic strutcure Sunset was strapping herself into. "Positive Principal. Sunset and I have tested this thing at least a dozen times." SciTwi said proudly as she slapped on her goggles and punched some buttons on the console. It was quite a surprise how the girl's managed to carry all of this equptiment into the gym but it musr have been hard for two of the school's resident magic users. Celestia nodded, trusting the girl's pride in her work, but her distraught face didn't subside much to the notice of both Sunset and Twilight. "Celestia? Is something wrong" The principal sighed as she turned to the window and the morning sky outside. "I haven't seen my sister at all this morning. I thought maybe she just came here early but still nothing. Normally I wouldn't worry but I had a horrible dream that she was kidnapped." "Well....I doubt it's anything like that and I'm sure she's fine. Anyway, ready to show Celestia what our new toy does Sunset?" "Ready Twi!" Sunset shouted with a thumbs up. Being given the go, SciTwi pulled a lever on the side of the console and the ringed structure hummed with a purple glow. "So...how does this...thing work?" "It's quite simple really, using finite amounts of magic donated by the girl's and I this machine is able to map the genes in a person's body without the use of extracting blood or other unsettling methods. Any second now the magic frequencies are tuning through Sunset's body and examining her DNA and.....BINGO!" The screen on the console blinked as the magical teen's body showed up along with a double helix showing both her human DNA and her pony side still inside. "Fascinating." "Not really, like I said we've done this before on each other and for that matter not an average human. Want to try it for yourself?" Celestia looked back to Sunset as she unstrapped herself from the machine. "You'd really like it Principal Celestia, at the very least you get this awesome tingling sensation." "Well...I suppose I could use some excitement today." Celestia walked over to the chair and sat herself down with a hint of unease. Not for the duo's craftsmanship but more for something else. For some reason, as long as she could remember she had a strange distaste for cramped spaces. "Alright Celestia, here we go."

15332221223211112.content:
Principal Celestia strapped herself in, and she could feel her head scrape the ceiling. Celestia swore she had felt a discomfort like this before, but once the machine started, the magic that entered Celestia's body was actually giving her a relaxing sensation. The tingling sensation of the magic was like a massage, relieving tension her body down to the cellular level. In fact Celestia thought her mind was starting to feel reinvigorated, like some long lost part of her was starting to wake up.

"We'll be shoo-ins for the science fair 1st prize for sure. You'd be surprised what DNA can reveal about someone," Twilight said getting the results, "Your results is..."

However Twilight was in a confused shock when she got results on the console. The diagram showed Celestia's DNA was... "Blueberry Alien!?" Twilight asked, "That can't be right!"

"Something wrong Twilight?" Sunset asked.

"I think the machine's having a bug of some sort." SciTwi replied, "It's saying Celestia's... an alien!"

"What!?"

Sunset rushed over and took a look herself. Twilight already had the result printed out and was comparing it to the DNA to her own and Sunset's results.

"She should be human, obviously, but the identifier software we made last night is saying she's not. I can identify similarities in Celestia's DNA in my own but..."

"Is there something wrong?" Principal Celestia asked, getting out of the two teens' machine.

"Uh... Nope!" SciTwi lied, not wanting to freak her principal out, "We just need to uh... put some polish to the results and we'll be ready to present it tonight at the science fair."

"Well, I'll look forward it. I actually enjoyed what your machine did."

The school bell rang, signaling class was beginning to start. Thankfully Gym Class didn't require the actual gym today, so Sunset and Twilight were free to leave their invention where it was.

"Thank you, see you later." Sunset thanked quickly.

As the two teens headed to thier classes, they agreed to meet at lunch to figure out what had happened. Principal Celestia started to head for her office. Getting a smell of the fresh blueberry muffins from the Home Ec room, Celestia never realized how comforting that smell was. All that magic in made her feel so refreshed like never before. Granted she was still worried for her sister's whereabouts. Once she entered her office, she sat down at her desk. There wasn't any forms or paperwork to fill, so the principal had plenty of time to think about things.

"I hope Luna's okay," Celestia said to herself, "It isn't like her to worry... everyberry."

Something about that last word she said confused her, she wondered why it just felt normal of her to say all of sudden. Celestia closed her eyes to think about that, and some new instinct inside her was telling her it could lead to finding Luna.

153322212232111122.content: As Celestia opened her eyes, she found that she was still at her desk, but no longer was it a desk of a high school principal. Instead she now sat at the high quality desk fit for one of the best captains in the Blue-Berrien Space Force. Celestia showed no signs of worry towards her now huge, rounded belly and blue complextion. After all, it was only natural for her. A small drone dropped from an opening the celing, stopping at the foot of the desk and opening to show the face of someone Celestia strangely couldn't recognize. "Captain Celestia. As you are aware, you and your sister are highly decorated leaders for our forces and few other Blue-Berriens have managed to match your skills in bringing a ship out and home. Sure there were a few times we were jiggling in our juices but you two truley are the best. With that being said, you both should understand that this is a mission unlike anything taken before you. This planet rests far beyond the reaches of the Juicy Way and therefore will be highly unpredictable. We have understood and excepted your coordincoordinates ate and the planet does seem capable of sustaining other life. If that will be so, they will no doubt be of a primitive species. Why, they might actually believe that magic exists..." Celestia rolled her eyes jokingly, such a ridiculous notion. "Nevertheless, the key to a peaceful and simple colonization will rely on how well we can attract the natives to our ways. Now if anyberry is to have a chance to teach the inhabitants our ways, they must be prepared with all of the information they can contain. We are all aware you two graduated with top honors from Brightwell University but it is better to patch the bucket before juice spills. "And so, we have prepared a small presentation for you to show to the natives. You'll be able to access this anytime on the ship when we install it into the system. Please inform us if you have anything to add to it." The screen faded to black for a moment before changing colors and shapes to resemble a retention swirl. Celestia herself often used these to study for exams back at the university. As Celestia began to stare into the floating spiral,a calming voice began to speak. "A quick announcement before I begin, this is not meant as a communication screen. If you are a ship worker, please recall the teleportation code for your ship. Just punch it into a transponder and an person aboard your ship will bring you up shortly......."

1533222122321111221.content:
Celestia knew the teleport code and entered it to her transponder, but held off entering the send key. She let the spiral entertain her a bit with feeding her redundant exposition, but decided she had enough enough. She pressed the pressed the button and waited for contact with her ship, The Starship Cyanocus. Then someberry would be able to teleport her back to the ship. In reality Celestia, entered Luna’s phone number and just hit the send button.

***
On the Starship Cyanocus, Luna could hear her earth phone's ringtone. Luna had changed into her Blue-Berrien officer's outfit and the phone was in her human pants pocket. Luna was surprised the Ship Cyanocus could give phone reception.

“Didn’t realize the signal reached this far into space.” Luna said, “...Now comes the hard part.”

She hadn’t gotten used to her rounding body yet so trying to answer it took some careful reaching and rotating to grab her phone. She couldn’t see who was calling, but roughly guessed it must of been Celestia. At the last second before the phone went to voicemail, Lieutenant Captain Luna was able to answer her phone and set it to Speaker.

“Uh… Hello?”

“Good morning, Lieutenant. I would like to be beamed up please.”

“Sister!?” Luna said surprised.

That was definitely Celestia’s voice all right, and she called her Lieutenant. It seemed the Principal’s Blue-Berrien side had awoken as well. Luna didn't know how, since Celestia wasn't abducted like her.

“Are you alright?” Luna asked.

“Never juicier Luna." Celestia replied politely, "Are you going to beam up or not?”

Still, an order is still an order. With a mental command, Luna used her Visor Berry to access the Cyanocus’s Computer systems. After running a diagnostic, the ship’s teleportation system were in working order.

“Alright captain,” Lieutenant Captain Luna replied, “The system says the teleporters are functioning, but it might take a while.”

15332221223211112212.content: ""It just doesn't make any sense!" SciTwi moaned as read over the terminal on the DNA reader. For the past 20 minutes she had put in Celestia's readout and ran it again to try and check for errors. Every time she did however, the printout returned in the exact same condition as before. "This just can't be possible! Something has to be clogging the circuits or...artggh!" Sunset! "Thr purple girl turned her head to her partner, who currently had her head stuck in an open panel on the machine's backside. "How is everything over there?" "The calibration isn't off on the scanner, the energy levels are stable, and every bit of hardware is in perfect working order." "But that still doesn't explain this! I mean, I certainly haven't found any proof that aliens exist let alone blueberry ones! It just doesn't make any scientific sense...at....well current company excepted but that's different. There must some issue with the software we're not seeing." Sunset pulled her head from the panel, slamming it shut and turning to her friend. "Okay...let's see if we can think of some other way this could happen....." The gym fell silent as Sunset walked about, leaving SciTwi to continue her self rambling. "Okay...so we've tested this on ourselves right?" "Yes." "Now when I tested it, the machine showed not only my human DNA but my pony self as well right?" "Correct...where is this going?" "I'm getting to it, now you said that there was some kind of similarity between your readout and Celestia's." "Probably just the human components we share." "Exactly! Maybe there's something in your DNA that just threw the sensor a curve. I mean Celestia isn't magically enhanced like you or I so maybe the sensors flipped when they couldn't find it. We'll just dig through the readout and link the similarity and the computer should adapt." SciTwi smiled at the thought of getting this headache over with and pulled her printout from her pack. As the terminal accepted the copy, SciTwi put her finger to the board. "Just need to have the machine cross reference the two scans, searching and isolating all forms of the similarity....okay...now to process the full scan and we should get......" "Sunset chuckled to herself, it always was amusing whenever this girl got into 'the zone' like this. Probably similar to the Equestrian twilight as well. "What....th...Sunset...come have a look at this...." The two girls stared at the monitor, curious at what thru were seeing. It was a similar setup to Sunset's readout with having two different strands but now instead of the multicolored lines of pony dna, the girls were looking into fractured codes, pieces of foreign DNA being scrambled up and fitting into the human strand like a jigsaw. "What are we looking at exactly Twi?" As if to awsner her question, the machine slowly printed out a new sheet of paper. Bringing it to her face, Twilight read aloud. "Twilight Sparkle. Main DNA: Human, Untapped DNA:....Blueberry Alien...." "Untapped? What's that mean? It's the computers word for dormant.....call one of the girls over. We may need a little more testing....and tell them to bring some blueberries....I want to see how accurate this really is....." "You think we should inform Celestia?" "No....we aren't certain about anything yet. And besides, wether or not this is real there is no telling how well she would take this..."

153322212232111122122.content:
Sunset knew just where to go, the home EC room. She knocked on the door, and her friend Applejack answered

"Howdy Sunset." the farm girl answered.

"Hi AJ, Twilight and I need some help at the gym. We need you to bring some blueberries for us."

"Well uh, alright, ah can sure do that for yas." Applejack answered, confused by the Sunset's request.

Applejack was able to get herself excused from class and got herself a carton of blueberries. Once she arrived at the gym, Applejack gave the carton to Twilight, whose hands were nevrously shaking when holding.

"Are ya alright sugarcube?"

Twilight discovering she was an alien human hybrid was something the teen wasn't prepared for

"When we were collecting some samples, we discovered something really weird. It said the Principal was an alien."

"Alien!?"

Sunset replied and hopefully calming AJ down, "Uh... Yeah, we're thinking it's a bug involved, so we're collecting some sample data trying to figure things out. We just think it's exposure to some magic, wanna ."

"Well ok Sunset."

The farm girl into the machine, undergoing the same process Sunset, Twilight, and Prinicipal Celestia went. When the process was finished, Applejack got out, feeling rejuvenated.

"So what's mah results?" The farm teen asked.

The results were printed out as usual, Twilight read out loud, "Primary DNA human," but next part cause her dread to return, "Untapped DN... uh-oh!"

"Bl...Blueberry Alien!?"

"Uh... Sugar cube?" Not hearing what Sunset just said.

"It's just a glitch, It's just a glit..."

"Calm Down Twilight," Sunset said putting her hands on SciTwi's shoulders, "We're not going to figure out this if you keep panicking like this."

"I'm uh... fine," Sci Twi replied nervously, and after some deep breaths and staring at the readouts, "Okay, we discovered seems this Blueberry Alien DNA is maternal in nature."

"Maternal?" Applejack asked, getting out of the machine.

"It's something you get... from your mother." Twilight answered.

"Wait, ya'll's sayin mah mom's some alien blueberry woman!?" Applejack asked, shocked and confused.

"I-I-I-t's just a glitch Applejack. We... I uh mean, your mom can't be an alien! It's' just a glitch! It's just a glitch! It's just a..." Twilight tried to reasurre, but both Sunset and Applejack could tell SciTwi was clearly in denial about what her invention was revealing about herself and her friend, and what she had known about her life.

1533222122321111221223.content:
While Sunset was attempting attempting to bring SciTwi out of her new mental unrest, Applejack just stood with an eyebrow cocked. "Well it certainly ain't working right ah can tell ya Twi. Ah mean we've faced some crazy things in the past but blueberry aliens? Let alone mah mom being one? If ah was told this by anyone else ah would be so darn riled up....ah..." Applejack eyed the small blue trunk off to the side of the machine and stopped her sentence. While Sunset cradled SciTwi, AJ slowly walked towards the strangely captivating blue container. "Girls...where did yah'll get this thing?" "It was a hand me down from my parents. I keep some of my more bulky tools inside for easier storage." "Strange...mah mom had one....exactly....like this....."

"Big Mac! Where are yah ya big silly? This cellar's only so big. Ah'm gonna get ya one way or another." The little farm girl closed the door behind her as she crept down the stairs. There was no way she was gonna let him beat her at hide and seek again. "Come on now ya lug, show yerself!" Though slightly dark, the cellar gave off enough light that Applejack was able to make out the dirty blond color of her brother's hair. "Gotcha!" The girl said as she hugged her brother tightly, not noticing he wasn't moving an inch. "Sis....." AJ opened her eyes and looked to her normally soft spoken kin. His eyes were wide open and his mouth was likewise. AJ followed her brother's eyes until they came upon a fallen piece of cellar wall. Within the stones was a small blue trunk with no latch. Without a word, the two siblings walked to the trunk and opened it up. There wasn't much inside, some dried up fruits, possibly blueberries, some medicine type bottles barely legible, a scrap of paper with some unreadable figures on it and a dusty photograph with a few burnt edges. The two looked at the picture and saw a bunch of blue, rounded people saluting two at the front. "Hey Big Mac, don't that look a lot like Mama?" "Eeyup." "What's say? Blue...Blueberriean? When Mom and Dad come back from thier trip ah say we ask em about this."

"But they never did...." Applejack was now kneeling over the trunk with tears in her eyes. "Ah guess the shock of it overtook our knowledge of that....but...ah know it's still at the house.....and those two in the front....they almost looked like......sweet berrys....."

15332221223211112212232.content:
"... The Principals!" Applejack said.

"Are you sure about?" Sunset asked.

"Granted, ah might need a second look that photo, but ah know it. One of them had uh green eyes, blue and violet hair..."

"Gee that sounds Vice Prinicpal Luna." Pinkie said, getting out of the DNA reader machine.

"Pinkie!? when did you get here?" SciTwi asked startled.

"You and Sunset were having so much fun, so I snuck in and tried it out myself when you were having that flashback." Pinkie answered.

The machine console had printed out Pinkie's results.

"Pinkamina Diane Pie" Sunset quietly read to herself, "Primary DNA: Human, Untapped DNA: Blueberry Alien."

Sunset sighed, she discovered now three of her friends had those blueberry alien genes. Sunset Shimmer could tell this would be the start of a big revelation.

***

Back on the Starship Cyanocus, The sisters Celestia and Luna were reunited.

"How do I look sister?" Celestia asked, swaying her large exercise ball sized belly side to side.

"Gorgeous Captain." Luna replied, smiling at the sight of her swelling sister.

Thanks to the magic from Twilight's invention, Principal Celestia had remembered and accepted her alien past faster then her sister. Her skin was back to a blue color, and her stomach has resumed production of juice. Luna had finished her growth was now a proper shape, a round blueberry with her head, hands, and feet sticking out. Both of them changed out of their earth clothes and back into their officers' uniforms. Celestia's outfit was blue and silver like her sister's, but the captain's Blue-Berrien clothes had sun emblems instead of moon emblems. However thier mirth was soon interrupted when the bridge's computer started beeping peculiarly and the two of them remembered what that meant.

"A signal from Blue-Berriea!?" Luna noticed.

"Well, put it on your Visor Berry." Celestia replied.

Luna nodded, and with a command of her mind, a monitor flashed open from the Luna's helmet and revealed a blue-Berrien Captain Celestia recognized from the flashback. She had Blue eyes, and pure blue hair, She was wearing a visor berry on her head

"This is Chairwoman Azuris of the Blue-Berrien Federation. We have answered your distress signal but The Blue-Berrien Federation has befell crisis of its own. One that has resulted in the large displacement of our people. While we weren't able to contact you in decades, we have sent fleet of transport ships to your planet as yours is the only Blue-Berrien colony that is unafflicted by the calamity. If you are watching this, then our probes have succesfully contracted the ship and have sent a retriever ship to summon you. In about 2 weeks, your colony will need extra infrastructre to be holding refugees. We have sent a shipment of repair drones, construction drones, and extra building material to assist development. Chairwoman Azuris signing off."

"I must of made an accidental distress signal on my last virtua diary entry." Luna said, quickly

"And the signal must of reached home."

"So what now captain?" Luna asked.

Celestia gave that some thought. They had technically accomplished thier mission in colonizing the planet, but it costed them thier Blue-Berrien identity. The crew were living thinking they were human. They had jobs and families. In fact most of them had kids. However just juicing themselves and act like nothing happened was offically out of the question, because soon Earth will be having its first contract with alien life.

"You want the truth to come out don't you?" Celestia asked

"As much as you do captain," Luna answered, "but we can't just waltz down and announce we and a majority of Canterlot's females are aliens."

"True Lieutentant, if anyone found people they've grown up with are aliens they would freak... Uh-oh, Twilight's invention!"

"Invention?" Luna asked.

"Her invention is what restored me. It's a DNA reader that uses magic ," Celestia answered, noticing the irony concerning her past view on magic, "I have the feeling she found out our hertitage. It's going to be only a matter of time before she discovers the truth and I'm afraid the poor girl is going to have a panic attack."

Sunset sighed as she finally turned away from the console. "First things first...there is someone we have to tell this to...." Twilight, while still rocking back and forth, nodded solemnly. "We had rested this on Celestia and she deserves to know what was on her form. Hopefully some adult wisdom will help us figure out what to do next." "Where is Celestia anyway? None of us have seen her or Luna at all today." While the girls continued thier conversation, Applejack looked to herself. The Humane 7 walked their way to Principal Celestia's office. Applejack knocked on the door.

When AJ opened the door to the office, the seven girls (one human/pony, six human/alien) discovered Principal Celestia was absent. Everything in her office was untouched unmoved from the time she got in the office to when Luna beamed her up.

"She was here this morning, when we when we got her sample." Sci Twi said anxiously, hands on the side.

"Her phone and belongings her are still here." Rarity observed. "She couldn't be far."

"Yeah, but nobody saw her leave." Fluttershy added.

"Gee Louise on a bed of peas, it's a dead end." Pinkie Pie lamented.

There was silence for a moment until Applejack spoke up.

"We still got a lead y'all: mah mom's trunk. We can open it up and try to find out about our alien mothers from there." Applejack said.

"Yeah, we can meet up there after school." Sunset Shimmer replied, "Plus Twilight could probably use some fresh air."

The rest of girls agreed, and left the office, off to attend their final classes for the day. The during said classes, Sunset's friends were just as nervous Twilight as questions kept racing through minds. what was the aliens intents, what were they really like, and would they themselves end like in that photo Applejack described: large, blue, and rounded?

Come over here get a minute would ya?" As RD walked over to her friend, Sunset thanked herself for remembering to turn off and cover the DNA reader before leaving. Poor Twilight might be upset but she wasn't gonna chance anyone stealing thier project....even if it was becoming the center of a mass conspiracy. "How exactly can you understand that alien language dear?" Rarity asked.

"I just used some translating magic to read it." Sci Twi replied digging through the luggage. “Ah-Ha! Here it is!”

Twilight then pulled out a screen the size of a tablet.

“What in tarnation is that?” Applejack asked.

“The papers were a colonist field manual,” Sci Twi answered. “The contents were issued to them, fruits for planting, medicines to boost immunities to any planet navitive diseases, and this..”

Twilight activated the tablet. It took a while for tablet to load. In the meantime Pinkie, Rarity, and Fluttershy were busying looking at the photograph. The two berries in front were definately Celestia and Luna, no doubt about that, but Rarity quietly gasped at another sight in the photo. One Blue-Berrien looked very much like her mother. The alien in question was blue skinned and rounded like the rest of them, but that alien had her mother’s face, her mother's eyes, and her mother's violet hair in a very similar hairstyle. Pinkie and Fluttershy could also see their moms in that photo when Rarity passed it to them. When Sunset Shimmer got the photograph, she could identify a few other women like Miss Cheerilee and Mrs. Cake in the crowd of blueberry aliens as well.

“Okay the tablet has booted up,” Sci Twi said, “So lets see here… Wow, way too much to go over. Oh! this one looks promising, *ahem* Blue-Berrien Human Genetic Compatibility by Doctor...” The research paper was only document not written in alien characters and in fact was written by Applejack’s mother. The farm girl noticed the date, it was only months before she and her brother discovered that box. Tears started to form into AJ’s green eyes again.

“Girls... Look ah know yall want to help, but… look, ah want find this out on mah own.”

Applejack’s friends had to respect the farmgirl’s wish. The girls knew they couldn’t stay at Applejack’s place. There was still a science fair the girls had to attend. The girls (with SciTwi still in possession of the tablet) went back to Canterlot High with the exception of Rainbow Dash. Rainbow had the photograph with her when she came home, but she never got a good look at it. The first thing Rainbow did was take a quick shower to clean herself. Sunset Shimmer had caught up to her when gym class was finishing up and asked to come to the gym immediately, preventing RD from cleaning her after an intense track session. Rainbow brought some extra clothes with into the bathroom and she changed into them when she got out of the shower. When the athlete left the bathroom, Rainbow noticed her mom looking at the photo.

“Oh hi Rainbow! I was just looking over your things. They just smelt so much like….” She answered, pausing to realize it was very familiar.

“Mom?” Rainbow asked worriedly, seeing her mother’s face to begin to turn blue.

"Something wrong Twilight?" Sunset Shimmer asked.

"Yeah, I should of left this at Applejack's." SciTwi replied, referring to the tablet.

Science Fair wasn't going to be open in a while so the two of them, plus Rarity, Pinkie, and Fluttershy were near Sunset Shimmer's locker instead. It would be a while before Sunset and Twilight would have to present their project. The girls were nervous over what was discovered the principals, women they trusted, even their mothers were blueberry alien women, The girls (minus Sunset Shimmer) were Human/ Blueberry Alien hybrids. Twilight was busy fidgeting the tablet's main menu with her index finger. Sunset was getting documents sorted out for the speech she had made for this occasion. Pinkie Pie was keeping watch, Rarity was tending her make-up, and Fluttershy was trying to call Rainbow Dash.

"Rainbow hasn't been answering her phone." Fluttershy said worryingly.

"Yeah your right," Pinkie replied checking her phone to see Dash responded to her texts, "I hope the talent agents haven't abducted her."

Rarity decided that a subject change was in order to hopefully calm everyone down.

"What do think taking them so long to start the science fair?" the fashionista asked.

"Principal Celestia was going to judge, but since she's missing, they've been scrambling to find a substitute." Sci-Twi answered.

"Are you able to go the gym?" Flutters asked.

"Well, that's where we're going next. We need to do some last minute adjustments to the DNA reader." Sunset said.

Before Sunset closed her locker, she let Twilight put the tablet into Sunset's locker. SciTwi accidentally ended up pressing a button on the alien device that caused the tablet to emit a tracking signal.

***
Back on the Cyanocus, Celestia and Luna were going over the supply shipments Chairwoman Azuris had delivered to their ship when Luna's visor berry notified her of something.

"Captain, the ship is receiving a Blue-Berrien tracking signal," Lieutenant Captain Luna said and she gasped when noticed the signal's origin, "and it's coming from Canterlot High!"

Captain Celestia paused as her swelling arms and legs were in the middle of being absorbed into spherical body, "Right, I was going to be judging the Science Fair tonight. Well I can't go down like this. Lieutenant, you're going to have to go in my place, the blue-berrien skin tone we have is closer to your previous skin tone when we thought we were humans."

"I'll take it I'll have to juice myself?" Lieutenant Captain Luna asked.

"Correct Lieutenant, The ship's juicers are repaired again. Be on the lookout for any Blue-Berriens awakening. Because of Twilight and Sunset's machine, I have a feeling a mass awakening of Blue-Berriens crew will happen tonight. And... you are going to have to be the one that reveal the presence of the Blue-Berriens. But do that once the staff awakens."

"I understand Captain." Luna saluted her sister the traditional Blue-Berrien way, raising her hands up 90 degrees and bowing her spherical body slightly forward.

"Best of luck to you, Sister." Celestia encouraged her sister and subordinate as the latter rolled herself out of the bridge and into ship's juicing room. Celestia turned her round body to look at the signal displayed on large monitor.

15332221223211112212232121111.content:
Luna shivered as her rotund body slowly shrank down, though whether it was from the actual shrinking itself or the fear of what she was about to undergo was hard to tell. As the metallic hands ceased thier tense squeezing and the output pipeline retracted back into the tank however, Luna knew she had to keep calm. After readjusting to walking on her feet, Luna headed out of the juicing room.

Celestia watched as her second in command's locator in her suit showed on the monitor heading down towards Earth. "It wouldn't take a Blueberrien psychologist to suspect a certain group of girls are responsible for the tracking signal. Knowing Twilight and her friends, they must be the already in a panic. But this world is so accepting of magic than certainly my sister shouldn't have....too much trouble." Despite her optimism, a stern look stayed on the blue captain's face as her sister touched down on the planet they once knew as thier only home.

As Luna walked by the reflective lockers, she noticed she was still wearing her outfit. "No matter..." she mumbled to herself, "...the students will no doubt mistake it for a costume to fit the science fair idea. Now...sister said that the staff will need to be returned to thier Blueberrien glory before I am to inform the student body. How should I go about this little issue? Celestia had said that it was Twilight and Sunset's DNA machine that had awakened her genes, but I doubt I can just have the staff line up. No...there has to be another way...." As Luna continued her thoughts, it was becoming clear the girls were going to need to understand ahead of time. The other students would know just as Celestia described but......no....the Captain's orders were absolute. There had to be some way to do this. The Science Fair wasn't supposed to open up for awhile and if Luna guessed right, the DNA reader would be the only invention here early. "Perhaps if the process is triggered by the power of the device, I could find a way to make it create a wave of energy. No....it wouldn't work. Mechanics never were my strong suit on the Starship.....but something must be done....."

Before Lieutenant Luna could make a decision she a scream from behind her. She turned her head to see Rainbow Dash sprint past her in sheer panic, too fast for Luna to get the tomboy's attention. The alien Lieutenant could only look at the direction Rainbow was running from, the school's entrance. When Luna approaches the entrance, she saw Windy Whistles, Rainbow's mother, was at the entrance. Her skin complexion bluer than normal, and sporting a growing belly. It appeared that Windy Whistles had regained her Blue-Berrien side as well.

"Evening, Lieutenant Captain!" Whistles said, confirming she was an awakened Blue-Berrien.

"Evening to yourself, Ms. Whistles. It's nice to see one of the Space Force's finest pilots. How did you" Luna asked

"My daughter came home with the commerative photo for the colonization mission," She answered, taking a photo out of her coat pocket and gave to Luna, "Just one look and smell of it and everything started rushing back. I was going to show my daughter how awesome Blue-Berriens are but she ran off screaming."

Luna realized that had happened to her as well. Being back on the Cyanocus, the sight and smell of the ship reawakened her true heritage with her abduction fears slowing the recovery process. Luna told Windy everything that has happened to her, Celestia, and what happened to their home planet of Blue-Berriea.

"...We haven't got enough details about what but what we do know is that in two weeks, fleets of Blue-Berriens will be arriving here seeking refuge. The captain does plan on revealing the truth to Canterlot but she wants the crew reawakened first."

"I see, anything I can do to help Lieutenant Captain?"

"Hmmm, I can't think of anything at the moment. So just... stay hidden and keep watch..."

Windy Whistles saluted her officer and got into position. Luna soon made her way to Celestia's office, knowing her the school keys stored there.

153322212232111122122321211112223.content:
As the situation over in Canterlot High was beginning to develop further and further for the worse, Applejack was still at home digging through the contents of her alien mother's locker. Having found the visor berry and a separate version of her mother's research notes, Applejack couldn't stop herself from pouring over the information.

....integrating into the family itself was rather easy. While the very act of hiding my true colors and nature from most of the town was difficult, repeated exposure to a very specific sequence of my DNA through modified aromatherapy candles created an accepting effect from this family itself. They said they would only let me stay for a few days to repay the damages my crashed 'car' caused, but within a week I was the daughter they never realized they had. I knew they would fall for it, the family seemed so large that it would be easy for members to be forgotten. Even now, I cannot deny the guilt of dishonesty sickens me but there really was no other choice. Most of other crew members have either vanished right out of existence or were messed up mentally that they can't even remember who they are. I was heart broken when my daughter Applejack came in and told me about her new principal and vice principal. The greatest commanders of the Blueberrien Space Force reduced to school leaders, so unbecoming. Speaking of my children, I find it rather curious how they do not appear to show any signs of their Blueberrien heritage. I suppose it must be because I had spent so many years repressing mine. I had taken a small sample from each of them while they were sleeping and thankfully found there was still some form of my DNA inside them, but how to let it out I have no idea. Especially from Macintosh, a male Blueberrien is almost unheard of. My biggest fear however is what the public will do to them or me if the secret ever gets out of hand. These humans, even with their cultures being more intelligent than first expected, are still vastly primitive when compared to my glorious home planet. Even worse, they seem to fight amongst one another daily purely being of differences in appearance. I pray that someday this from of issue will be lessened long enough for our kin to be accepted, but I fear it is only a prayer. While again the very idea of dishonesty and lying go against all my moral standings, it would seem I must be given no choice. For the past few days, I have been developing a weapon gun device with the rather simple materials found around my family's farm plus some scrap I kept from my old escape pod. It will blast out a smoke similar to the aromatherapy candles I used once before, but this time a more concentrated and pressurized gas. While testing is yet to be completed, it's initial purpose is planned to be to put the humans into a dazed state and making them susceptible to the words of Blueberriens. Plus, there may be the chance that exposure to their native DNA will reform my former crewmates back to their true forms. If any of my old crewmates or more likely my family are reading this in the event of my continued absence or worse, my lab is in the cellar under the boxes near where you found my trunk. If it is indeed my family, please understand that I was afraid of what would become of me would the truth ever be revealed. If you think less me, I will not blame you and instead blame myself. All I ask is that you do what you believe is right for yourself, your family and your kind....whichever side of you that you decide.

Staying silent but her eyes showing fear all thier own, Applejack ran down into the cellar. It didn't take her long to find the boxes, sure enough one of them was hiding a secret panel with a button behind it. One press was all it took and a large section of the cellar walls opened up to a blue corridor. "Mah....." As the country teen walked through the fruity scented hallways, her mind began thinking over every secnario should the truth be revealed. Sure maybe the school would be fine considering the constant magic events happening but wht about the rest of the town? Once word of the incident at the theater got out, the place was closed down for a serious investigation. Guys in dark coats and bullet proof vests, all carrying heavy looking weapons.....there was no way any peace was going to be hand under any circumstances. The metal doors slid open, revealing a small lab that would make SciTwi blush in suprise. In the center, sitting in a glass case, was a large canister connected to several large nozzles almost like a bug sprayer. As AJ stepped towards her mother's work, she began to shake. There was no way lying was going to get her and the girls out of the current situation they were in, and it seemed like the truth by itself wasn't going to hurt any less. She opened up the case and put her hand on the central nozzle, gripping the trigger as she pulled it slowly to her face. The uncertainty of the situation was finally reaching her....AJ had to make a choice.........
......
......
......a small click sounded as she squeezed the trigger.
153322212232111122122321211112223.title: A Juicy Find......sigh....

Captain Celestia is able to make contact Chairwoman Azuris.
1533222122321111221223212111122231.content:
Applejack decided to embrace the truth as the blueberry gas blasted out of her mother's invention and into her face. The farmgirl inhaled as much of it as she could through her nostrils and mouth. Afterwards, AJ wiped the dust off a nearby mirror. In her reflection, Applejack could see her face quickly becoming a blueberry-like shade of blue and was starting to spread to her neck and down to the rest of her body. She smiled as the color just felt right. She then felt her body begin production of juice as her stomach began growing, pushing her abdomen outward. AJ felt what she guess was juice her mom mentioned in her paper was beginning to fill her body.

         Applejack then noticed some round clothing, blue and silver and figured it must be what mom wore when she came to Earth. The alien hybrid went behind one of the canister to change. She took off her country attire and changed into the space spandex. The suit fit Applejack like a glove despite the teen’s stomach blowing up to bigger than a beach ball and still growing. Applejack was able to strap the blueberry device on to her back, wrist, and her bulging waistline. Lastly, AJ took her Stetson off briefly, and put the Visor Berry on. The alien helmet briefly sent a pang into her skull but the pain only lasted for a hundredth of a second. Applejack could tell her arms and legs were beginning to fill up as she put her hat back on top of the visor berry. AJ took another look at her reflection, and developed the feeling her mother would of been proud of her. She knew what had to next: the truth will come out tonight, and the world would know about the existence of the Blue-berriens. Applejack then turned around but saw her younger sister Apple Bloom at the entrance.

         “Applejack!? What goin’ on? What’s happening to you!?” Apple Bloom asked, worried and confused.

         "Don’t worry Sis, Ah’m just fine," Applejack said, gathering her courage and putting a blue hand on her younger sister's shoulder, "It's time we learned the truth. It’s about mom, she’s… an alien.”
1533222122321111221223212111122231.title: AJ begins her transformation to her true form

The other mane 6 hear rumors of their parents becoming blueberries
15332221223211112212232121111222311.content:
Applebloom's face showed no clear emotion, at the very least a strange mix between confusion and disbelief. Applejack sighed, realizing she was going to have to explain everything to Applebloom. Setting thier mother's work down, Applejack told her sister everything she knew about this situation. Everything from the principals disappearing to the DNA machine to finding moms trunk and finally to this. As AN would have guessed, Applebloom found it a little hard to believe, questioning it only a moment or two and holding her breath once to see if she was dreaming. "...and ah found this all here. Sis this stuff has been here get longer than any of us realize and ah...ah just wanted to let the truth out fer me. Now ah know her gonna think differently about a lot of things but I can assure Yah'll of this: alien, human or whatever, our mama loved all her children the same. An yer still mah sister, that don't change fee nothin. However ah can think of pleanty of folks that are gonna freak out once this truth gets out. " Applebloom looked to her billowing sister and closed her eyes, seemingly think over what to say. "Applejack....all may life ah wanted to be like our mom...at least what ah thought was her. With only stories from granny about her, ah needed someone to follow physically. From everything ah'd learned, ah guess ah always followed you and her probably the most honest person a ever met. If Yah'll say this is our fate then ah believe yah..." Applebloom stood straight and held her face out. "....give me the gas Sis, ah'm ready to be what mah momma wanted me to be. "Applejack could help but smile at the trusting loyalty of her sister as she picked up the gasser and shot a big puff into Applblooms face. Already the visor berry was picking up the blueberrien DNA within Applebloom overshadowing her human DNA. From all of the commotion, a small buzzing came from Applejack's discarded pants. "Mah phone!" Applejack saddled over to her phone and opened it up to see Fluttershy was calling her....for the tenth time. As AJ loomed to her arms however, there was no telling how long she was able to hold the phone. Sensing this delema, the visor berry took to work scanning the 'primitive' device and quickly added the connection to its list. AJ sighed as she mentally awsnered.

"Applejack! Thank everything you've picked up! What have you been doing all this time? I've been...Pinkie!" "Sorry Flutters, this has got to be fast. AJ, whatever you think you're doing stop doing it and get ice here right now. Flutters and I are at the school and trouble is beginning to really brew up here. Luna is here and she's spreading some chemical through the school that's turning the faculty blue. We've followed them to Luna's office....which is a lot bigger than I remember I could swear this was smaller. Anyways thier having some kind of meeting here and Rainbow's mother is a blueberry now so just get over here!" Applejack couldn't get a word in as the connection gave out. All this moment did was simply reinforce her fears. If even her friends, who based so much on friendship could be afraid, then the commoner was going to be even worse. "Applebloom, ah think there's a spare suit in here somewhere. We've got a science fair to hit."
